Sense.DEF: the 14th letter of the English alphabet
Sense.TRAN: 英语字母表的第十四个字母

Sense.DEF: used in mathematics to represent a number whose value is not known
Sense.EXAMPLE: The value of n is less than 10.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: n的值小于10。

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= north or 或 northern 北；北方(的)﹔朝北(的)
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= noun 名词
a short form of 缩略式= ‘and’
Sense.EXAMPLE: rock ’n’ roll
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 摇滚乐
Sense.EXAMPLE: fish ’n’ chips
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 炸鱼薯条

Sense.DEF: written on a form to show that you do not need to answer a question
Sense.TRAN: 不适用〔写在表格中表示某项无需填写〕

Sense.DEF: another spelling of nan2
to catch or arrest someone who is doing something wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police nabbed him for speeding.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他超速行驶被警察逮住。

Sense.DEF: to get something or someone quickly, especially before anyone else can get them
Sense.EXAMPLE: See if you can nab a seat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你能否抢到一个座位。

Sense.DEF: Mexican food consisting of small pieces of tortillas covered with cheese, beans etc
Sense.TRAN: 干酪玉米片〔墨西哥食物〕

Sense.DEF: the time when a situation is at its worst
Sense.EXAMPLE: By 1932, the depression had reached its nadir.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到1932年﹐经济大萧条到了最严重的程度。

Sense.DEF: something that is naff seems silly, especially because it is unfashionable or shows a lack of good taste
Sense.EXAMPLE: a really naff film
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部蹩脚透顶的电影
Sense.EXAMPLE: Babur says the uniform makes him look naff.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 巴布尔说他穿上那套制服看上去傻透了。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone rudely to go away
to keep asking someone to do something, or to keep complaining to someone about their behaviour, in an annoying way
Sense.TRAN: 跟…纠缠不休﹔唠叨﹔不停地抱怨
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop nagging!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你别再唠叨了！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Nadia’s been nagging me to fix the lamp.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳迪亚一直唠叨着要我修那盏灯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She keeps nagging me about my weight.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是在我耳边唠叨我的体重。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He’s always nagging at Paula for wearing too much makeup.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他老是抱怨葆拉化妆太浓。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel continuously worried or uncomfortable

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a problem that had been nagging at him for days
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经困扰他多日的一个问题

Sense.EXAMPLE: One question still nagged me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个问题仍然困扰着我。

Sense.DEF: a person who keeps complaining or asking someone to do something, in an annoying way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be such a nag!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别总是唠唠叨叨的！

Sense.DEF: a horse, especially one that is old or in bad condition
making you worry or feel pain slightly all the time
Sense.TRAN: 无法摆脱的﹔烦人的﹔让人头痛的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was still a nagging doubt in the back of her mind.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的内心深处仍然有一个无法摆脱的疑惑。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Lee had a nagging pain in her back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 李背痛一直不好。

Sense.DEF: always complaining
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nagging wife
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一味抱怨的妻子

Sense.DEF: no
a thin pointed piece of metal with a flat top, which you hit into a surface with a hammer, for example to join things together or to hang something on
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key was hanging on a nail by the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙挂在门边的一颗钉子上。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hammered a nail into the wall.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她往墙上敲进一颗钉子。

Sense.DEF: your nails are the hard smooth layers on the ends of your fingers and toes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve broken my nail.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弄断了指甲。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stop biting your nails!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别咬指甲！
Sense.EXAMPLE: She sat painting her nailsputting a coloured substance on them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她坐着涂指甲油。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He still had dirt under his nails.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的指甲里还有脏东西。

Sense.DEF: one of several bad things which help to destroy someone’s success or hopes
Sense.TRAN: 导致某人/某事物失败的因素
Sense.EXAMPLE: Observers fear that this strike will be another nail in the coffin of the industry.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 观察家担心这次罢工将是对该行业的又一次致命打击。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the final nail in his coffin
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的催命符

Sense.DEF: very tough and not easily frightened, or not caring about the effects of your actions on other people
Sense.TRAN: 铁石心肠的﹐冷酷无情的﹔非常坚强的

Subsense.DEF: if you pay money on the nail, you pay it immediately
completely correct
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They got it absolutely on the nail.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们完全正确。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: hit the nail on the head

PIC.HEADING: NAIL 指甲﹐趾甲
PIC.PICCONTENT: nail clippers 指甲刀[钳]；manicure kit 美甲用具；nail file 指甲锉；nail polish 指甲油；nailbrush 指甲刷

Sense.DEF: to fasten something to something else with nails

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A sign saying ‘No Fishing’ had been nailed to the tree.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 树上钉着一块写有“禁止钓鱼”的牌子。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The lid was firmly nailed down.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 盖子被钉得牢牢的。

GramExa.GLOSS: permanently close a window or door by fixing something across it using nails
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The windows had been nailed up.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 窗户被封死了。

Sense.DEF: to catch someone and prove that they are guilty of a crime or something bad
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took us 10 years to nail the guy who killed our daughter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们花了十年时间﹐终于将杀害我们女儿的那个家伙绳之以法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The state police finally nailed him for fraud.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 州警方最终以诈骗罪逮捕了他。

Sense.DEF: if you nail something, you succeed in getting it, after a lot of time or effort
Sense.TRAN: 〔花费很多时间或精力而〕得到
Sense.EXAMPLE: She finally nailed her dream job.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于找到了理想的工作。

Sense.DEF: to prove that what someone has said is completely untrue

Sense.LEXUNIT: nail your colours to the mast
Sense.DEF: to say clearly and publicly which ideas or which people you support
to punish someone severely
to reach a final and definite agreement or decision about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Two days isn’t enough time to nail down the details of an agreement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要把协议的所有细节都确定下来﹐两天的时间是不够的。

Sense.DEF: to force someone to say clearly what they want or what they intend to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Before they repair the car, nail them down to a price.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 修车前先让他们把价钱讲明白。

Sense.DEF: a very exciting story, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 非常刺激的故事[影片等]

Sense.DEF: extremely exciting because you do not know what is going to happen next
Sense.TRAN: 非常刺激的﹔充满悬念的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match went all the way to a nail-biting finish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 比赛一路进行下来﹐到了令人紧张的最后阶段。
Sense.EXAMPLE: some nail-biting moments near the end of the movie
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片接近尾声时一些扣人心弦的时刻

Sense.DEF: a small stiff brush for cleaning your fingernails
a special tool for cutting your nails neatly
a thin piece of metal with a rough surface used for making your nails a nice shape
a tool that uses air to shoot nails into wood
coloured or transparent liquid which you paint on your nails to make them look attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: pink nail polish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 粉红色指甲油

Sense.DEF: a shop where you can have your nails mademore attractive
a small pair of scissors for cutting your nails
not having much experience of how complicated life is, so that you trust people too much and believe that good things will always happen
Sense.TRAN: 无经验的﹐幼稚的﹐天真的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a naive young girl
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天真的小女孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim can be so naive sometimes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆有时候非常幼稚。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is naive to think/suppose/assume etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be naive to think that this could solve all the area’s problems straight away.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 认为这样就可以马上解决该地区的所有问题也太天真了。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I had naively imagined that he was in love with me.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我曾天真地以为他是爱着我的。

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes or not covered by clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The children ran naked through the yard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们光着身子跑过院子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a picture of a naked man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 裸体男子的照片
Sense.EXAMPLE: They found the body lying half naked in the grass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们发现尸体半裸着躺在草丛中。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The governor ordered the prisoner to be stripped naked and whipped.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 监狱长下令将那个犯人剥光衣服进行鞭笞。

GramExa.GLOSS: completely naked

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say that someone has nothing on or doesn’t have anything on rather than say they are naked.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们经常说一个人has nothing on或doesn’t have anything on﹐而不说is naked
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They ran through the yard with nothing on.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们光着身子跑过院子 。

Sense.DEF: if you can see something with the naked eye, you can see it without using anything to help you, such as a telescope

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The mite is just visible to the naked eye.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 螨虫用肉眼就可以看到。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Through his telescope he could see millions of stars that were invisible to the naked eye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通过望远镜他可以看见数以百万计肉眼看不见的星星。

Sense.DEF: weak and unable to protect yourself
Sense.TRAN: 缺乏保护的﹐无力自卫的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Standing in front on his first day of teaching, Brad felt completely naked.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执教的第一天站在学生面前﹐布拉德觉得手足无措。

Sense.DEF: truth, self-interest, aggression etc that is not hidden and is shocking
Sense.TRAN: 明摆着的事实/明显的私利/赤裸裸的侵略等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The President condemned the invasion as an act of naked aggression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统谴责这次入侵是赤裸裸的侵略行径。

Sense.DEF: a light, flame etc that is not enclosed by a cover
Sense.TRAN: 无罩灯/没有遮挡的火焰/无鞘剑等
Sense.EXAMPLE: A naked light bulb dangled from the ceiling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天花板上悬吊着一只光秃秃的灯泡。

Sense.DEF: too weak and gentle and not strict or tough enough
Sense.TRAN: 软弱无力的﹔优柔寡断的
Sense.EXAMPLE: For some people soccer has a reputation as a rather namby-pamby sport.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对有些人来说﹐足球是一项有点婆婆妈妈的运动。

Sense.DEF: what someone is called
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her name is Mandy Wilson.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的名字是曼迪•威尔逊。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s your name?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你叫什么名字？

GramExa.GLOSS: call something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He married a young lady by the name of Sarah Hunt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他娶了一位名叫萨拉．亨特的年轻姑娘。

GramExa.GLOSS: using a different name from your real name
GramExa.EXAMPLE: HH Munro wrote under the name Saki.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: HH.芒罗以笔名萨基从事写作。

Sense.DEF: what a thing, organization, or place is called
Sense.TRAN: 〔物体﹑机构或地方的〕名字﹐名称

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the name of the street?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条街叫什么名字？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The name of the company has changed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司的名称更改了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Edo was the ancient name for Tokyo.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 江户是东京的古称。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The flower’s common name name that is used by ordinary people, not its scientific name is forget-me-not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种花俗称勿忘我。

Sense.DEF: the opinion that people have about a person or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t want to do anything to damage the good name of the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不想做任何有损公司良好声誉的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The restaurant got a bad name for slow service.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家餐馆因为服务慢而名声不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They give the rest of the fans a bad name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们害其他的球迷背上骂名。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has a name for reliability.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家公司以信誉可靠闻名。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make your name/make a name for yourself
GramExa.GLOSS: become famous for something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He quickly made a name for himself in the Parisian art world.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很快就在巴黎的艺术界闯出了名气。

GramExa.GLOSS: prove that you did not do something bad or illegal

Sense.DEF: a person, company or product that is very famous or is known by many people
Sense.TRAN: 非常著名的人[公司﹐产品]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: some of the biggest names in show business
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 演艺界的一些大牌明星
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It made the company into a household name a very well known person or thing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这让该公司变得家喻户晓。

Sense.DEF: to use unpleasant words to describe someone in order to insult or upset them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The other kids used to call me names.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他孩子过去经常辱骂我。

GramExa.PROPFORM: call sb all the names under the sun
GramExa.GLOSS: use many unpleasant words

Sense.LEXUNIT: in sb’s name/in the name of sb

Subsense.DEF: if something is in someone’s name, it officially belongs to them or is for them to use
Subsense.TRAN: 属于某人﹔以某人的名义
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The house is in my husband’s name.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子归于我丈夫名下。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I’ve booked a table in the name of Steinmann.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以斯坦曼的名字订了餐位。

Subsense.DEF: as someone else’s official representative
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I claim this land in the name of the King!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我以国王的名义宣布拥有这块土地！

Sense.LEXUNIT: sth has sb’s name on it
Sense.DEF: something that seems to be appropriate for or deserved by a particular person
Sense.EXAMPLE: The match had England’s name on it they will win it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这场比赛英格兰队赢定了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in the name of religion/freedom/science etc
Sense.DEF: using religion, freedom etc as the reason why something is done – used especially when you disapprove of what someone is doing
Sense.TRAN: 以宗教/自由/科学等为名〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: cruel experiments on animals carried out in the name of science
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以科学为名进行的残酷的动物实验
Sense.EXAMPLE: the things people do in the name of love
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们以爱的名义所做之事

Sense.DEF: to have or own something – used to emphasize that someone has very little or a lot of something
Sense.TRAN: 拥有某物〔用于强调所有物很少或很多〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He died without a penny to his name very poor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死时身无分文。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He didn’t have a qualification to his name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一点资历都没有。

Sense.DEF: the most important thing in a particular activity or situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔某活动或情况〕最为重要的方面
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quality, that’s the name of the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 质量是关键。

Sense.LEXUNIT: cannot put a name to sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is not able to say what something is called
Sense.EXAMPLE: I know the tune but I can’t put a name to it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道这曲调﹐但说不出曲名来。

Sense.DEF: to talk about someone without showing respect for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: How dare you take the Lord’s name in vain swear using a word such as ‘God’ or ‘Jesus’?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你怎么敢亵渎上帝之名？

Sense.DEF: if a situation exists in name only, it does not really exist even though officially people say it does
Sense.TRAN: 只是在名义上﹐有名无实
Sense.EXAMPLE: a democracy in name only
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有名无实的民主制度
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was president in name only.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是名义上的总统。

Sense.DEF: if something is true in all but name, it is really true, even though people do not officially say that it is true
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was his wife in all but name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她虽无名分﹐但事实上就是他的妻子。

Sense.DEF: used to say that people are angry with someone because of something he or she has done – used especially humorously
Sense.TRAN: 某人臭名昭著〔尤为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If anything goes wrong, your name will be mud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是出了什么问题﹐你的名声就毁了。

Crossrefto.REFLEX: drag sb's name through the mud

Collocate.EXAMPLE: All their children have French names.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们所有孩子都有法语名字。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They gave their children unusual names.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们给孩子们取了古怪的名字。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell people that you have a particular name
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She may be using a false name.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能使用化名。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: choose to have a new name
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Are you going to take your husband’s name when you get married?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你打算结婚后改用夫姓吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Many immigrants changed their names to seem more American.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多移民为了显得更像美国人而改了姓名。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell someone your name, especially someone in an official position
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I gave my name to the receptionist.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向接待员通报了姓名。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His first name is Tom, but I don’t know his last name.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叫汤姆﹐但我不知道他姓什么。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say their name when speaking to them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I didn’t know him well enough to use his first name.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他还没有熟悉到可以直呼其名的程度。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say someone’s name loudly, to get their attention
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He called Jean’s name, but there was no answer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他叫了琼的名字﹐但是没有人应答。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sign your name here, please.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 请在这里签名。

Collocate.COLLOC: call sb by their first/full etc name
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use that name when you speak to them
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 用名字/全名等称呼某人
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone called him by his first name.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都对他直呼其名。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be called something by people, often when that is not your real name
Collocate.EXAMPLE: As he had long red hair, he went by the name of Red.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为他留着长长的红头发﹐大家便叫他“红发”。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: know their name
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The headteacher knew all the children by name.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 校长叫得出所有孩子的名字。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: use someone’s name when you see them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The waiter greeted him by name.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 服务员叫他名字和他打招呼。

Variant.LABELTRAN: 【尤美﹐正式】) the name chosen for you by your parent

Exponent.EXAMPLE: People usually call each other by their first name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们一般用名字称呼对方。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Please write your given name and your date of birth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请写上你的名字和出生日期。

Exponent.DEF: first name
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His Christian name was Joseph.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的教名是约瑟夫。

Exponent.DEF: the name that you share with your family or husband. Most English speakers would say last name. Surname sounds slightly formal.
Exponent.TRAN: 姓〔大多数人说last name﹐surname 较正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can I have your last name?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问您贵姓？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Johnson is a common English family name.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰逊是一个普通的英国姓氏

Exponent.DEF: the name between your first and last names
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Harry Potter’s middle name is James.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里·波特的中名是詹姆斯。

Exponent.DEF: your first name, middle name, and last name
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I need your full name and address.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要你的全名和地址。

Exponent.DEF: a woman’s family name before she married and began using her husband’s name
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My mother’s maiden name was Higgins.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我母亲婚前姓希金斯。

Exponent.DEF: a woman’s family name after she gets married, if she uses her husband’s name
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I don’t know what her married name is.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不知道她婚后姓什么。

Exponent.DEF: a name that people call you because of your appearance, personality etc, which is not your real name
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At school he was given the nickname ‘Shorty’.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在学校里被取了个外号叫“矮子”。

Exponent.DEF: a false name, especially one used by a criminal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He uses a number of aliases.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他使用许多化名。

Sense.DEF: to give someone or something a particular name

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We named our daughter Sarah.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们给女儿取名为萨拉。

GramExa.GLOSS: give someone or something the same name as another person or thing
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 以某人/某物的名字给某人/某物命名
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was named after his father.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 用他父亲的名字给他取了名。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The street is named after the famous South African leader, Nelson Mandela.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条街是以南非著名领袖纳尔逊．曼德拉的名字命名的。

GramExa.GLOSS: give something the same name as a person or thing
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 以某人/某物的名字给某物命名
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: The college is named for George Washington.
这所大学以乔治•华盛顿的名字命名。

GramExa.GLOSS: someone with a particular name
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 一个名叫…的男人/女人等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: some guy named Bob Dylan
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个名叫鲍勃•迪伦的人

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say someone or something is called something rather than named something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说某人或某物is called...﹐而不说is named...
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: He had a friend called Mick.

Sense.SIGNTRAN: 说出某人或某物的名字
Sense.DEF: to say what the name of someone or something is, especially officially
Sense.TRAN: 确认…的姓名﹐说出…的名字[名称]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two murder victims have yet to be named.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名凶案受害者的姓名有待确认。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The woman who was shot has been named as Mary Radcliff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被枪杀的女子经确认名叫玛丽•拉德克利夫。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She has secret information and is threatening to name names name the people who were involved in something, especially something bad or illegal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她掌握着秘密情报﹐并且威胁要说出相关人员的名字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’re a lot better than some airlines I could name.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们比我叫得上名字的一些航空公司要好得多。

GramExa.GLOSS: say publicly who is responsible for something illegal that has happened, or who has not achieved a particular standard

Sense.DEF: to officially choose someone or something, especially for an important job or prize

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The film was named best foreign film.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该电影被评为最佳外语片。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Quinn has been named as the new team manager.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 奎因被任命为球队的新任主教练。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Fitzgerald was named to the committee by the chairman.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 菲茨杰拉德被主席选入该委员会。

Sense.LEXUNIT: to name but a few/a handful/three etc
Sense.DEF: used after a short list of things or people to say that there are many more you could mention
used after a list of things to mean that there are many more you could mention
Sense.TRAN: 凡是你说得出的(应有尽有)！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clothes, books — you name it, they’ve got it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 服装﹑书籍——凡是你说得出的﹐他们都有！

Sense.DEF: to decide on a date for your wedding
to say how much you are willing to pay for something or sell something for
a popular and well-known product name
Sense.EXAMPLE: name-brand climbing gear
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名牌登山用具

Sense.DEF: when people use unpleasant words to describe someone in order to insult or upset them
Sense.EXAMPLE: playground teasing including name-calling
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 操场上的对骂嬉闹

Sense.DEF: to mention a particular product, person, business etc in something such as an advertisement or speech, or to mention them in order to thank them
Sense.TRAN: 〔在广告、演讲或鸣谢中〕提到...的名字

Sense.DEF: the day each year when people of some Christian religions celebrate the particular saint holy person whose name they have been given
Sense.TRAN: 命名日〔基督教会纪念某圣徒的日子〕

Sense.DEF: when someone mentions the name of a famous person they have met or have some connection with, in order to seen impressive to other people — used humorously or to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 拽人名〔提到见过或认识的名人以抬高自己的身价，幽默用法或含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn't want to be accused of name-dropping.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想被人指责拽人名。

Sense.DEF: used when you want to say that someone has done something wrong but without mentioning their name, especially to criticize them in a friendly way
Sense.TRAN: 不便透露姓名的〔尤指一种礼貌的批评方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A certain person, who shall remain nameless, forgot to lock the front door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某人忘了锁前门﹐名字我就不说了。

Sense.DEF: a nameless person is someone whose name is not known
Sense.EXAMPLE: the work of some nameless 13th-century writer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 某位13世纪无名作家的作品

Sense.DEF: a nameless thing does not have a name
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lay still in his nameless grave.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他安息在无名的墓冢里。

Sense.DEF: nameless emotions are very strong and difficult to describe in words
Sense.TRAN: 〔情感〕不可名状的﹐难以形容的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He managed to calm her nameless fears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他设法使她克服了难言的恐惧。

Sense.DEF: too terrible to name or describe
Sense.EXAMPLE: nameless horrors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 难以言表的恐惧

Sense.DEF: used when saying the names of the people or things you are referring to
Sense.EXAMPLE: Three students were mentioned, namely John, Sarah and Sylvia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有三名学生被提到﹐即约翰、萨拉和西尔维娅。

Sense.DEF: a small sign fastened to something, showing the name of the owner or maker, or the person who lives or works in a place
Sense.TRAN: 〔标明所有者或制作者的〕标示牌﹔〔写明居住者或工作者的〕姓名牌

Sense.DEF: another person, especially a more famous person, who has the same name as someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: Like his famous namesake, young Washington had a brave, adventurous spirit.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 像和他同名的那位名人一样﹐小华盛顿也有勇敢的冒险精神。

Sense.DEF: a small sign with your name on it that you wear
Sense.TRAN: 胸牌〔胸前佩戴的姓名牌〕

Sense.DEF: a small piece of cloth with your name on it that is sewn onto clothes, especially schoolchildren’s clothes
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指学童校服上的〕标有姓名的布条

Sense.DEF: grandmother – used by children
a type of bread made without yeast and eaten with Indian food
a woman whose job is to take care of the children in a family, usually in the family’s own home
Sense.TRAN: 〔一般在雇主家照看小孩的〕保姆
Sense.EXAMPLE: She found a job as a nanny with a wealthy Italian family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她找到一份工作﹐在一户有钱的意大利人家当保姆。

Sense.DEF: grandmother – used by children
a government which tries to control the lives of its citizens too much
Sense.TRAN: 保姆国家﹐保姆政府〔指过分干涉国民生活的政府〕

Sense.DEF: a female goat
one billionth part of a unit
Sense.EXAMPLE: nanometre a billionth of a metre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳米

Sense.DEF: in stories and films about the future, a machine that can move and perform jobs, but which is so small that it cannot be seen unless you use special equipment such as a microscope
Sense.TRAN: 〔关于未来的故事或电影中的〕微型机器人

Sense.DEF: a machine so small that its parts are made of single molecules. Scientists are trying to make nanomachines for use in medicine.
Sense.TRAN: 纳米机器﹐毫微级计算机〔科学家正试图制造这种机器应用于医学〕

Sense.DEF: the activity of putting information about a particular subject on a website, usually information sent by people who use the website regularly and are interested in the subject
Sense.TRAN: 纳米出版〔指定期在网站上发布专题信息的活动〕

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring time. There are a billion nanoseconds in a second.
a science which involves developing and making extremely small but very powerful machines
a short sleep, especially during the day

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I usually take a nap after lunch.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我午饭后通常要小睡一会儿。

Sense.EXAMPLE: an afternoon nap
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 午睡

Sense.DEF: the soft surface on some cloth and leather, made by brushing the short fine threads or hairs in one direction
to not be ready to deal with something when it happens, although you should be ready for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The German team were caught napping and Lampard scored the winning goal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁德国队一不留神﹐兰帕德攻入了制胜的一球。

Sense.DEF: to sleep for a short time during the day
a substance made from petrol that was used in bombs by US forces to burn fields and villages during the Vietnam war
Sense.TRAN: 〔美军在越战时所用燃烧弹中的〕凝固汽油

Sense.DEF: the bottom part of the back of your neck, where the hair ends
Sense.EXAMPLE: the soft warm nape of her neck
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那温软的后颈

Sense.DEF: a type of oil used for fuel or for making chemicals
Sense.TRAN: 萘〔用作燃料或化学品原料〕

Sense.DEF: a square piece of cloth or paper used for protecting your clothes and for cleaning your hands and lips during a meal
a sanitary pad
a small ring which a napkin can be kept in
a piece of soft cloth or paper worn by a baby between its legs and fastened around its waist to hold its liquid and solid waste
Sense.EXAMPLE: Excuse me while I change the baby’s nappy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐我给宝宝换一下尿布。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a dirty nappy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脏尿布

GramExa.GLOSS: nappies which are made to be used once and thrown away
sore skin caused by wet nappies

Sense.DEF: a former Internet service which allowed people to download songs for free. It was the first service of its kind. It was shut down by a court order in 1999.
Sense.TRAN: Napster 在线音乐服务〔过去的一项因特网服务﹐提供免费音乐下载﹐是同类中最早的服务﹐1999 年被法庭判决关闭〕

Sense.DEF: a police officer who deals with the problem of illegal drugs
to secretly tell the police about someone else’s criminal activities, especially activities involving illegal drugs
Sense.TRAN: 告密〔尤指向警方透露有关贩毒的情报〕

Sense.DEF: when someone is too concerned about their appearance or abilities or spends too much time admiring them – used to show disapproval
Sense.EXAMPLE: He went to the gym every day, driven purely by narcissism.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天都去健身房﹐纯粹出于自我欣赏。

Sense.DEF: a yellow or white spring flower, such as the daffodil
a medical condition which causes someone to keep falling asleep suddenly, without being able to prevent this
strong illegal drugs such as heroin or cocaine
Sense.EXAMPLE: the narcotics trade
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品交易

GramExa.GLOSS: a police officer who deals with the problems of narcotics

Sense.DEF: a type of drug which makes you sleep and reduces pain
relating to illegal drugs
Sense.EXAMPLE: narcotic addiction
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒瘾

Sense.DEF: a narcotic drug takes away pain or makes you sleep
someone who is friendly with criminals and who secretly tells the police about their activities
Sense.TRAN: 〔向警方提供情报的〕线人﹐密探﹐卧底

Sense.DEF: angry about something
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to get narked about it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要为此恼火！

Sense.DEF: to explain what is happening in a film or television programme as part of the film or programme
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wildlife film narrated by David Attenborough
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一部由大卫•艾登堡解说的野生动物影片

Sense.DEF: to tell a story by describing all the events in order, for example in a book
Sense.EXAMPLE: The main character narrates the story.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主人公讲述故事。

Sense.DEF: a spoken description or explanation which is given during a film, play etc
the act of telling a story
a description of events in a story, especially in a novel
Sense.EXAMPLE: At several points in the narrative the two stories cross.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 叙述中两条故事线多次交织在一起。

Sense.DEF: the process or skill of telling a story
the person who tells the story in a book or a play
the person who describes or explains what is happening in a film or television programme but who is not seen
Sense.TRAN: 〔电影或电视节目中的〕解说员﹐旁白员

Sense.DEF: measuring only a small distance from one side to the other, especially in relation to the length

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a long narrow road
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭长的道路
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the narrow passage between the cottage and the house
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小屋和房子间狭窄的通道
GramExa.EXAMPLE: his narrow bed
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的窄床

Sense.EXAMPLE: The stairs were very narrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 楼梯非常狭窄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a long, narrow band of cloud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窄长的云带

Sense.DEF: a situation in which you only just avoid danger, difficulties, or trouble
Sense.EXAMPLE: A woman had a narrow escape yesterday when her car left the road.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天一名女子驾车时冲出公路﹐险些丢了性命。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was shaken by his narrow escape from death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他死里逃生﹐吓得不轻。

Sense.DEF: a win etc that is only just achieved or happens by only a small amount
Sense.TRAN: 险胜/惜败/微弱多数/微小的差距等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The president won a narrow victory in the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统在竞选中险胜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He persuaded a narrow majority of the party to support the government.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说服了该党派中的微弱多数﹐让他们支持政府。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scotland eventually won the match by the narrow margin of 5-4.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰队最终以5比4的微弱优势获胜。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: The expression a narrow victory/defeat is used mostly in writing. In everyday British English, people often say that someone only just won/lost or, in everyday American English, barely won/lost.
F2NBox.TRAN: a narrow victory/defeat的说法主要用于书面。在日常英国英语中﹐人们经常说某人only just won/lost ﹐在日常美国英语中﹐人们经常说 barely won/lost 。

Sense.DEF: a narrow attitude or way of looking at a situation is too limited and does not consider enough possibilities
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got a very narrow view of life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的人生观非常狭隘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some teachers have a narrow vision of what art is.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些教师对于什么是艺术认识狭隘。

Sense.DEF: a meaning of a word that is exact or limited
Sense.EXAMPLE: I use the word ‘neighbour’ in its more precise or narrower sense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说的是较准确或较狭义的“邻居”。

Sense.DEF: limited in range or number of things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company offered only a narrow range of financial services.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司只提供有限种类的金融服务。

Sense.DEF: to make something narrower or to become narrower
Sense.EXAMPLE: He narrowed his eyes and gazed at the horizon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他眯起眼睛凝望着地平线。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The track divided into two and narrowed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小道分成两条并且变窄了。

Sense.DEF: if a range, difference etc narrows, or if something narrows it, it becomes less
Sense.EXAMPLE: The choice of goods available is narrowing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可供选择的商品越来越少。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economic gap between the two halves of the country was beginning to narrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国两个区域之间的经济差距开始缩小。

Sense.DEF: to reduce the number of things included in a range
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police have narrowed down their list of suspects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方已缩小了嫌疑人的范围。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I've narrowed it down to one of two people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经把范围缩小到两人之间选一人。

Sense.DEF: a long narrow boat for use on canals
a size of railway track of less than standard width
Sense.EXAMPLE: a narrow gauge railway
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 窄轨铁路

Sense.DEF: by only a small amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was narrowly defeated in the election.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在选举中以微弱差距败北。
Sense.EXAMPLE: One bullet struck his car, narrowly missing him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗子弹击中了他的汽车﹐差点打中他。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A man narrowly escaped death when a fire broke out in his home on Sunday morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 周日早晨一名男子家中起火﹐险些丧命。

Sense.DEF: in a limited way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The law is being interpreted too narrowly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该法律的诠释过于狭隘。
Sense.EXAMPLE: These big general issues should be broken down into more narrowly focused questions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些笼统的大问题应该被细分成若干个更具体的问题。

Sense.DEF: unwilling to accept or understand new or different ideas, opinions, or customs
Sense.TRAN: 心胸狭窄的﹐气量小的﹔不开放的﹔有偏见的
Sense.EXAMPLE: His attitude is narrow-minded and insensitive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的态度狭隘而冷漠。
Sense.EXAMPLE: narrow-minded nationalism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 狭隘的民族主义

Sense.DEF: a narrow area of water between two pieces of land which connects two larger areas of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are really three lakes, joined by narrows.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其实有三个湖泊﹐由峡道相连。

Sense.DEF: a narrow part of a river, lake etc
not one
Sense.EXAMPLE: They said nary a word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们一个字也没有说。

Sense.DEF: a US government organization that controls space travel and the scientific study of space
related to the nose
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nasal passage
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鼻腔

Sense.DEF: a sound or voice that is nasal comes mainly through your nose
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spoke in a high nasal voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说话鼻音很重。

Sense.DEF: a nasal consonant or vowel such as /n/ or /m/ is one that is produced completely or partly through your nose
a particular speech sound such as /m/, /n/, or /N/ that is made through your nose
coming into existence or starting to develop
Sense.TRAN: 初生的﹐新生的﹔开始发展的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the country’s nascent democracy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国新生的民主
Sense.EXAMPLE: their nascent industries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的新兴行业

Sense.DEF: the capital city of the state of Tennessee, US, famous as the centre of the country and western music industry
Sense.TRAN: 纳什维尔〔美国田纳西州首府﹐以作为乡村和西部音乐的中心而闻名〕

Sense.DEF: a garden plant with orange, yellow, or red flowers and circular leaves
nasty behaviour or remarks are extremely unkind and unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 不友善的﹔不好的﹔恶毒的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nasty temper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坏脾气
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nasty things that were being written about her
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们描述的那些关于她的坏事情
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s a nasty streak in her character.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她性格中有令人讨厌的一面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drivers often have a nasty habit of driving too close to cyclists.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机常有一个坏习惯﹐就是车开得离骑自行车的人太近。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so nasty to your mum do not treat her unkindly.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别对你妈妈这么凶。

GramExa.GLOSS: suddenly start behaving in a threatening way
GramExa.EXAMPLE: When Harry refused, Don turned nasty and went for him with both fists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 哈里拒绝后﹐唐翻了脸﹐挥动双拳向哈里扑去。

Sense.DEF: someone who is nasty behaves in an unkind and unpleasant way
Sense.TRAN: 不友好的﹔恶意的﹔令人不愉快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I went to school with him e_SEnD he was nasty then and he’s nasty now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我和他一起上过学他那时很讨厌﹐现在还是很讨厌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re a nasty little brute!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这个讨厌的小家伙！

Sense.DEF: a nasty experience, feeling, or situation is unpleasant

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It gave me a nasty shock.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这使我非常震惊。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I had a nasty feeling that a tragedy was going to happen.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有一种很不好的感觉﹐一场悲剧将要发生。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Life has a nasty habit of repeating itself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生活总是令人厌烦地重复着。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a nasty accident while riding in the forest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在森林中骑马时出了严重的事故。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When you feel you’ve been cheated, it always leaves a nasty taste in the mouth makes you feel upset or angry afterwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感觉自己被骗之后﹐心里总会留下很不好受的滋味。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The weather turned nasty towards the evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 傍晚时分天气变坏了。

Sense.DEF: having a bad appearance, smell, taste etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s that nasty smell?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是什么难闻的气味？
Sense.EXAMPLE: a market stall selling cheap and nasty watches
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卖廉价而难看的手表的集市摊位

Sense.DEF: severe or very painful
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nasty cut
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 严重的割伤
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was carried off the field with a nasty injury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他受了重伤被抬下场。

Sense.DEF: a nasty substance is dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: nasty chemicals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 危险的化学品

Sense.DEF: someone who is dishonest, violent, or likely to cause trouble
Sense.TRAN: 不诚实的人﹔凶暴的人﹔易惹麻烦的人

Sense.DEF: relating to birth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Green turtles return to their natal island to breed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绿毛龟回到牠们出生的岛上繁殖。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is exactly as you would expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What does he drive?’ ‘A BMW, natch.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他开什么车？”“当然是宝马。

Sense.DEF: a country, considered especially in relation to its people and its social or economic structure
Sense.EXAMPLE: the President’s radio broadcast to the nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统对全国的广播讲话
Sense.EXAMPLE: an independent nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 独立的国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: the world’s leading industrial nations
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上的主要工业国

Sense.DEF: a large group of people of the same race and language
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Cherokee nation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 切罗基族

Sense.DEF: related to a whole nation as opposed to any of its parts
Sense.EXAMPLE: Religion matters very much at a national level.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 宗教事务在全国都非常重要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Between 1929 and 1933 America’s national income fell by more than half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1929至1933年间﹐美国的国民收入下降过半。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are strong indications that the Prime Minister will call national elections in May.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有明显迹象预示首相将于5月召集全国大选。

Sense.DEF: relating to one particular nation as opposed to other nations
Sense.EXAMPLE: We refuse to sign any treaty that is against our national interests.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们拒绝签署任何违反本国利益的条约。

Sense.DEF: owned or controlled by the central government of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the National Institute for Space Research
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家空间技术研究院
Sense.EXAMPLE: the national airline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国营航空公司

Sense.DEF: someone who is a citizen of a particular country but is living in another country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Foreign nationalswere advised to leave the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外国侨民被劝离开该国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Turkish nationals who are living in the UK
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住在英国的土耳其侨民

Sense.DEF: the official song of a nation that is sung or played on public occasions
special clothing traditionally worn by the people of a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: folk dancers in national costume
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 身穿民族服装的民间舞蹈演员

Sense.DEF: the course of study that most students follow in England and Wales between the ages of 5 and 16
Sense.TRAN: 〔为英格兰和威尔士大多数5至16岁学生而设的〕全国统一课程

Sense.DEF: the total amount of money owed by the government of a country
Sense.EXAMPLE: The government taxed fuel highly in order to finance the national debt.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府为了偿付国债﹐征收很高的燃料税。

Sense.DEF: a US weekly tabloid newspaper known especially for its articles about the relationships of famous people and the things that they do
Sense.TRAN: 《国民问询报》〔美国小报﹐尤以刊登名人八卦新闻著称〕

Sense.DEF: the system of electricity lines across Britain
a military force in each state of the US which can be used when it is needed by the state or the US government
the state system for providing health care in Britain, paid for by taxes
a system organized by the British government in which workers and employers make regular payments, and which provides money for people who are unemployed, old, or ill
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国的〕国民保险制度 〔由英国政府经管的一项保险制度﹐雇主和雇员必须按时缴纳钱款﹐以帮助失业者﹑老年人或病人〕

Sense.DEF: a British spelling of nationalize
the desire by a group of people of the same race, origin, language etc to form an independent country
Sense.EXAMPLE: Scottish national­ism
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰民族主义

Sense.DEF: love for your own country and the belief that it is better than any other country
Sense.TRAN: 本国优越感﹔民族自豪感
Sense.EXAMPLE: Under his leadership, a strong sense of nationalism emerged.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在他的领导下﹐人们心中涌出强烈的民族自豪感。

Sense.DEF: a nationalist organization, party etc wants to gain or keep political independence for their country and people
Sense.TRAN: 国家主义的﹔民族主义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Scottish Nationalist Party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰民族党
Sense.EXAMPLE: the rise of the nationalist movement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民族主义运动的兴起

Sense.DEF: a nationalist organization or party believes that their country is the most important or the best
Sense.TRAN: 〔组织或党派〕怀有极度民族优越感的

Sense.DEF: someone who is involved in trying to gain or keep political independence for their country and people
Sense.TRAN: 国家主义者﹔民族主义者
Sense.EXAMPLE: Welsh nationalists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 威尔士民族主义者

Sense.DEF: someone who believes their country is best
Sense.TRAN: 怀有极度民族优越感者

Sense.DEF: someone who is nationalistic believes that their country is better than other countries
Sense.TRAN: 有民族[国家]主义情绪的﹔民族[国家]主义的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were encouraging nationalistic sentiment among the students.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在鼓动学生们的民族主义情绪。

Sense.DEF: the state of being legally a citizen of a particular country
Sense.EXAMPLE: people of the same nationality
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 同国籍的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has British nationality.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拥有英国国籍。

GramExa.GLOSS: the state of being a citizen of two countries

Sense.DEF: a large group of people with the same race, origin, language etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: the different nationalities within the former USSR
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 前苏联的各个民族

Sense.DEF: if a government nationalizes a very large industry such as water, gas, or the railways, it buys it or takes control of it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British government nationalized the railways in 1948.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1948年英国政府将铁路国有化。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nationalised industry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国有化工业

Sense.DEF: by or to everyone in the nation
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nationally recognised qualification
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国家认可的资格
Sense.EXAMPLE: The programme will be broadcast nationally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该节目将在全国播出。

Sense.DEF: a building, special feature of the land etc that is kept and protected by a government for people to visit
Sense.TRAN: 国家保护建筑﹔国家历史文物

Sense.DEF: land which is protected by a government because of its natural beauty or historical or scientific interest, and which people can visit
Sense.EXAMPLE: Yosemite National Park
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 〔加利福尼亚〕约塞米蒂国家公园

Sense.DEF: the idea that a country must keep its secrets safe and its army strong in order to protect its citizens
Sense.EXAMPLE: The number of people who join the army is so low that it is beginning to threaten national security.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参军人数之少开始威胁到国家安全。

Sense.DEF: the system of making all adults spend a period of time in the army, navy, or air force
the state of being a nation
a nation that is a politically independent country
Sense.EXAMPLE: European Union is seen as a threat to the sovereignty of the nation state.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧盟被视作对民族国家主权的一种威胁。

Sense.DEF: happening or existing in every part of the country
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nationwide search for a missing British tourist
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在全国范围内对一名失踪英国游客的搜寻
Sense.EXAMPLE: nationwide television
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全国性的电视节目

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在全国各地有350个销售点。

Sense.DEF: your native country, town etc is the place where you were born
Sense.EXAMPLE: They never saw their native land again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们再也没见到故土。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He spent most of his professional life outside his native Poland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他大部分的职业生涯都没在祖国波兰度过。

Sense.DEF: a person or people who come from or have always lived in a particular place
Sense.TRAN: 土生土长的纽约人/当地人口/当地居民等

Sense.DEF: the language you spoke when you first learned to speak
Sense.EXAMPLE: English is not the native language for almost half of our overseas visitors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有差不多一半的海外游客母语不是英语。

Sense.DEF: growing, living, produced etc in one particular place
Sense.EXAMPLE: Singapore has many native species of palm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新加坡有很多土生的棕榈树种。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These fish are native to North America.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些鱼原产于北美。

Sense.DEF: native customs, traditions etc are related to people who lived in a particular country before European people arrived there
Sense.EXAMPLE: the native traditions of Peru
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 秘鲁的土著传统
Sense.EXAMPLE: stalls selling native jewelry
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 售卖土著首饰的货摊
Sense.EXAMPLE: native folklore
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土著民俗

Sense.DEF: a native ability is one that you have naturally from birth
Sense.EXAMPLE: her native wit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她天生的机智风趣

Sense.DEF: to behave, dress, or speak like the people who live in the country where you have come to stay or work – used humorously
Sense.EXAMPLE: Austen has been living in New Guinea so long he’s gone native.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥斯汀在新几内亚住了那么久﹐已经入乡随俗了。

Sense.DEF: a person who was born in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a native of Switzerland
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个出生在瑞士的人

Sense.DEF: someone who lives in a place all the time or has lived there a long time
Sense.TRAN: 本地人﹐当地人﹔久居某地的人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He has become a native of Glasgow.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他已经成了格拉斯哥人。

Sense.DEF: a word used by white people in the past to refer to the people who lived in America, Africa, southern Asia etc before European people arrived, now considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 土著人〔旧时白人称呼先于欧洲人居住在美洲﹑非洲和南亚等地的当地人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was not certain whether the natives were friendly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他不敢肯定土著人是否友好。

Sense.DEF: a plant or animal that grows or lives naturally in a place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bear was once a native of Britain.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 熊曾是英国的土生动物。

Sense.DEF: someone who belongs to one of the races that lived in North America before Europeans arrived
Sense.TRAN: 北美土著居民﹐印第安人

Sense.DEF: someone who has learned a particular language as their first language, rather than as a foreign language
Sense.TRAN: 以某种语言为母语的人﹐说本族语的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: For the spoken language, students are taught by native speakers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们由母语人士来教授口语。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a native speaker of English
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 以英语为母语的人

Sense.DEF: the birth of Jesus Christ
a picture or model of the baby Jesus Christ and his parents in the place where he was born
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Nativity scene
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 耶稣诞生的场景

Sense.DEF: a play telling the story of the birth of Jesus Christ, performed by children at Christ­mas
Sense.TRAN: 圣诞剧〔由儿童在圣诞节时演出的关于耶稣诞生的短剧〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the school’s Nativity play
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的圣诞剧

Sense.DEF: a group of countries including the US and several European countries, which give military help to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: our allies in NATO
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的北约盟国
Sense.EXAMPLE: a NATO country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北约成员国

Sense.DEF: to talk for a long time about unimportant things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sometimes she would pick up the telephone and natter to Charles.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有时候她会拿起电话跟查尔斯唠叨个没完。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lynne’s been nattering on about the wedding for weeks.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琳恩几周来一直在唠叨婚礼的事。

Sense.DEF: the act of talking about unimportant things
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sat down and had a natter and a cup of tea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们坐下来聊天喝茶。

Sense.DEF: neat and fashionable in appearance
Sense.EXAMPLE: a natty suit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 笔挺时髦的套装
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a natty dresser.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衣着整洁而时髦。

Sense.DEF: existing in nature and not caused, made, or controlled by people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the study of the natural world trees, rivers, animals, plants etc
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对自然界的研究
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area of spectacular natural beauty
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然风景秀丽的地区

GramExa.GLOSS: things such as floods or earthquakes

Sense.EXAMPLE: death from natural causes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然死亡
Sense.EXAMPLE: the need for natural light in offices
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 办公室里需要自然光的照射

Sense.DEF: normal and as you would expect
Sense.TRAN: 正常的﹔自然的﹔预料中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: At the time, accepting his offer had seemed the most natural thing in the world.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时﹐接受他的提议似乎是再自然不过的事了。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is natural (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not natural for a child of his age to be so quiet.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 像他这个年纪的孩子如此安静不正常。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s only natural that he should be interested in what happens.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他关注所发生的事情是很正常的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a perfectly natural not surprising mistake to make.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 犯这样的错误完全不足为奇。

Sense.DEF: a natural tendency or type of behaviour is part of your character when you are born, rather than one that you learn later
Sense.TRAN: 天生的﹔与生俱来的﹔本能的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Babies have a natural fear of falling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婴儿本能地害怕跌倒。

Sense.DEF: having a particular quality or skill without needing to be taught and without needing to try hard
Sense.TRAN: 天赋的﹔天生具有某种素质[技能]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a natural musician
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天生的音乐家
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cheryl has a natural elegance about her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢里尔身上有一种与生俱来的优雅。
Sense.EXAMPLE: his natural ability with figures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在数字方面的天赋

Sense.DEF: behaving in a way that is normal and shows you are relaxed and not trying to pretend
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be cool, be natural.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 保持冷静﹐自然一点。

Subsense.DEF: someone’s natural parent or child is their real parent or child, who is biologically related to them
Subsense.EXAMPLE: An adopted young person has the right to trace his natural parents.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被收养的年轻人有权寻找自己的亲生父母。

Subsense.DEF: if someone is the natural child of someone, their parents were not married to each other
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He was rumoured to be the natural son of a duke.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谣传他是某位公爵的私生子。

Sense.DEF: not connected with gods, magic, or spirits
Sense.TRAN: 与神仙鬼怪无关的﹐自然科学的
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure there’s a perfectly natural explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我相信一定有一种纯自然的解释。

Sense.DEF: justice that is based on human reason alone
with nothing added to change the taste
Sense.TRAN: 天然的﹐未添加其他成分的
Sense.EXAMPLE: natural yoghurt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原味酸奶

Sense.DEF: a musical note that is natural has been raised from a flat by one semitone or lowered from a sharp by one semitone
Sense.TRAN: 〔音符〕本位音的﹐标明本位号的

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Manufacturers now choose to emphasize the naturalness of the ingredients used in their products.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 生产商现在决定要注重其产品原料的天然性。

Sense.DEF: to be good at doing something without having to try hard or practise
Sense.EXAMPLE: People think I am a natural, but I’ve had to work at it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们认为我有天赋﹐但我也是得靠努力的。

Subsense.DEF: a musical note that has been changed from a flat to be a semitone higher, or from a sharp to be a semitone lower
the sign in written music that shows this kind of musical note

Sense.DEF: someone who has always had a particular quality or skill without having had to learn it
Sense.TRAN: 天生的歌手/会讲故事的人等

Sense.DEF: a method of giving birth to a baby in which a woman chooses not to be given drugs to reduce the pain
gas used for heating and lighting, taken from under the earth or under the sea
the study of plants, animals, and minerals
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Natural History Museum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然历史博物馆

Sense.DEF: a style of art or literature which tries to show the world and people exactly as they are
someone who studies plants or animals
painted, written etc according to the ideas of naturalism
if someone born outside a particular country is naturalized, they become a citizen of that country
Sense.TRAN: 使归化﹐使〔外国人〕入国籍

Sense.DEF: use this to say that something is normal and not surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: Naturally, you’ll want to discuss this with your wife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当然﹐你一定想和你妻子商量一下这件事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Naturally enough, she wanted her child to grow up fit and strong.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很自然﹐她希望自己的孩子健康茁壮地成长。

Sense.DEF: use this to say ‘yes’ when you agree with someone or when you think the person who asked the question should know that your reply will be ‘yes’
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Am I allowed in?’ ‘Naturally.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我可以进来吗？”“当然。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is the result of nature, not of someone’s actions
Sense.EXAMPLE: My hair is naturally curly.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的头发生来就是鬈的。

GramExa.GLOSS: be easy for you to do because you have a natural ability
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Speaking in public seems to come quite naturally to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当众演讲似乎是她与生俱来的能力。

Sense.DEF: in a relaxed manner without trying to look or sound different from usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Just speak naturally and pretend the microphone isn’t there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然地说就行﹐就当麦克风不存在。

Sense.DEF: science
things that exist in nature and can be used by people, for example oil, trees etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a country with abundant natural resources
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然资源丰富的国家

Sense.DEF: chemistry, biology, and physics, considered together as subjects for study, or one of these subjects
Sense.TRAN: 自然科学〔指化学﹑生物和物理〕

Sense.DEF: the process by which only plants and animals that are naturally suitable for life in their environment will continue to live and breed, while all others will die out
a reduction in the number of people employed by an organization, which happens when people leave their jobs and the jobs are not given to anyone else
everything in the physical world that is not controlled by humans, such as wild plants and animals, earth and rocks, and the weather
Sense.EXAMPLE: We grew up in the countryside, surrounded by the beauties of nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在乡村长大﹐周围是美丽的大自然。
Sense.EXAMPLE: nature conservation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自然保护

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The inhabitants of the island fight a constant battle against the forces of nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座岛上的居民经常和大自然的力量抗争。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: All these materials are found in nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些材料都能在自然界中找到。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Disease is nature’s way of keeping the population down.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疾病是大自然控制人口的方法。

Sense.DEF: someone’s character
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child with a happy, easy-going nature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 个性开朗﹑容易相处的孩子

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’sjust not in Jane’s nature to lie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 简天生不会撒谎。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was by nature a very affectionate person.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生性就是个非常亲切的人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I tried appealing to his better nature his feelings of kindness but he wouldn’t agree to help us.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想唤起他的善良本性﹐但他就是不同意帮助我们。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Of course she’s jealous - it’s only human nature the feelings and ways of behav­ing that all people have.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她当然嫉妒——这是人的天性。

Sense.DEF: the qualities or features that something has

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They asked a lot of questions about the nature of our democracy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们询问了很多关于我们民主制度本质的问题。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He examined the nature of the relationship between the two communities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他调查了那两个社区之间关系的特点。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The exact nature of the problem is not well understood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家还未弄清楚该问题的确切本质。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Any government funding would be temporary in nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任何政府资助终究都是暂时性的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Capitalist society is by its very nature unstable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从本质而言﹐资本主义社会是不稳定的。

Sense.DEF: a particular kind of thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The support being given is of a practical nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 提供的支援是实用性的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I never trouble myself with questions of that nature.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从不自寻烦恼考虑那类问题。

Sense.DEF: according to the natural way things happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the nature of things, there is bound to be the occasional accident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 按照事物的规律﹐偶尔发生事故是必然的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be in the nature of sth
Sense.DEF: to be similar to a type of thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The enquiry will be more in the nature of a public meeting than a formal hearing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 调查将更像是一次公众会议而不是正式的听证会。

Sense.DEF: not natural, and morally wrong
Sense.EXAMPLE: They believe that suicide is against nature.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们认为自杀违背天性。

Sense.DEF: to allow events to happen without doing anything to change the results
Sense.TRAN: 顺其自然﹐任其自然发展
Sense.EXAMPLE: The best cure for a cold is to let nature take its course.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 治感冒最好的办法就是顺其自然。

Sense.DEF: a style of living in which people try to live simply and not use modern machines
Sense.TRAN: 〔生活方式的〕返璞归真﹐回归自然
Sense.EXAMPLE: city workers who want to get back to nature in their holidays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休假时想回归自然的城市上班族

Sense.DEF: an area of land in which animals and plants are protected
a path through the countryside that is designed so that you can see interesting plants, animals etc along the way
Sense.TRAN: 自然小径〔沿途可看到有趣的动植物〕

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys not wearing any clothes because they believe it is natural and healthy to do this
someone who tries to cure illness using natural things such as plants, rather than drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔使用植物等自然事物代替药物治病的〕自然疗法者

Sense.DEF: nothing
Sense.TRAN: 无﹔没有什么东西﹔不存在
Sense.EXAMPLE: All their plans came to naught failed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的所有计划都泡了汤。

Sense.DEF: a naughty child does not obey adults and behaves badly
Sense.TRAN: 〔孩子〕淘气的﹐顽皮的﹐没有规矩的﹐不听话的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re a very naughty boy! Look what you’ve done!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你真是个淘气鬼！瞧你干了些什么！

Sense.DEF: if an adult does something naughty, they do something that is not right or good, but is not very serious
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt a bit naughty going off on my own, leaving the children behind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我把孩子们留下﹐自己走开了﹐觉得有点不妥当。

Sense.DEF: naughty jokes, magazines, films etc deal with sex, especially in a humorous way
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指形式幽默的〕黄色笑话/杂志/电影等

Sense.DEF: a stair where a child is told to sit for a period of time as a punishment when they have been naughty
Sense.TRAN: 罚坐的台阶〔小孩子因调皮捣蛋而被罚坐其上的台阶〕

Sense.DEF: the feeling that you have when you think you are going to vomit bring food up from your stomach through your mouth

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A feeling of nausea suddenly came over me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我突然有一种恶心的感觉。

Sense.DEF: to make someone feel that they are going to vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: The thought of food nauseated me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一想到吃的东西我就恶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She felt dizzy and nauseated.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她觉得头晕想吐。

Sense.DEF: making you feel that you are going to vomit
Sense.TRAN: 令人恶心的﹐令人作呕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nauseating smell of rotting fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烂鱼的恶臭

Sense.DEF: making you feel annoyed or offended
Sense.EXAMPLE: his nauseating remarks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他令人厌恶的言论

Sense.DEF: feeling that you are going to vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: I felt slightly nauseous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得有点恶心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The taste made me nauseous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那味道让我恶心。

Sense.DEF: making you feel that you are going to vomit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nauseous smell
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人作呕的气味

Sense.DEF: relating to ships, boats, or sailing
Sense.EXAMPLE: nautical equipment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 航海装备

Sense.DEF: a unit for measuring distance at sea, equal to about 1.15 miles or 1,852 metres
relating to the navy or used by the navy
Sense.EXAMPLE: a naval officer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海军军官
Sense.EXAMPLE: naval battles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 海战

Sense.DEF: the long central part of a church
the small hollow or raised place in the middle of your stomach
to spend too much time thinking about your own problems – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 花过多时间考虑自己的问题〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: a river, lake etc that is navigable is deep and wide enough for ships to travel on
to find which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll drive, you take the map and navigate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我来开车﹐你拿着地图指路。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Early explorers used to navigate by the stars.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的探险家往往靠星辰确定方向。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We managed to navi­gate our way through the forest.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们终于辨明方向走出了森林。

Sense.DEF: to understand or deal with something complicated
Sense.TRAN: 理解﹐应付〔困难复杂的情况〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: A solicitor will help you navigate the complex legal system.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会有一位律师来帮助你应对错综复杂的司法制度。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I am currently trying to navigate through a whole stack of information on the subject.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我目前正在设法整理有关这个问题的一大堆信息。

Sense.DEF: to sail along a river or other area of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: The river is too dangerous to navigate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这河道太危险﹐不适宜航行。

Sense.DEF: to find your way around on a particular website, or to move from one website to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: The magazine’s website is easy to navigate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该杂志的网站浏览方便。

Sense.DEF: the science or job of planning which way you need to go when you are travelling from one place to another
Sense.EXAMPLE: compasses and other instruments of navigation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗盘及其他导航仪器

Sense.DEF: when someone sails a ship along a river or other area of water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Navigation becomes more difficult further up the river.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 越往河的上游﹐航行越困难。

Sense.DEF: when you click on words, pictures etc in order to move between documents that are connected on the Internet
an officer on a ship or aircraft who plans which way it should go when it is travelling from one place to another
an unskilled worker who does physical work, such as building roads
Sense.TRAN: 〔从事筑路等的〕干粗活的工人

Sense.DEF: the part of a country’s military forces that fights at sea
Sense.EXAMPLE: the British Navy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国海军

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is your brother still in the navy?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你弟弟还在海军服役吗？

Sense.EXAMPLE: He joined the navy during the war.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在战争期间参加了海军。

Sense.DEF: a very dark blue colour
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jacket is available in navy, green, or brown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这款夹克有藏青色﹑绿色和棕色。

Sense.DEF: a small white bean which is cooked and eaten, especially in baked beans
very dark blue
Sense.EXAMPLE: a navy blue sweater
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 藏青色的毛衣

Sense.DEF: used when you are adding something to emphasize what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 不但如此﹐而且〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bright e_SEnD nay, a blinding light
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一道明亮﹐甚至令人目眩的光

Sense.DEF: used to say no
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nay, lad. It’s not that bad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不﹐小伙子。 没有那么糟。

Sense.DEF: a ‘no’ – used when voting
a member of the National Socialist Party of Adolf Hitler which controlled Germany from 1933 to 1945
Sense.TRAN: 〔1933到1945年间德国的〕纳粹党员﹐纳粹分子

Sense.DEF: someone who uses their authority over others in a very strict or cruel way
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some of the supervisors are real Nazis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有些主管真霸道。

Sense.DEF: used to make a reader pay attention to a piece of information
Sense.TRAN: 注意﹐留心〔用于提醒读者留意某则信息〕

Sense.DEF: the American organization which arranges professional basketball games
one of the main American television companies
a person who has recently become someone’s good friend, especially soon after meeting them – used especially by young people and in magazines
Sense.EXAMPLE: She has been giving her NBF fashion tips.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一直在给她那位新认识的好朋友传授时尚要诀。

Sense.DEF: an officer of low rank in the British army
used for forming written ordinal numbers with 2
Sense.TRAN: 〔构成书面语中以2结尾的序数词〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the 2nd second of March
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 3月2日
Sense.EXAMPLE: her 22nd birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的22岁生日

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= northeast or 或 northeastern 东北(部)﹔(来自)东北的

Sense.DEF: an early type of human being
Sense.TRAN: 尼安德特人〔一种原始人种〕

Sense.DEF: a man who is big, ugly, and stupid
Sense.TRAN: 傻大粗〔体形巨大﹑相貌丑陋的蠢人〕

Sense.DEF: someone who has old-fashioned ideas and opposes change
an early type of human being who lived in Europe during the stone age
Sense.TRAN: 尼安德特人〔石器时代的欧洲原始人〕

Sense.DEF: neapolitan ice cream has layers of different colours and tastes
Sense.TRAN: 〔冰激凌〕多色的〔各层颜色﹑口味各不相同〕

Sense.DEF: a very small rise and fall of the level of the sea at the times of the first and third quarters of the moon
only a short distance from a person or thing
Sense.TRAN: 接近(地)﹐靠近(地)﹐离…很近(地)
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live near London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在伦敦附近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure they live somewhere near here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我肯定他们就住在这附近。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They moved house to be nearer the school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把家搬到离学校近一些。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a hotel near to the beach
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一家靠近海滩的宾馆

Sense.EXAMPLE: She told the children not to go near the canal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她告诉孩子们不要走近运河。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m warning you - don’t come any nearer!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我警告你别再靠近！
Sense.EXAMPLE: We heard voices as we drew near the village.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们走近村子时听见了说话声。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: The form near is not often used as an adverb without to, except in the phrase quite near.
F2NBox.TRAN: near如果不和to连用一般不用作副词﹐ 但短语quite near除外
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The school is quite near.
F2NBox.EXPL: However, the comparative nearer is often used as an adverb.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但是它的比较级nearer经常用作副词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The sound got nearer and nearer.
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘near from something’. Use to after near.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要说 near from something。而要在near后用to。

Sense.DEF: soon before a particular time or event
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t remember to phone until near the end of the week.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 快到周末我才想起要打电话。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll give you a ring a bit nearer to Christmas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 临近圣诞节时我会给你打电话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They should send us more details nearer the time of the concert.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临近音乐会时他们应该会给我们发更多详细信息。

Sense.DEF: almost doing something or almost in a particular state
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work is now near completion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作现已接近尾声。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of the women were near tears.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多女人差点落泪。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We are no nearer an agreement than we were six months ago.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们没有达成协议﹐同六个月前相比﹐依然毫无进展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was near to panic as he scrambled out of the building.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他爬出那栋大楼的时候几乎吓坏了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was near to crying.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她几乎要哭了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He seemed to know that he was near to death.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎知道自己快要死了。

Sense.DEF: almost at a particular amount or level
Sense.EXAMPLE: Inflation is now near 10%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通货膨胀率目前接近10%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked nearer fifty than forty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去更像50岁而不是40岁。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Unemployment is now near to its all-time low.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 失业率现已接近历史最低点。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Strawberries are near the top of the list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 草莓列在清单的前几项里。

Sense.DEF: if something is near something else, it is similar to it
Sense.EXAMPLE: His story was near enough the truth for people to believe it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的描述非常接近事实﹐足以令人相信。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They say that love is very near to hate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说爱恨仅一步之遥。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It may not be an exact replica but it’s pretty damn near.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这也许说不上是完美的复制品﹐但的确已经十分相似了。

Sense.DEF: almost perfect, impossible etc
Sense.TRAN: 近乎完美/几乎不可能等
Sense.EXAMPLE: a near impossible task
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 几乎不可能完成的任务

Sense.DEF: if an event is drawing near, it is nearly time for it to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: The day of his interview was drawing near.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他面试的日子就要到了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very nearly true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: The repairs will cost us £1,000, as near as damn it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 修理费要花掉我们将近1,000英镑。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is nearly true or correct
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s eleven o’clock, near enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 差不多11点了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All three car parks were full, near enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 三个停车场差不多都满了。

Sense.DEF: used before an adjective or adverb to say that something is definitely not true
Sense.TRAN: 远非﹐绝不是〔用于形容词或副词之前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s nowhere near enough money!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些钱远远不够！
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job wasn’t anywhere near finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作离结束还远着呢。

Sense.DEF: if one person or thing does not come near another one, it is not at all as good as the other one
Sense.EXAMPLE: None of the other word-processing programs comes near this one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他的文字处理程序都不如这个程序好用。

Sense.LEXUNIT: sb will not go near sb/sth
Sense.DEF: if someone will not go near a person or thing, they dislike or are frightened of them and will not speak to the person or use the thing
Sense.TRAN: 某人不喜欢[不愿]接近某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: He refused to go near a doctor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拒绝去看医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He made up his mind never to go near a motorcycle again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他下定决心再也不碰摩托车了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: so near and yet so far
Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone very nearly achieved or got something
Sense.TRAN: 近在眼前却又遥不可及

Exponent.DEF: only a short distance from something or someone
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I live near Salzburg in Austria.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我住在奥地利萨尔茨堡附近。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: If we moved to Dallas, we’d be near my parents.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们搬到达拉斯去﹐那就离我父母近了。

Exponent.DEF: very near something or someone, or almost touching them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel is close to the beach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店离沙滩很近。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Nancy came and sat close beside me on the bed.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 南希走过来﹐紧挨着我坐到床上。

Exponent.DEF: not a long distance away – used when saying that a place is near enough to be easy to get to
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The station’s not far away from here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 车站离这儿不远。

Exponent.DEF: near here or near a particular place
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is there a post office nearby?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近有邮局吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A group of reporters were waiting nearby.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 附近等着一群记者。

Exponent.DEF: easy to walk to from somewhere, or near enough to something for you to walk there
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s a good school within walking distance.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在步行距离之内就有一所好学校。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The house is within walking distance of shopping facilities.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从这房子到购物场所﹐步行就能到达。

Exponent.DEF: in or near the area where you are or the area you are talking about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I prefer to buy fruit and vegetables that are grown locally.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我更喜欢买本地种植的水果和蔬菜。

Exponent.DEF: in the general area near here
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Parking is impossible around here.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这附近根本没法停车。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is there a garage round here?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这附近有汽车修理厂吗？

Exponent.DEF: living or existing in the area where you are or the area you are talking about
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We grew up knowing all the other kids in the neighbourhood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们从小就认识邻里的所有其他孩子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There’s very little crime in the neighborhood.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一片地区犯罪活动很少。

Exponent.DEF: in the area around and near a particular place – used especially in news reports
Exponent.TRAN: 在邻近地区〔尤用于新闻报道〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A white van was seen in the vicinity at the time the murder took place.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凶案发生时有人看见附近停着一辆白色面包车。

Sense.DEF: only a short distance away from someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a beautiful house but it’s 20 miles away from the nearest town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子很漂亮﹐但离最近的城镇也有20英里。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We can meet at the pub or in the restaurant, whichever’s nearer for you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们可以在酒吧或餐馆见面﹐看哪个离你近一些。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: The form near is not used with this meaning before a noun. Use nearby instead.
F2NBox.TRAN: near表示这个意思时不用在名词前。名词前用nearby
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: a nearby park
F2NBox.EXPL: However, the superlative nearest is often used before a noun.
F2NBox.TRAN: 但是﹐最高级nearest经常用于名词之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They headed for the nearest beach.

Sense.DEF: almost a disaster, collapse etc
Sense.TRAN: 险些发生的灾难/几乎崩溃等
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election was a near disaster for the Conservative party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那次选举对保守党来说几乎是场灾难。

Sense.DEF: the thing you have that is most like a particular type of thing
Sense.TRAN: 几乎就是某事物﹐就像某事物一样
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the nearest thing to a father I’ve got.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他简直就像是我的父亲。

Sense.DEF: soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: They promised to contact us again in the near future.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们答应不久会再和我们联系。

Subsense.DEF: if something you succeed in doing is a near thing, you manage to succeed but you nearly failed
Subsense.EXAMPLE: They won the championship, but it was a near thing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们获得了冠军﹐但是赢得很险。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that you just managed to avoid a dangerous or unpleasant situation
Subsense.TRAN: 好险〔表示刚好躲过危险或不愉快的情况〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: That was a near thing e_SEnD that truck was heading straight for us.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚才好险啊﹐那辆卡车朝着我们直冲过来。

Subsense.DEF: when a bomb, plane, car etc nearly hits something but does not
Subsense.TRAN: 〔炸弹﹑飞机﹑汽车等〕几乎打中[撞上]
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a near miss between two passenger aircraft over the airport
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两架客机在机场上方险些相撞

Subsense.DEF: a situation in which something almost happens, or someone almost achieves something
Subsense.TRAN: 几乎发生﹐几乎达到〔某种结果〕

Sense.DEF: an amount to the nearest £10, hundred etc is the number nearest to it that can be divided by £10, a hundred etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Give me the car mileage to the nearest thousand.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 告诉我这车的行驶里程﹐按整千数算。

Subsense.DEF: a relative who is very closely related to you such as a parent
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The death of a near relative is a terrible trauma for a child.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亲人去世会对孩子造成巨大的心灵创伤。

Subsense.DEF: someone’s family – used humorously
Subsense.TRAN: 某人的家人[亲人]﹐某人的至爱〔幽默用法〕

Subsense.DEF: used to describe the side of something that is closest to where you are
Subsense.EXAMPLE: the near bank of the river
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这头的河岸

Subsense.DEF: used when talking about the parts of a vehicle to mean the one that is closest to the side of the road when you drive
Subsense.TRAN: 〔交通工具〕靠路缘一侧的﹐靠左边的
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The headlight on the near side isn’t working.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 左边的车头灯坏了。

Sense.DEF: to come closer to a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: She began to feel nervous as she neared the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走近那所房子时开始觉得紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The ship was nearing the harbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那艘船正驶近港口。

Sense.DEF: to come closer to being in a particular state
Sense.EXAMPLE: The work is nearing completion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作快完成了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s 55 now, and nearing retirement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他现在55岁﹐快要退休了。

Sense.DEF: to come closer to a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was nearing the end of his stay in India.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在印度的逗留期接近尾声。

Sense.DEF: if a time nears, it gets closer and will come soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: He got more and more nervous as the day of his departure neared.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离开的日子越来越近﹐他的心情也越来越紧张。

Sense.DEF: not far away
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lucy was staying in the nearby town of Hamilton.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 露西当时住在附近的汉密尔顿镇。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Dan found work on one of the farms nearby.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 丹在附近的一个农场里找到了工作。

Sense.DEF: the Middle East
almost, but not quite or not completely
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took nearly two hours to get here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到这里花了将近两小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Michelle’s nearly twenty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 米歇尔年近二十。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is the job nearly finished?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这工作快干完了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Louise is nearly as tall as her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 路易丝差不多和她母亲一样高。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I nearly always go home for lunch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我几乎总是回家吃午饭。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He very nearly died.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他差点送命。

Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s not nearly as good-looking as his brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他长相远不如他弟弟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve saved some money, but it’s not nearly enough.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们存了一点钱﹐不过还远远不够。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use nearly before negative words like ‘no’, ‘nothing’ etc. Instead, use almost , or say hardly any , hardly anything etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在否定词no, nothing 等之前不要用nearly﹐而要用almost﹐或者可以说hardly any, hardly anything等
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I know almost nothing (NOT 不说nearly nothing) about him.
There was hardly any traffic (NOT 不说 nearly no traffic).

Sense.DEF: on the side of a vehicle that is closest to the side of the road when you drive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a scratch on the nearside front wing of the car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 汽车左前翼子板上的一道划痕

Sense.DEF: unable to see things clearly unless they are close to you
tidy and carefully arranged
Sense.EXAMPLE: neat handwriting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工整的笔迹
Sense.EXAMPLE: His clothes were always neat and clean.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的衣服总是很整洁。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everything in the house was neat and tidy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 房子里的每样物品都干净整齐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She arranged the books in a nice neat pile.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她把书摞成整齐的一堆。

Sense.DEF: someone who is neat likes to keep things tidy
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve always been quite neat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向来很爱整洁。

Sense.DEF: very good, pleasant, or enjoyable
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a really neat idea.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个主意真不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I liked working for him — he was a neat guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢为他工作——他是个很好的人。

Sense.DEF: something that is neat is small and attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: her small, neat features
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她那小巧精致的面容

Sense.DEF: a neat way of doing or saying something is simple but clever and effective
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the end we found a very neat solution to the problem.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后我们找到了一个解决这个问题的巧妙办法。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neat summary of the main issues
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对主要问题的简明总结

Sense.DEF: a neat alcoholic drink has no ice or water or any other liquid added
Sense.TRAN: 〔酒〕纯的〔指不加冰﹑水或其他酒的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I can’t drink brandy neat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喝不了纯白兰地。
Sense.EXAMPLE: drinking neat whisky
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝纯威士忌酒

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He wrote his name neatly at the bottom of the page.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在那页纸的最下面工整地签上了自己的名字。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: The problem was neatly summed up by one of the teachers.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个问题由其中一位老师作了简要的总结。

Sense.DEF: to make something neater
Sense.EXAMPLE: Put a row of zig-zag stitching along the cut edge to neaten it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 沿剪边来一排曲折线缝﹐使之显得整齐。

Sense.DEF: beneath
Sense.EXAMPLE: neath the stars
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在星空下

Sense.DEF: a mass of gas and dust among the stars, which often appears as a bright cloud in the sky at night
a galaxy mass of stars which appears as a bright cloud in the sky at night
an idea that is nebulous is not at all clear or exact
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Normality’ is a rather nebulous concept.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “常态”是个非常含糊的概念。

Sense.DEF: a shape that is nebulous is unclear and has no definite edges
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nebulous ghostly figure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幽灵般朦胧的身影

Sense.DEF: possibly, but not certainly
Sense.EXAMPLE: That is not necessarily true.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那未必是真的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Expensive restaurants aren’t necessarily the best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昂贵的餐馆不一定是最好的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having this disease does not necessarily mean that you will die young.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患上此病不一定就会早逝。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘So the school will have to close down, then?’ ‘Not necessarily.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “那么这所学校得关闭了？”“也不一定。”

Sense.DEF: in a way that cannot be different or be avoided
Sense.EXAMPLE: The care of old people necessarily involves quite a lot of heavy lifting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 照顾老年人必定要干很多搬重物的活儿。

Sense.DEF: something that is necessary is what you need to have or need to do
Sense.TRAN: 必要的﹐必需的﹐必不可少的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The booklet provides all the necessary information about the college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这本小册子提供了关于那所学院的所有必需信息。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No further changes were considered necessary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有必要作出进一步改变。
