GramExa.EXAMPLE: The police are advising motorists to travel only if their journey is absolutely necessary.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方建议驾驶员如非万不得已不要驾车出行。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is necessary (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not necessary to wear a tie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不一定要打领带。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The doctor says it may be necessary for me to have an operation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说我可能需要做手术。

GramExa.PROPFORM: make it necessary (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Falling profits made it necessary to restructure the business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 利润下滑使得公司必须重组。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A good diet is necessary for maintaining a healthy body.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 想保持身体健康﹐合理饮食必不可少。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll stay up all night, if necessary, to get it finished.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有必要﹐我会熬个通宵把这事做完。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, instead of saying it is necessary for sb to do sth, people usually say that someone has to do sth.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般不说it is necessary for sb to do sth﹐而是说someone has to do sth
F2NBox.BADEXA: The doctor says it might be necessary for me to have an operation.
F2NBox.GOODEXA: ➔The doctor says I might have to have an operation.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生说我可能必须得做手术 。

Sense.DEF: a connection, result etc that must exist and cannot be avoided
Sense.EXAMPLE: The closure of the factory was a necessary consequence of increased competition from abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工厂倒闭是来自国外的竞争加剧的必然结果。

Sense.DEF: something bad or unpleasant that you have to accept in order to achieve what you want
Sense.TRAN: 〔为实现目的不得不接受的〕不得已的事﹐难免的坏事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Hurst regarded work as a necessary evil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赫斯特先生把工作看成是迫不得已的事情。

Exponent.DEF: used to describe something that you need to have or do
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Make sure you bring the necessary documents with you.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 一定要带好所需的文件。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It may be necessary for you to have a small operation.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能需要做个小手术。

Exponent.DEF: very important and necessary, especially in order to be healthy, successful etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为健康或取得成功〕非常必要的﹐必不可少的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Vitamins are essential for healthy growth.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 维生素对于健康成长必不可少。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tourist industry is an essential part of the Spanish economy.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 旅游业是西班牙的经济支柱。

Exponent.DEF: extremely important and necessary, especially in order to avoid serious problems
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤为避免重大问题〕必不可少的﹐非常重要的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: A vital piece of equipment on the spacecraft had stopped operating.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 航天器上的一个重要设备停止了运转。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It is vital that the aid is sent immediately.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 必须马上派出救援。

Exponent.DEF: if something is compulsory, you must do it because of a rule or law
Exponent.TRAN: 〔根据法律或法规规定〕必须做的﹐强制性的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Maths and Science are compulsory subjects.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 数学和科学是必修课。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All new staff undergo a compulsory training course.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有新员工都必须参加一个培训课程。

Exponent.DEF: if something is obligatory, you must do it because of a rule or law. Obligatory is more formal than compulsory.
Exponent.TRAN: 〔根据法律或法规规定〕必须做到的﹐义务的〔obligatory 比compulsory正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The use of seat belts is obligatory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 系安全带是强制性的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Safety regulations have made it obligatory for all competitors to wear fist protectors.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 安全条例规定所有参赛者都必须戴拳套。

Exponent.DEF: if something is mandatory, you must do it because it is the law. Mandatory is more formal than compulsory and sounds stronger.
Exponent.TRAN: 依法必须做的﹐强制性的〔mandatory比compulsory正式﹐语气也更加强烈〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: School attendance is mandatory.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 上课出勤是必须的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a prisoner serving a mandatory life sentence
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 依法被终身监禁的犯人

Exponent.DEF: the requisite things are the ones that you need to have in order to do something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔为了做某事〕需要的﹐必要的﹐必备的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The other candidates lacked the requisite skills.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 其他求职者缺少必要的技能。

Sense.DEF: things such as food or basic clothes that you need in order to live
to do what is necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: Leave it to me - I’ll do the necessary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交给我吧﹐我会把该办的事都办好的。

Sense.DEF: to make it necessary for you to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Lack of money necessitated a change of plan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于缺乏资金﹐只能改变计划。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This would necessitate interviewing all the staff.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这样一来﹐就得和所有员工面谈。

Sense.DEF: something that you need to have in order to live
Sense.EXAMPLE: She saw books as a necessity, not a luxury.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她视书籍为必需品而非奢侈品。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A car is an absolute necessity if you live in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要是住在乡下﹐绝对需要有辆汽车。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A lot of families cannot even afford to buy the basic necessities of life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多家庭甚至买不起基本的生活必需品。

Sense.DEF: when something is necessary

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He emphasized the necessity for good planning and management.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强调了做好规划和管理的必要。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This illustrates the necessity of keeping accurate records of your work.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这说明有必要准确记录你的工作情况。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many teachers are now questioning the necessity of formal exams.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在许多老师都在质疑正式考试的必要性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He only remained with the group out of necessity.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他只是出于需要才留在那个小组。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m afraid it’s become a matter of economic necessity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 恐怕这已成了一个经济需求的问题。

Sense.DEF: something that must happen, even if it is unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 无奈的事物﹔不好却必要的东西
Sense.EXAMPLE: Taxes are a regrettable necessity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 税收是令人遗憾的无奈之举。

Sense.DEF: used when something happens in a particular way because that is the only possible way it can happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of the jobs are, of necessity, temporary.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有许多工作岗位势必是临时性的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: necessity is the mother of invention
Sense.DEF: used to say that if someone really needs to do something, they will find a way of doing it
the part of your body that joins your head to your shoulders, or the same part of an animal or bird

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jean wore a string of pearls around her neck.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼脖子上戴了一串珍珠。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mike rubbed the back of his neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克揉了揉后颈。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You have a lot of tension in your neck muscles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的颈部肌肉很紧张。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He patted his horse’s neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他拍了拍马脖子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had a mass of golden hair, which she wore in a coil at the nape back of her neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有一头金发﹐盘在脖子后面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The dog picked up the puppy and carried it by the scruff back of the neck into the house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那条狗叼住小狗的后颈﹐把它叼进了屋子。

Sense.DEF: the part of a piece of clothing that goes around your neck

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The neck of his shirt was open.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他衬衫的领口敞着。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The sweater has a round neck and long sleeves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那件毛衣是圆领长袖的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a navy V-necked sweater
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 藏青色V领套头毛衣

Sense.DEF: the narrow part of something, usually at the top

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Lara put the cork back in the neck of the bottle.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉勒把软木塞塞回了瓶颈。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a crack in the neck of the violin
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 小提琴琴颈处的一条裂缝

Sense.LEXUNIT: be up to your neck in sth

Subsense.DEF: to be very busy with something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s up to her neck in work.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她正忙于工作。

Subsense.DEF: to be in a difficult situation that is hard to escape from
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Jim’s up to his neck in debt.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆债台高筑。

Sense.DEF: if two competitors or groups are neck and neck in a competition or race, they are level with each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛中〕(与某人)势均力敌﹐不分上下
Sense.EXAMPLE: Opinion polls show the two main parties are running neck and neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民意调查显示两大主要党派势均力敌。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in this/sb’s neck of the woods
Sense.DEF: in a particular area or part of the country
Sense.TRAN: 在这一带/在某人的地区
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t been in this neck of the woods for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我已经好多年没有到这里来了。

Sense.DEF: to be punished or criticized
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we don’t make some changes we’ll all get it in the neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果不作些改变﹐我们都会挨批评的。

Sense.DEF: if a race, especially a horse race, is won by a neck, the winner is only a very short distance in front
Sense.TRAN: 〔比赛﹐尤指赛马中〕以微弱优势〔获胜〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our horse won by a neck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的马以微弱优势获胜。

Sense.DEF: a confident attitude that makes you able to do unreasonable or shocking things without feeling embarrassed
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t know how they have the neck to charge that much!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弄不明白他们怎么好意思收这么多钱！

Sense.DEF: a narrow piece of land that comes out of a wider part
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neck of land between a lake and the sea
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 湖海之间的地峡

Sense.DEF: if something hangs around your neck, it keeps causing you problems

PIC.HEADING: NECKS 衣领
PIC.PICCONTENT: crew neck 圆领；scoop neck 汤匙领；polo neck BrE【英】/turtleneck AmE【美】高翻领；V-neck 鸡心领；cuff 袖口；an open-necked shirt 敞领衬衣

Sense.DEF: if two people are necking, they kiss for a long time in a sexual way
a narrow piece of material around the neck of a piece of clothing
a square piece of cloth that is folded and worn tied around the neck
a string of jewels, beads etc or a thin gold or silver chain to wear around the neck

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a coral necklace.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她戴着一串珊瑚项链。

Sense.DEF: a short necklace
the shape made by the upper edge of a piece of woman’s clothing around or below the neck
Sense.EXAMPLE: a square neckline
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 方形领口

GramExa.GLOSS: leaving part of the chest uncovered
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her evening gown had a plunging neckline.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的晚礼服领口开得很低。

Sense.DEF: a man’s tie
magic, especially evil magic
the practice of claiming to talk with the dead
sexual interest in dead bodies
an area of land where dead people are buried, especially a large ancient one
Sense.EXAMPLE: the extensive necropolis which served the Etruscan city of Caere
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊特鲁里亚塞雷古城的大型公墓

Sense.DEF: the sweet liquid that bees collect from flowers
thick juice made from particular fruit
Sense.EXAMPLE: mango nectar
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 芒果汁

Sense.DEF: the drink of the gods, in the stories of ancient Greece
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊神话中〕众神饮用的酒﹔琼浆玉液

Sense.DEF: a type of fruit like a peach that has a smooth skin, or the tree that produces this fruit
used to say what a married woman’s family name was when she was born. ‘Née’ is put after her married name and before her old name.
Sense.TRAN: 〔已婚妇女〕婚前原名为…的﹔娘家姓…的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mrs Elizabeth Davis, née Williams
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伊丽莎白．戴维斯太太﹐婚前姓威廉斯

Sense.DEF: to have to have something or someone, because you cannot do something without them, or because you cannot continue or cannot exist without them
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t really need a car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你其实并不需要一辆车。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plants need light in order to survive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物需要光才能存活。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The camcorder needs a new battery.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台摄像机需要一块新电池。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you sure that you have everything you need?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你确定需要的都有了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need glasses for reading.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我看书要戴眼镜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I need you to help me with the cooking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要你帮我做菜。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: More blood donors are urgently needed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 迫切需要更多人来献血。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a much needed boost to the local economy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地经济迫切需要的一次推动

Sense.DEF: to feel that you want something very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need a drink.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我需要喝一杯。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you need anything, just say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你需要什么﹐说一声就可以。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She needed to go out for a walk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要出去散散步。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that someone should do something or has to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He needs to see a doctor straightaway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有必要马上去看医生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need to catch up on my office work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有必要赶赶我的办公室工作了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You need to let me know by Monday if you want to take part.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得在星期一之前告诉我你想不想参加。

Sense.DEF: used in negative sentences when saying that something is not necessary or not always true
Sense.TRAN: 需要〔在否定句中表示“不必﹐未必”〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You needn’t stay long.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不必待很久。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Going to the dentist need not necessarily be a painful experience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 看牙医未必就是件痛苦的事。

GramExa.PROPFORM: need not have done sth/need not do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You needn’t have spent all that money.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你本可以不花那么多钱的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I needn’t have worried.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本来是不必担心的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Need we leave so soon?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们一定要那么快就走吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jim need never find out what I said.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆永远不需要知道我说了些什么。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something should have something done to it, or has to have something done to it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house needed painting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子得粉刷了。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Does this shirt need ironing?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这件衬衫要熨烫吗？

GramExa.PROPFORM: sth needs to be checked/cleaned/done etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The engine will need to be completely checked.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台发动机需要彻底检查一下。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The pie doesn’t need to be refrigerated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这馅饼不需要冷藏。

GramExa.GLOSS: ought to be washed, cleaned etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 需要(好好)洗洗/打扫/修剪等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: His hair needs a wash.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的头发该洗洗了。

Sense.DEF: if a job needs a quality or skill, you must have that quality or skill in order to do it well
Sense.TRAN: 要求﹐需要〔某种素质或技能〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job needs a lot of patience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作需要很有耐心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Being a teacher needs a high level of motivation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当老师需要很高的积极性。

Sense.DEF: used when you think people should already know what you are going to say
Sense.EXAMPLE: I need hardly remind you that this information is confidential.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些信息是保密的﹐这就不用我提醒了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: you need only do sth/all you need do is…
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you only have to do something in order to do something else
Sense.TRAN: 你只需要做某事/你所要做的只是…
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need only look at the building to see how much money it will take to repair.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只要看一下那栋楼﹐就知道要花多少钱维修。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All we need do is threaten them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们只需要威胁他们一下。

Sense.LEXUNIT: need I ask/need I say more/need I go on etc?
Sense.DEF: used to say that it is not necessary to say more or ask about something, because the rest is clear
Sense.TRAN: 这还用问？我还有必要说下去吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s lazy, slow, and stubborn. Need I say more?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她懒惰﹑迟钝﹑顽固。 还要我说下去吗？

Sense.LEXUNIT: that’s all I need/that’s just what I didn’t need
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you did not want something to happen, especially when it seems annoying
Sense.TRAN: 真是时候〔尤用于不喜欢的事偏偏发生之时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘There’s a customer for you on the phone.’ ‘That’s all I need!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “有个顾客打电话找你。”“真是时候！”

Sense.LEXUNIT: need sth like a hole in the head
Sense.DEF: used when saying that you definitely do not need something

Subsense.DEF: used to say you are not interested in something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Make-up, who needs it?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 化妆品﹐谁要啊！

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is actually very important to you
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Kids? Who needs them!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子？他们可太重要了！

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: Verb patterns 动词句型
F2NBox.EXPL: You can say that you need to do something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 可以说need to do something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I need to clean (NOT不说I need clean) the house.
F2NBox.EXPL: If someone else is going to do something for you, you can say that you need something done.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果别人要为你做某事﹐你可以说need something done
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I need my car fixed urgently.
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are talking about the object that is going to have something done to it, you can say that it needs cutting, cleaning etc or needs to be cut, cleaned etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: 当说到需要对某物做某事时﹐可以说it needs cutting﹐cleaning等或needs to be cut﹐cleaned等
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: My hair needs cutting.
That box needs to be moved (NOT 不说needs moved).
F2NBox.HEADING: Negatives 否定句
F2NBox.EXPL: You can say that you don’t need to do something or need not/needn’t do something.
F2NBox.TRAN: 可以说don’t need to do something或need not/needn’t do something
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I don’t need to leave (NOT 不说don’t need leave) until 10.
You needn’t apologize (NOT 不说needn’t to apologize).
F2NBox.EXPL: Need not means that it is not necessary to do something. Do not use it to mean must not
F2NBox.GLOSS: should not, or are not allowed to.
F2NBox.TRAN: need not 的意思是“不必”做某事﹐不能表示must not (不准)的意思
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You needn’t take any money.
You mustn’t take any sharp objects on the plane.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 不准携带任何尖锐物品上飞机 。
F2NBox.EXPL: If you say that someone needn’t have done something, you mean that it was not necessary for them to do it although they did it anyway.
F2NBox.TRAN: need’t have done 意为某人“本不该”做某事﹐虽然已经做了
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We needn’t have ordered so much food.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们本不该点这么多吃的 。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use it when something was not necessary and was not done. Use didn’t need to.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果某事不需要做也没有做﹐不要用needn’t have done ﹐用 didn’t need to
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I didn’t need to tell him who I was – he already knew.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有必要告诉他我是谁——他已经知道了 。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common different grammar patterns of the verb need are. 本图表所示为动词need构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。
Tail.PICCONTENT: need sth; need to do sth; need sb/sth to do sth; need not do sth; need doing; need do sth; need sth for sth; other; 10%; 20%; 30%; 40%; 50%

Sense.DEF: a situation in which something is necessary, especially something that is not happening yet or is not yet available

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a growing need for new housing in many rural areas.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多农村地区对新住房的需求不断增长。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We fully recognize the need to improve communications.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们充分意识到需要改善沟通交流。

Sense.DEF: a strong feeling that you want something, want to do something, or that you must have something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the need for job satisfaction
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 需要工作带来的满足感

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jack did not feel the need to boast about his success.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克觉得没必要吹嘘自己的成功。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: You’re welcome to come back and talk any time, if ever you feel the need.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要你觉得有必要﹐欢迎你随时回来谈谈。

Sense.DEF: what someone needs to have in order to live a normal healthy comfortable life
Sense.EXAMPLE: She works to provide for her family’s basic needs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她工作是为了维持家里的基本生计。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Environmentalists argue that the organization fails to address the needs of third world farmers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 环境保护主义者认为该组织未能解决第三世界国家农民的需求问题。

GramExa.GLOSS: provide something that people want or need
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The charity exists to meet the needs of elderly people.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该慈善机构的存在是为了满足老年人的需求。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Schools must satisfy the needs of their pupils.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校必须满足学生的需求。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We have loans to meet your every need.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有不同贷款方式可以满足您的各种需要。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s no need (for sb) to do sth

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone does not have to do something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need for you to come if you don’t want to.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你不想来﹐就不必来了。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to feel sorry for him.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没必要为他觉得难过。

Subsense.DEF: used to tell someone to stop doing something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: There’s no need to shout!
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用大声喊叫！

Subsense.DEF: to need help, advice, money etc, because you are in a difficult situation
Subsense.EXAMPLE: This project is in urgent need of funding.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个项目急需资金。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He is homeless and in desperate need of help.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他无家可归﹐迫切需要帮助。

Subsense.DEF: to need to be cleaned, repaired, or given attention in some way
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The church was in dire very great need of repair.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂亟待修缮。

Sense.DEF: to not need something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She believes him and has no need of further proof.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她相信他﹐不需要他进一步证明什么。

Sense.DEF: when you do not have enough food or money
Sense.EXAMPLE: cases of severe need in the inner cities
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 旧城区中食物严重短缺的现象

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We must care for those in need.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须关心那些生活困难的人。

Sense.DEF: when you are in trouble and need someone to help you
Sense.EXAMPLE: How could she abandon her father now, in his hour of need?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她怎能在父亲困难的时候对其弃之不顾呢？

Sense.DEF: used to say that you must sometimes do things that you do not like doing
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s not the most comfortable way to travel, but needs must.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这不是最舒适的出行方式﹐但是也只能如此了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that really exists
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a real need for after-school care in our area.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这个地区的确需要课后看护。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that must be dealt with quickly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The most urgent need was for more teachers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最迫切的是需要更多的老师。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very urgent need
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There’s a crying need for more doctors and nurses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在迫切需要更多的医生和护士。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an extremely urgent need
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There is a desperate need to build more housing.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在迫切需要建造更多的住房。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She emphasized the growing need to deal with environmental problems.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她强调说﹐现在越来越有必要处理环境问题。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say how important it is
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He stressed the need for better training courses.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强调必须要改进培训课程。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: make something unnecessary
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The new drug treatment eliminates the need for surgery.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有了这种新的药物治疗方法﹐就没有必要进行外科手术了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: New teaching materials must be created if a need exists for them.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有需要﹐就必须编写新的教学材料。

Collocate.COLLOC: there is a need for sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Clearly there is a need for more research.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 显然有必要作进一步研究。

Collocate.COLLOC: there is no need for sth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They felt that there was no need for a formal contract.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们觉得没有必要订立正式的合同。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: if or when something becomes necessary
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Team members move from job to job as the need arises.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小组成员在必要时要变换岗位。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: if it is necessary
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I can work during my lunch break if need be.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如有需要﹐我可以在午餐时间加班。

Sense.DEF: necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: needful expenditure
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 必要的开支

Subsense.DEF: a small thin piece of steel, with a point at one end and a hole in the other, used for sewing
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a needle and thread
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针和线
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a tapestry needle
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 绣针

Subsense.DEF: a knitting needle

Sense.DEF: a very thin, pointed steel tube at the end of a syringe, which is pushed into your skin to put a drug or medicine into your body or to take out blood
Sense.EXAMPLE: She carried hypodermic needles and syringes in her bag.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她包里带着皮下注射针和针筒。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Drug users are at risk when they share needles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吸毒者共用注射针很危险。

Sense.DEF: a long thin piece of metal on a scientific instrument that moves backwards and forwards and points to numbers or directions
Sense.EXAMPLE: a compass needle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罗盘指针

Sense.DEF: a long, very thin piece of metal used in acupuncture a kind of medical treatment originally used in China
a small needle-shaped leaf, especially from a pine tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: pine needles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松针

Sense.DEF: the very small, pointed part in a record player that touches the record in order to play it

Sense.LEXUNIT: like looking for a needle in a haystack
Sense.DEF: used to say that something is almost impossible to find
Sense.TRAN: 如同草垛里寻针〔指某物几乎是无法找到的〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Finding out which file you want can be like looking for a needle in a haystack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要确定你要的是哪份文件﹐犹如大海捞针。

PIC.HEADING: NEEDLES 针
PIC.PICCONTENT: hypodermic needle 皮下注射针头；needle 缝衣针；pine needle 松针；compass needle 指南针指针

Sense.DEF: to deliberately annoy someone by making unkind remarks or jokes about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just said that to Charlie to needle him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对查理说那些话就是为了刺激他。

Sense.DEF: pictures made by covering a piece of material with small stitches
used when you are telling someone something that they probably know or expect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Needless to say, any contributions of money will be gratefully received.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不用说﹐收到任何一笔捐款我们都将很感激。

Sense.DEF: needless troubles, suffering, loss etc are unnecessary because they could easily have been avoided
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report caused needless anxiety to women who have attended the clinic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那份报告让去那家诊所就诊过的妇女产生了不必要的忧虑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to bring to an end these needless deaths.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们必须终止这些无谓的死亡。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Charles hates needless waste.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 查尔斯痛恨不必要的浪费。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: People are dying needlessly every year of heart attacks.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 每年都有人因心脏病白白死去。

Sense.DEF: a woman who is good at sewing
Sense.TRAN: 精于缝纫的妇女﹔缝纫女工

Sense.DEF: the activity or art of sewing, or things made by sewing

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘need not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: I needn’t have put on this thick coat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我本来用不着穿这件厚外套的。

Sense.DEF: if information is given to people on a need-to-know basis, they are given only the details that they need at the time when they need them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Access to the manufacturing process is on a strictly need-to-know basis.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如非必要﹐生产过程绝不外泄。

Subsense.DEF: having very little food or money
Subsense.EXAMPLE: a needy family
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贫困家庭

Subsense.DEF: needy people
Subsense.EXAMPLE: money to help the needy
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用来帮助穷人的钱

Sense.DEF: needing and wanting a lot of love and attention
never
a lazy useless person
evil or criminal
Sense.EXAMPLE: nefarious activities such as drug trafficking and fraud
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贩毒和诈骗之类的犯罪活动

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= negative 阴性(的)

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from having any effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Efforts to expand the tourist industry could be negated by reports that the sea is highly polluted.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关海洋受到严重污染的报道可能会使拓展旅游业的努力完全白费。

Sense.DEF: to state that something does not exist or is untrue
when something is made to have no effect or be the opposite of what it should be
Sense.EXAMPLE: Much of what passes for Christianity is a negation of Christ’s teachings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多被认为是基督教的东西﹐和基督的教诲是相悖的。

Sense.DEF: when someone says no or disagrees
Sense.EXAMPLE: He shook his head in silent negation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他摇摇头﹐默默地表示反对。

Sense.DEF: harmful, unpleasant, or not wanted
Sense.EXAMPLE: My drinking was starting to have a negative effect on my work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喝酒开始对我的工作产生不良影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the negative aspects of ageing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 年岁增长的负面问题
Sense.EXAMPLE: On the negative side, it will cost a lot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从坏的方面讲﹐它要花很多钱。

Sense.DEF: considering only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc and not the good ones
Sense.EXAMPLE: students with a negative attitude to school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对上学抱消极态度的学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: They have a uniformly negative image of the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们都对警察印象不好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jean rarely sounded so negative about her mother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 琼很少这么说她母亲不好。

Subsense.DEF: saying or meaning ‘no’

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He gave a negative answer without any explanation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给了一个否定的回答﹐没有作任何解释。

Subsense.DEF: containing one of the words ‘no’, ‘not’, ‘nothing’, ‘never’ etc

Sense.DEF: not showing any sign of the chemical or medical condition that was being looked for
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pregnancy test was negative.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妊娠化验结果为阴性。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A person can be recently infected by HIV and have a negative result.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚感染艾滋病病毒的人化验结果可能是阴性的。

Sense.DEF: a negative charge is carried by electrons
less than zero
Sense.EXAMPLE: negative numbers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 负数
Sense.EXAMPLE: a negative return on our investment a loss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们投资的负收益

Sense.DEF: used in the names of blood types, meaning not having rhesus factor
Sense.TRAN: 〔血液中〕不含猕因子的﹐Rh 阴性的

Sense.DEF: an image on a photographic film that shows dark areas as light and light areas as dark, from which the final picture is printed
Sense.EXAMPLE: black and white photographic negatives
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 黑白照片的底片

Sense.DEF: a statement or expression that means ‘no’

GramExa.GLOSS: say ‘no’
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The majority of people, when asked whether or not they are creative, will reply in the negative.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数人被问及是否有创意时﹐都会给出否定的回答。

Sense.DEF: something bad or harmful
Sense.EXAMPLE: The negatives outweigh the positives on this issue.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在这个问题上弊大于利。

Sense.DEF: a negative result from a chemical or scientific test
Sense.TRAN: 〔化验或科学试验中的〕阴性结果
Sense.EXAMPLE: The test will give a proportion of false negatives.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种化验会出现一定比例的假阴性结果。

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept a proposal or request
to prove something to be untrue
a situation in which someone owes more money on a mortgage arrangement to borrow money to pay for a house than they would receive if they sold their house
Sense.TRAN: 资产负值﹐负资产〔指资产值低于抵押款〕

Sense.DEF: an attitude in which someone considers only the bad qualities of a situation, person etc, not the good ones
to fail to look after someone or something properly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She smoked and drank, neglected the children, and left the clothes unmended.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她抽烟喝酒﹐既不照顾孩子﹐也不缝补衣服。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neglected garden
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 疏于打理的花园
Sense.EXAMPLE: The building has been badly neglected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这栋大楼严重疏于维护。

Sense.DEF: to pay too little attention to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Many of these ideas have been neglected by modern historians.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些观点有许多都被现代的历史学家忽略了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The police officer was accused of neglecting his duty not doing everything he should.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位警官被控渎职。

Sense.DEF: to not do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: You neglected to mention that they had a second album released during 1991.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有提及他们在1991年发行了第二张专辑。

Sense.DEF: failure to look after something or someone, or the condition of not being looked after

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tenants are complaining about the landlord’s neglect of the property.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 住户在抱怨房东疏忽了房屋的维修。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: After years of neglect, the roads were full of potholes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 道路因为多年失修﹐路面上到处都坑坑洼洼的。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The whole district had an air of abandonment and neglect.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 整个地区有一种萧条落寞的感觉。

Sense.DEF: failure to pay proper attention to something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five officers were court-martialled for cowardice or neglect of duty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五名军官因怯懦或渎职受到军事法庭审判。

Sense.DEF: not looking after something properly, or not giving it enough attention

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She became more and more neglectful of her responsibilities.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她越来越无视自己的责任。

Sense.DEF: a very thin, pretty coat, worn over a nightdress
Sense.TRAN: 〔套在睡衣上的〕薄料宽松室内服

Sense.DEF: failure to take enough care over something that you are responsible for
Sense.EXAMPLE: negligence in carrying out safety procedures
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 执行安全程序时的疏忽
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bridge’s architect was sued for criminal negligence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座桥梁的建筑师被控犯有玩忽职守罪。

Sense.DEF: not taking enough care over something that you are responsible for, with the result that serious mistakes are made
Sense.TRAN: 疏忽的﹐粗心大意的﹔玩忽职守的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The report stated that Dr Brady had been negligent in not giving the patient a full examination.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报告称布雷迪医生失职﹐未给病人作全面的身体检查。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Mr Brown was found guilty of negligent driving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布朗先生被判疏忽驾驶罪。

Sense.DEF: a negligent manner or way of dressing is careless, but in a pleasantly relaxed way
Sense.TRAN: 〔态度﹑穿着〕不拘泥的﹐不计较的﹐随便的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gave a negligent shrug.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他漫不经心地耸了耸肩。

Sense.DEF: too slight or unimportant to have any effect
Sense.TRAN: 可以忽视的﹐无足轻重的﹐微不足道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The damage done to his property was negligible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他财产造成的损失微不足道。

Sense.DEF: an offer, price, contract etc that is negotiable can be discussed and changed before being agreed on
Sense.EXAMPLE: Part-time barman required. Hours and salary negotiable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 招聘兼职酒吧男服务员﹐工作时间及薪金面议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price is not negotiable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格没有商量的余地。

Sense.DEF: a road, path etc that is negotiable can be travelled along
Sense.EXAMPLE: The road is only negotiable in the dry season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这条路只有在旱季才可通行。

Sense.DEF: a cheque that is negotiable can be exchanged for money
to discuss something in order to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在商业或政治方面〕谈判﹐协商

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government refuses to negotiate with terrorists.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府拒绝和恐怖分子谈判。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Union leaders have negotiated an agreement for a shorter working week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会领袖已经商定了一份缩短每周工作时间的协议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His first aim is to get the warring parties back to the negotiating table discussing something.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的首要目标就是把交战各方拉回到谈判桌上。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting past or over a difficult place on a path, road etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Guido swung the steering-wheel round to negotiate a corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉多转动方向盘﹐顺利地通过了拐角。

Sense.DEF: official discussions between the repre­sentatives of opposing groups who are trying to reach an agreement, especially in business or politics
Sense.TRAN: 〔正式的〕谈判﹐协商〔尤指在商业或政治方面〕

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The negotiations with the company had reached a crucial stage.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 和那家公司的谈判到了关键阶段。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This follows private nego­tiations between the landowner and the leisure centre.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这依照的是土地拥有人和休闲中心私下达成的协议。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He is trying to involve community leaders in negotiations on reform.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他试图让社区领导一起参与协商改革事宜。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: After lengthy negotiations, a compromise was finally reached.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过长久谈判﹐终于达成了妥协。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very long
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Despite protracted negotiations, the two sides have failed to reach agreement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然进行了长时间谈判﹐双方还是没有达成协议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The agreement is the result of two years of long and difficult negotiations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个协议是两年艰难而漫长的谈判的结果。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in which it would be very easy to upset people and cause the negotiations to fail
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The company is about to start delicate negotiations with the union about next year’s pay agreement.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司打算就明年的薪酬协定和工会展开微妙的谈判。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: done with a lot of effort
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The agreement came after months of intense negotiations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 经过数月的紧张谈判﹐终于达成了这个协议。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A new round of global trade negotiations is due to start next week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一轮全球贸易谈判将于下周开始。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start negotiations
Collocate.EXAMPLE: They have entered into negotiations to acquire another company.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经开始谈判﹐准备再收购一家公司。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The country should conduct direct negotiations with its neighbours.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国应与其邻国直接进行谈判。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The two companies have broken off negotiations on the deal.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两家公司已经中断这笔生意的谈判。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: start them again
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pressure is on Israel and the Palestinians to resume peace negotiations.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 以色列和巴勒斯坦面临要重启和平会谈的压力。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Peace negotiations started last week.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平会谈于上周开始。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: stop making progress
stop because of disagreement
be being discussed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The contract is currently under negotiation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 合同目前正在洽谈中。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be able to be discussed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The price is usually open to negotiation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 价格一般都可以商量。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be willing to discuss something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The president signalled that he is open to negotiations on the budget.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 总统表示﹐在预算问题上他愿意商谈。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: be something that must be discussed
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The pay is subject to negotiation.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 薪酬必须经过协商决定。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one part of a series of negotiations
Collocate.EXAMPLE: the next round of negotiations on trade barriers
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一轮关于贸易壁垒的谈判

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 谈判的开始/初期/最后阶段

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an occasion when negotiations cannot continue because of a disagreement

Sense.DEF: someone who takes part in official discussions, especially in business or politics, in order to try and reach an agreement
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指商业或政治方面的〕谈判代表﹐协商者
Sense.EXAMPLE: the chief union negotiator
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 工会的首席谈判代表

Sense.DEF: a word for a black woman, usually considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 女黑人〔一般认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a word for a black person, usually considered offensive
Sense.TRAN: 黑人〔一般认为具有冒犯性〕

Sense.DEF: a spiritual2
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国黑人唱的带有宗教色彩的〕黑人灵歌

Sense.DEF: if a horse neighs, it makes a long loud noise
someone who lives next to you or near you
Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the neighbors complained about the noise from the party.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有位邻居抱怨聚会太吵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: FBI agents were interviewing all their friends and neighbors.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 联邦调查局人员正在向他们所有的朋友和邻居问话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our next-door neighbours the people who live in the house next to us say they’ll look after our cat for us while we’re away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们隔壁的邻居说﹐我们不在时他们会照顾我们的猫。

Sense.DEF: a country that is next to another one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Israel and its Arab neighbours
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以色列及其阿拉伯邻国

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is next to another person or thing of the same type
Sense.EXAMPLE: The teacher saw Phil passing a note to his neighbour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 老师看见菲尔给坐在他旁边的人递了一张纸条。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden was divided from its neighbour by a high wall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座花园和相邻的花园被一堵高墙隔开了。

Sense.DEF: an area of a town or city
Sense.TRAN: 社区﹐住宅小区﹔四邻﹐街坊
Sense.EXAMPLE: She grew up in a quiet neighborhood of Boston.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是在波士顿一个清静的街区里长大的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is situated in a peaceful residential neighbourhood area where there are houses rather than factories or shops.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆坐落在一个宁静的住宅区里。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday British English, instead of saying in my neighbourhood, people often say where I live .
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们经常说where I live﹐而不说in my neighourhood
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There aren’t many bookshops where I live.

Sense.DEF: the area around you or around a particular place, or the people who live there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be quiet! You’ll wake up the whole neighbourhood!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静点！ 你会把邻居全都吵醒的！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Is there a good Chinese restaurant in the neighbor­hood?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这附近有没有好的中餐馆？

Sense.DEF: a little more or a little less than a particular number or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: The painting is worth something in the neighborhood of $3,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这幅画大约值3,000美元。

Sense.DEF: a system, organized by a group of neighbours, in which members of the group regularly watch each other’s houses in order to prevent crime
Sense.TRAN: 邻里联防〔指邻居定期相互照看住宅以防止犯罪发生的制度〕

Sense.DEF: near the place where you are or the place you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fair attracted hundreds of people from the neighbouring towns and villages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 集市吸引了邻近城镇及村庄的好几百人前来。

Sense.DEF: behaving in a friendly and helpful way towards the people who live next to you or towards the countries that are next to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: the importance of good neighbourly relations between the two countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国间睦邻友好关系的重要性

Sense.DEF: not one or the other of two people or things
Sense.TRAN: 两者都不（的），两者中无一（的）
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like tea or coffee?’‘Neither, thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你要喝茶还是喝咖啡？”“都不要，谢谢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a game in which neither team deserved to win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场比赛两个队都不该赢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Neither of them can cook.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们俩都不会做饭。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Thompson had two strategies, neither of which seems to have worked very well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤普森有两套行动计划，效果似乎都不太好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We asked both John and Jerry, but neither one could offer a satisfactory explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们询问了约翰和杰里，可他俩都没能给出令人满意的解释。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Neither is used before a singular noun. Use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: neither 用于单数名词前，接单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Neither answer is right.
F2NBox.EXPL: Neither of is used before a plural noun or pronoun. In formal speech and wirting, use a singular verb after it.
F2NBox.TRAN: neither of 用于复数名词或代词之前，在正式的口语和书面语中后跟单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Neither of us speaks Spainish.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们俩都不会说西班牙语。
F2NBox.EXPL: In informal speech and wirting, you can use a plural verb.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在非正式的口语和书面语中可以使用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Neither of us are students.

Sense.DEF: used to show that a negative statement is also true about another person or thing

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t have any money.’ ‘Neither do I.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “我没带钱。”“我也没带。”
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tom didn’t believe a word she said, and neither did the police.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 汤姆根本不相信她说的话﹐警方也不相信。

Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t like horror movies.’ ‘Me neither.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不喜欢恐怖电影。”“我也不喜欢。”

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning two things that are not true or possible
Sense.TRAN: 既不…也不…﹐不…也不…﹐…和…都不
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither Oleg’s mother nor his father spoke English.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥列格的父母都不会说英语。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The equipment is neither accurate nor safe.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这台设备既不精确﹐也不安全。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not say ‘neither ... or ...’. Say neither ... nor ... or not ... or ....
F2NBox.TRAN: 不要说 “ neither ... or ... ”﹐要说neither ... nor ... 或 not ... or ...
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Neither he nor his wife enjoyed the vacation.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次度假他和他的妻子都玩得不开心 。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Most computer users do not know or wish to know about how their computers work.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数电脑用户都不知道﹐也不想知道他们的电脑是如何运行的 。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is not important because it does not affect a fact or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The fact that she needed the money for her children is neither here nor there – it’s still stealing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她需要钱是为了孩子也不行﹐这还是偷。

Sense.LEXUNIT: be neither one thing nor the other
Sense.DEF: used to say that something or someone cannot be described as either one of two types of thing or person, but is somewhere in the middle of the two
Sense.TRAN: 既不是…也不是〔表示介乎两者之间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The New York Times is neither one thing nor the other. It’s not really a city newspaper and it’s not really a national newspaper either.《
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《纽约时报》介乎两者之间﹐既不是一份城市报纸﹐也不是全国性报纸。

Sense.DEF: used to add another negative statement about someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The authorities were not sympathetic to the students’ demands, neither would they tolerate any disruption.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当局既不支持学生们的要求﹐也不会容忍任何混乱发生。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you are definitely not going to do something
an opponent or enemy that is likely to be impossible for you to defeat, or a situation that is likely to be impossible for you to deal with
Sense.TRAN: 难以战胜的对手﹔难以应对的事情

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In the final he will meet his old nemesis, Roger Federer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 决赛中他将对阵他的克星罗杰·费德勒。

Sense.DEF: a punishment that is deserved and cannot be avoided
Sense.TRAN: 天罚﹔不可逃避的惩罚﹔报应

Sense.DEF: based on a style, set of ideas, or political system that existed in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: neo-Georgian architecture
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新乔治王朝时代的建筑
Sense.EXAMPLE: neo-fascists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新法西斯主义者

Sense.DEF: neoclassical art or architecture copies the style of ancient Greece or Rome
Sense.EXAMPLE: a palace built in a neoclassical style
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新古典主义风格的宫殿

Sense.DEF: when a powerful country uses its economic and political influence to control another country
a member of a right-wing movement that has developed in the US since the 1960s and believes that the US should protect its national interests by using its power to influence other countries
Sense.TRAN: 新保守主义者﹐新保守派〔美国始于20世纪60年代的右翼运动的成员﹐他们认为美国应利用自己的实力来影响其他国家﹐从而保护自己的国家利益〕

Sense.DEF: relating to the last period of the stone age, about 10,000 years ago, when people began to live together in small groups and make stone tools and weapons
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Neolithic burial ground
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一块新石器时代的墓地

Sense.DEF: a new word or expression, or a word used with a new meaning
Sense.TRAN: 新词﹔新表达方式﹔旧词新义

Sense.DEF: a colourless gas that is found in small quantities in the air and is used in glass tubes to produce a bright light in electric advertising signs. It is a chemical element: symbol Ne
Sense.TRAN: 氖〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Ne〕

GramExa.GLOSS: ones that use neon
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the neon lights of Las Vegas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斯维加斯的霓虹灯
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A neon sign flashed on and off above the door.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 门上方的霓虹灯广告牌一闪一闪。

Sense.DEF: relating to babies that have just been born
Sense.EXAMPLE: neonatal care
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新生儿护理
Sense.EXAMPLE: nurses woking in neonatal units
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在新生儿区工作的护士

Sense.DEF: someone who has just started to learn a particular skill, art, job etc
a new member of a religious group
the son of your brother or sister, or the son of your husband’s or wife’s brother or sister
the practice of unfairly giving the best jobs to members of your family when you are in a position of power
Sense.TRAN: 任人唯亲﹔重用亲戚﹔裙带关系
Sense.EXAMPLE: allegations of nepotism and corruption
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对任人唯亲和腐败行为的指控

Sense.DEF: the planet that is eighth in order from the sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: the discovery of Neptune in 1846
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 1846年海王星的发现

Sense.DEF: someone who seems only interested in computers and other technical things — used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 计算机迷﹔对〔其他技术〕着迷的人〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a computer nerd
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 计算机迷

Sense.DEF: someone who seems very boring and unfashionable, and is not good in social situations

(37–68 AD) a Roman emperor, said to have killed his mother, wives, and many others. He blamed the Christians for causing the great fire of Rome in AD 64 and many were killed. He is also known for his performances as an actor and musician, and is usually shown in pictures fiddling playing the violin while Rome is on fire behind him. The expression ‘Nero fiddled while Rome burned’ is sometimes used to describe a situation in which immediate action is needed, but time is being wasted doing nothing.
Sense.TRAN: 尼禄〔公元37–68﹐罗马皇帝。Nero fiddled while Rome burned 这句话有时用来表示虽然情势紧急﹐但人们还是浪费时间无所作为〕

Subsense.DEF: used to talk about someone being worried or frightened

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb’s nerves are on edge/in tatters/frayed
GramExa.GLOSS: someone feels very worried or frightened
stop yourself feeling worried or frightened
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sean drank a large glass of brandy to calm his nerves.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖恩喝了一大杯白兰地﹐好让自己定定神。

GramExa.GLOSS: be extremely worried or frightened
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I remember you were a bundle of nerves on your wedding day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得你在婚礼那天紧张极了。

Subsense.DEF: the feeling of being worried or a little frightened
Subsense.EXAMPLE: A lot of people suffer from nerves before they go on stage.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很多人登台之前都觉得紧张。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: ‘What’s wrong with Rachel?’ ‘It’s just nerves. She’s got her driving test tomorrow.’
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: “蕾切尔怎么啦？”“只是紧张﹐她明天要参加驾驶考试。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 考试/首场演出等的紧张

Sense.DEF: nerves are parts inside your body which look like threads and carry messages between the brain and other parts of the body
Sense.EXAMPLE: a condition which affects the nerves in the back
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影响背部神经的疾病

GramExa.GLOSS: a nerve that has been crushed between two muscles etc, causing pain

Sense.DEF: courage and confidence in a dangerous, difficult, or frightening situation

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not many people have the nerve to stand up and speak in front of a large audience.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不是很多人都有勇气站在一大群人面前讲话。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She finally found the nerve to tell him she wanted a divorce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终于鼓起勇气告诉他自己想离婚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It takes a lot of nerve to report a colleague for sexual harassment.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要举报同事的性骚扰行为需要很大的勇气。

GramExa.GLOSS: suddenly become very nervous so that you cannot do what you intended to do
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Jensen would’ve won if he hadn’t lost his nerve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 詹森要不是气馁﹐就能赢了。

GramExa.GLOSS: remain calm in a difficult situation
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s hard to keep your nerve when people keep interrupting you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断被人干扰时你很难保持镇静。

Sense.DEF: if someone gets on your nerves, they annoy you, especially by doing something all the time
Sense.TRAN: 烦扰某人﹔使某人心神不定
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s always moaning. It really gets on my nerves.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她老是在哼哼唧唧的﹐真令我心烦。

Sense.DEF: if you say someone has a nerve, you mean that they have done something unsuitable or impolite, without seeming to be embarrassed about behaving in this way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s got a nerve asking for more money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他居然有脸要更多的钱。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She didn’t say sorry or anything.’ ‘What a nerve!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没有说任何道歉的话。”“真不要脸！”

GramExa.PROPFORM: have the nerve to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She lets me do all the work, and then she has the nerve to criticize my cooking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有的活儿她都让我来干﹐然后竟还有脸挑剔我的厨艺。

Sense.DEF: to mention something that makes someone upset, angry, or embarrassed, especially accidentally
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指无心地〕触到敏感话题﹔触到痛处
Sense.EXAMPLE: Without realizing, he had touched a raw nerve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无意间他触到了别人的痛处。

Sense.DEF: the ability to be brave and calm in a dangerous or difficult situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: The job requires nerves of steel.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 做这份工作需要有坚强的意志。

Sense.LEXUNIT: nerve yourself to do sth/for sth
Sense.DEF: to force yourself to be brave enough to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The parachutist nerved himself for the jump.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 跳伞者鼓足勇气准备往下跳。

Sense.DEF: a neuron
the place from which a system, activity, organization etc is controlled
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ship’s nerve center
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这艘船的控制中心

Sense.DEF: a poisonous gas that is used in war to kill or paralyse people
used to describe someone’s fingers when they cannot hold something firmly, especially because they have had a shock
Sense.EXAMPLE: The key fell from her suddenly nerveless fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 钥匙从她突然麻木的手上滑落。

Sense.DEF: a nerve-racking situation makes you feel very nervous or worried
Sense.TRAN: 令人紧张的﹔令人不安的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Speaking in public can be a nerve-wracking experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当众发言会是件令人非常紧张的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fran faced a nerve-racking wait for her test results.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗兰焦虑不安地等待考试结果。

Sense.DEF: worried or frightened about something, and unable to relax
Sense.TRAN: 神经紧张的﹔焦虑不安的﹔害怕的﹐胆怯的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was so nervous about her exams that she couldn’t sleep.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试让她紧张得睡不着觉。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish you’d stop looking at me like that. You’re making me nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你不要再那样看着我了﹐你让我紧张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Paul always gets nervous whenever he has to give a presentation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每次要进行陈述的时候﹐保罗总是很紧张。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Don’t be silly,’ she said with a nervous laugh. ‘There’s no such thing as ghosts.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “别傻了﹐” 她紧张地笑了笑﹐“世上没有鬼这种东西。

Sense.EXAMPLE: By the time I got into the interview I was a nervous wreck was extremely nervous.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了面试的时候﹐我紧张得要命。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We were all a bit nervous of him at first frightened of him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 起初我们都有点怕他。

Sense.DEF: often becoming worried or frightened, and easily upset
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s a nervous, sensitive child.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她是一个胆怯而敏感的孩子。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The film is unsuitable for people of a nervous disposition who are easily frightened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这部影片不适合容易紧张的人观看。

Sense.DEF: related to the nerves in your body
Sense.TRAN: 神经系统的﹐神经方面的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was suffering from a nervous condition.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她患上了一种神经系统疾病。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He had a nervous twitch his body made small, uncontrolled movements.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他身体出现神经性抽搐。

Sense.DEF: a mental condition in which you feel very tired, usually caused by working too hard or by a difficult emotional problem

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Mike’s nervousness showed in his voice.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 迈克的声音里透着紧张不安。

Exponent.DEF: worried or a little frightened about something and unable to relax
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kelly was so nervous about her exam that she couldn’t sleep.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试让凯莉紧张得睡不着觉。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It makes me nervous when you drive that fast.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你开那么快﹐我很紧张。

Exponent.DEF: worried and unable to relax in a way that makes you get angry or upset easily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Mary’s problems at work were making her tense and irritable.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 工作上遇到的问题让玛丽变得紧张易怒。

Exponent.DEF: nervous because you feel that something bad might happen, so that you are unable to relax until the danger has passed
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因感觉坏事可能发生而〕紧张不安的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I began to feel uneasy when he still hadn’t phoned by 11 o’clock.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他11点还没有打电话来﹐我开始不安起来。

Exponent.DEF: if you are on edge or your nerves are on edge, you feel nervous because you are worried about what might happen
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因担心某事发生而〕神经紧张的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My nerves were on edge, waiting for the results of the test.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我紧张地等待着考试结果。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Redundancies and other work upheavals have put employees on edge.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 裁员以及职场的动荡让员工们紧张不安。

Exponent.DEF: nervous and anxious in a way that is not normal or reasonable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s completely neurotic about food hygiene.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对食品卫生太神经过敏了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a neurotic mother
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经质的母亲

Exponent.DEF: nervous because you are worried about what might happen
Exponent.TRAN: 〔因担心某事发生而〕紧张不安的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Investors are a little edgy about the financial markets these days.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 投资者对于最近的金融市场有点心慌。

Exponent.DEF: becoming nervous or upset easily because that is your character
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Like many musicians, he’s very sensitive and highly-strung.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 和许多音乐家一样﹐他也非常敏感﹐容易激动。

Exponent.DEF: to feel extremely nervous and unable to relax
Exponent.EXAMPLE: After 10 months of teaching, I was a total nervous wreck.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历了十个月的教学工作﹐我感到神经极度紧张。

Exponent.DEF: to feel nervous about something that you are going to do very soon because it is important and you want to do it well
Exponent.TRAN: 心里紧张不安﹐心里七上八下
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Actors often have butterflies before going on stage.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 演员上台表演前心里往往非常紧张。

Sense.DEF: a mental illness in which someone becomes extremely anxious and tired and cannot deal with the things they usually do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colin came close to having a nervous breakdown last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 科林去年差点精神崩溃。

Sense.DEF: your nerves, brain, and spinal cord, with which your body feels pain, heat etc and your movements are controlled
nervous and easily frightened
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was all tired and nervy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她很累﹐又很紧张。

Sense.DEF: brave and confident
used to form nouns from adjectives
Sense.EXAMPLE: loudness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 响度
Sense.EXAMPLE: sadness
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 悲伤

Sense.DEF: a place made or chosen by a bird to lay its eggs in and to live in
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bird’s nest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸟窝
Sense.EXAMPLE: In May the females build a nest and lay their eggs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雌鸟在5月份筑巢产蛋。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Young eagles leave the nest after only two months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雏鹰仅仅两个月以后就会飞离鸟巢。

Sense.DEF: a place where insects or small animals live
Sense.EXAMPLE: a field mouse’s nest
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 田鼠穴

Sense.DEF: to leave your parents’ home and start living somewhere else when you are an adult
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both daughters were ready to fly the nest.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两个女儿都准备好离家独立生活。

Sense.DEF: a place where people are secretly doing a lot of illegal or dishonest things
Sense.TRAN: 间谍/窃贼的巢穴/阴谋诡计的策源地等

Sense.DEF: a set of tables etc that fit inside each other
Sense.TRAN: 〔可依大小套放的〕一套桌子/盒子等

Sense.DEF: to build or use a nest
Sense.EXAMPLE: They say eagles used to nest in those rocks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们说以前常有老鹰在那些岩石中筑巢。

Sense.DEF: to organize information, especially in a computer program, so that some of the information is recognized as separate but is included or contained in a larger part of the information
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤在计算机程序中〕嵌入〔信息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Phrases are nested in the dictionary entry for the first major word.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 短语按第一主词排入词典词条中。

Sense.DEF: an amount of money that you have saved so that you can use it for something special in the future
Sense.EXAMPLE: They had to use part of their retirement nest egg to pay for their son’s college fees.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们得动用部分退休金来支付儿子念大学的费用。

Sense.DEF: to move into a comfortable position, pressing your head or body against someone or against something soft
Sense.TRAN: (使)舒适地安顿下来﹔(使)偎依﹐(使)依靠
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah lay there peacefully, the child nestling by her side.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉安静地躺在那儿﹐孩子偎依在她身边。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He nestled his head against her shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他把头靠在她的肩膀上。

Sense.DEF: to be surrounded by something, especially hills or countryside
Sense.TRAN: 坐落在〔尤指山间或乡间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a tiny village nestling among the foothills of the French Alps
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坐落在法国阿尔卑斯山脚下的一个小村庄

Sense.DEF: a very young bird that cannot leave its nest because it is not yet able to fly
the system that allows millions of computer users around the world to exchange information
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bruce spends most evenings surfing the Net looking at information in different places on the Internet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布鲁斯晚上大多在网上浏览信息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You might find something on the Net.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你也许能从网上找到些什么。

Sense.DEF: something used for catching fish, insects, or animals which is made of threads or wires woven across each other with regular spaces between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fishing net
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 渔网
Sense.EXAMPLE: a butterfly net
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 捕蝶网

Subsense.DEF: the thing that players must hit the ball over in games such as tennis
the thing behind the posts that players try to kick or hit the ball into in games such as football or hockey
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Henry kicked the ball into the back of the net.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 亨利将球踢进了网窝。

Sense.DEF: something used for keeping things out, for example insects or birds, which is made of threads woven across each other with regular spaces between them
Sense.TRAN: 网罩〔用于阻挡昆虫﹑鸟类等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a mosquito net
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 蚊帐

Sense.DEF: very thin material made from fine threads woven together, with small spaces between
if criminals slip through the net, they avoid attempts by the police etc to catch them
if someone or something falls or slips through the net, a system which was designed to help or check them has not succeeded in doing this
Sense.EXAMPLE: In a class of 30 children it is easy for some to slip through the net and learn nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在有30个孩子的班级里﹐有些孩子很容易被忽视﹐什么也学不到。

Sense.DEF: to consider or try as many things as possible in order to find what you want
Sense.TRAN: 撒开大网﹔想尽办法寻找
Sense.EXAMPLE: Record companies are casting their nets wide in search of new talent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 唱片公司为了发掘新人正在撒开大网。

PIC.HEADING: NET 网
PIC.PICCONTENT: hairnet 发网；mosquito net 蚊帐；net 球网；fishing net 渔网

Sense.DEF: the net amount is the final amount that remains after all the other amounts have been taken away
Sense.EXAMPLE: The net profit after taxes, costs etc was up 16.3% last month.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上个月净利润增长了16.3%。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company reported a net loss of $56 million last year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司报告去年净亏损5,600万美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Vernon estimates the company’s net worth at over $8 billion.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 弗农估算公司的资产净值超过80亿美元。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The United States is a net importer of beef it imports more than it exports.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国是牛肉净进口国。

Sense.DEF: the final result or effect of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: The net result will be higher costs to the consumer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最后的结果是消费者将支付更高的费用。

Sense.DEF: the weight of something without its container

RunOn.EXAMPLE: jars of coffee weighing 450 grams net

Sense.DEF: to earn a particular amount of money as a profit after tax has been paid
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was netting around $64,000 a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一年净赚约6.4万美元。

Sense.DEF: to succeed in getting something, especially by using your skill
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company has recently netted several large contracts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司最近获得了几个大合同。
Sense.EXAMPLE: An undercover sweep netted 22 suspects in one evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一次秘密搜查行动一晚就抓获了22名嫌疑人。

Sense.DEF: to hit or kick the ball into the net in sport
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rooney has netted nine goals for United so far this season.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本赛季到目前为止鲁尼已经为曼联队踢入九个球。

Sense.DEF: to catch a fish in a net
Sense.EXAMPLE: We netted three fish in under an hour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不到一小时我们就网住了三条鱼。

Sense.DEF: a game similar to basketball played in Britain, especially by girls
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国女子玩的〕无挡板篮球﹐篮网球

Sense.DEF: lower down - often used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 下面的﹐下部的〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: exploring the nether regions of East Sussex
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 探索东萨塞克斯郡南部地区

Sense.DEF: the commonly accepted rules for polite behaviour when communicat­ing with other people on the Internet
someone who uses the Internet, especially someone who uses it in a responsible way
Sense.EXAMPLE: China and India have far larger numbers of netizens than any Western nation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中国和印度的网民数量远远超过任何一个西方国家。

Sense.DEF: someone who has started an Internet business
the expressions, technical words, slang etc commonly used on the Internet
Sense.EXAMPLE: a glossary of netspeak terms
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 网络用语词汇表

Sense.DEF: a British spelling of net2
material consisting of string, wire etc that has been woven into a net
Sense.EXAMPLE: a fence of wire netting
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铁丝网围栏

Sense.DEF: a wild plant with rough leaves that sting you
to be annoyed by what someone says or does
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was nettled by Holman’s remark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被霍尔曼的话激怒了。

Sense.DEF: a medical condition that causes areas of red spots on your skin
a system of lines, tubes, wires, roads etc that cross each other and are connected to each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hungary’s telephone network
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 匈牙利的电话网
Sense.EXAMPLE: a high-speed European rail network
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的高速铁路网

GramExa.EXAMPLE: an elaborate network of canals
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 四通八达的运河网
GramExa.EXAMPLE: the network of blood vessels in the body
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人体内的血管网

Sense.DEF: a group of radio or television stations, which broadcast many of the same programmes, but in different parts of the same country
Sense.EXAMPLE: the four biggest TV networks
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 四大电视网
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re listening to the American Armed Forces Network.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 您正在收听的是美军广播电台。

Sense.DEF: a set of computers that are connected to each other so that they can share information
a group of people, organizations etc that are con­nected or that work together

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s important to build up a network of professional contacts.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 建立同行人脉关系是很重要的。

Sense.DEF: to connect several computers together so that they can share information
to meet and talk with people who have similar jobs to yours, especially because they may be useful for your work
to broadcast a radio or television programme on several different channels at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 通过〔电台或电视〕网络播出

Sense.DEF: a piece of equipment in a pc that allows the PC to be connected to a network
the practice of meeting other people involved in the same kind of work, to share information, support each other etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m hoping to do some networking at the conference next week in London.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望下周在伦敦召开的会议上能结交一些同行。

Sense.DEF: relating to a nerve or the nervous system
Sense.EXAMPLE: signs of neural activity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经活动的迹象

Sense.DEF: a computer that is designed to operate in a way similar to the human brain
Sense.TRAN: 〔运行方式与人脑相似的〕神经电脑

Sense.DEF: a sharp pain along the length of a nerve
a set of computers that are connected to each other, which share information and operate in a way that is supposed to be similar to the human brain
Sense.EXAMPLE: By 1989, they were using neural networks to assess credit risks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到1989年﹐他们已在运用神经网络评估信用风险了。

Sense.DEF: relating to the nerves
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neurosurgeon
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经外科医生

Sense.DEF: a scientific study which combines neuroscience the study of the brain and information sciencethe collecting, storing, and arranging of information, especially using powerful computers
the scientific study of the nervous system and its diseases
a type of cell that makes up the nervous system and sends messages to other parts of the body or the brain
the scientific study of the brain
a mental illness that makes someone unreasonably worried or frightened
the study of how brain chemistry and structure affect religious beliefs and feelings
unreasonably anxious or afraid
Sense.TRAN: 神经质的﹐神经过敏的﹔极度害怕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seemed a neurotic, self-obsessed man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他似乎是个神经过敏又自恋的人。

Sense.DEF: relating to or affected by neurosis
Sense.EXAMPLE: neurotic disorders
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神经症

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She accused him of being a neurotic.

Sense.DEF: a neuter noun, pronoun etc belongs to a class of words that have different inflections from masculine or feminine words
to remove part of the sex organs of an animal so that it cannot produce babies
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neutered tomcat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 被阉割的公猫

Sense.DEF: to remove power from something or to stop something from being effective — used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 使失去作用﹐使丧失效力〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Plans to reform local government are designed to neuter local democracy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 改革地方政府的计划旨在压制地方民主。

Sense.DEF: not supporting any of the people or groups involved in an argument or disagreement
Sense.EXAMPLE: I always tried to remain neutral when they started arguing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们争论起来的时候我总是努力保持中立。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Clive decided to adopt a neutral position.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克莱夫决定采取中立立场。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British government acted as a neutral observer during the talks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国政府在会谈中扮演了中立观察员的角色。

Sense.DEF: a country that is neutral does not support any of the countries involved in a war
Sense.EXAMPLE: During World War II, Sweden was neutral.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在第二次世界大战期间﹐瑞典是中立国。

GramExa.GLOSS: land or sea that is not controlled by any of the countries involved in a war

Sense.DEF: in a place that is not connected with either of the people, groups, or countries that are involved in a discussion, argument, war, or competition
Sense.TRAN: 在中立地区﹔在第三方领土
Sense.EXAMPLE: The talks will be held on neutral ground.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会谈将在第三方领土上举行。

Sense.DEF: language, words etc that are neutral are deliberately chosen to avoid expressing any strong opinion or feeling
Sense.TRAN: 中性的﹔不带感情色彩的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the neutral language of an official news report
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方新闻报道采用的中性语言

Sense.DEF: if someone says something in a neutral voice, or if they have a neutral expression on their face, they do not show how they are feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bragg said in a neutral voice, ‘The investigation has been closed down.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布拉格不带感情地说:“调查结束了。”

Sense.DEF: a neutral colour is a colour such as grey, light brown, or cream
Sense.TRAN: 淡雅的﹐不鲜艳的﹐素净的〔如灰色﹑浅棕色或淡黄色〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neutral tones give the room a feeling of space.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 素净的色调让房间显得宽敞。

Sense.DEF: a neutral wire, for example in a plug, has no electrical charge18
a neutral substance is neither acid nor alkaline
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant prefers a neutral or slightly acidic soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种植物适宜于中性或略带酸性的土壤。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a neutral pH of 7.0
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 中性的pH 值7.0

Sense.DEF: the position of the gears of a car or machine when no power is being sent from the engine to the wheels or other moving parts

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When you start the engine, make sure the car’s in neutral.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 发动引擎时﹐一定要让汽车处于空挡。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Put the car into neutral.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 将汽车排挡置于空挡位。

Sense.DEF: a country, person, or group that is not involved in an argument or disagreement
a neutral colour
the state of not supporting either side in an argument or war
to prevent something from having any effect
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rising prices neutralize increased wages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不断上涨的物价会抵消工资的增长。

Sense.DEF: to make a substance chemically neutral
Sense.EXAMPLE: a medicine that neutralizes the acid in the stomach
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 能中和胃酸的药

Sense.DEF: to make an area neutral in a war
to destroy something that is dangerous to you during a war
something that is smaller than an atom and has no electrical charge
a part of an atom that has no electrical charge
a type of nuclear bomb that kills people but is not intended to cause much damage to buildings, roads etc
not at any time, or not once
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never been to Australia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他从未去过澳大利亚。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m never going back there again, not as long as I live.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只要我活着﹐我再也不会回到那儿去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is never too late to give up smoking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戒烟不言晚。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never had she been so confused.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从未如此困惑。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize what you are saying
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ll never ever forgive him for leaving me.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远不会原谅他离开我。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Never again never after a particular time would he return to Naples.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他再也不会回到那不勒斯。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize how bad something was
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never in all my life have I felt so humiliated.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我这辈子从未感到如此羞辱。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize that you never thought something
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had never for one moment imagined that it could happen to her.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从未想过这事会发生在她身上。

GramExa.PROPFORM: sb/sth has never been known to do sth
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that something is strange because it has never happened before
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 从未听说某人/某物做某事
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Max had never been known to leave home without telling anyone.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马克斯从来没有过不打招呼就出门的时候。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use another negative word (eg ‘not’) with never. If you use ‘not’, use ever.
F2NBox.TRAN: never不应与其他否定词(如not)连用。如果用not﹐就要使用ever
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: She might never forgive you OR或 She might not ever forgive you (NOT不说She might not never forgive you).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 她可能永远不会原谅你。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something which seems unlikely may happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try it! You never know, you might be lucky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 试试看！说不定你会走运。

Sense.DEF: used to mean that you did not know something until now
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never knew you played the guitar!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直都不知道你会弹吉他！

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that someone did not do something, especially when this seems surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: I do everything for him, and he’s never so much as made me a cup of coffee.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我什么都为他做﹐而他连一杯咖啡也没有给我煮过。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you would not want something to happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone might discover our secret and that would never do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 也许会有人发现我们的秘密﹐那可绝对不行。

Sense.DEF: used when you are very surprised by something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They’re getting married next month.’ ‘Never!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们下个月要结婚了。”“不可能吧！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s never going to cycle all the way to Manchester!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他绝不可能一路骑自行车去曼彻斯特！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well I never! I wouldn’t have thought she was that old!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 啊﹐不会吧！ 我没想到她有那么大年纪了！

Sense.DEF: used to say that you did not do something bad that someone has said you did. Many teachers think this is not correct English.
Sense.TRAN: 我没干过〔许多教师认为该用法不正确〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You cheated, didn’t you?’ ‘No, I never.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你作弊了﹐是吗？”“不﹐我没有。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you should not say that you will never do something, because there is always a small possibility that you might do it
used to encourage someone not to give up
used to tell someone not to worry
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’ll be back, never fear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐她会回来的。

Exponent.DEF: not at any time, or not once
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Ali had never seen snow before.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿里以前从未见过雪。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’ll never forget that day.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我永远不会忘记那一天。

Exponent.DEF: used to emphasize that you mean never
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Do you promise never ever to tell anyone else about this?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你答应永远不告诉别人吗？

Exponent.DEF: used to emphasize that you are surprised or annoyed because someone never did something
Exponent.TRAN: 一次都没有〔用于强调感到惊讶或恼火〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She’s never said thank you – not once.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她从来不说谢谢——一次都没有。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Jo hasn’t emailed me once in six months.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这六个月里乔没有给我发过一封电子邮件。

Exponent.DEF: used to emphasize that you never had a particular thought or idea
Exponent.TRAN: 从来没有〔出现某种想法〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘Did you ever suspect he was cheating on you?’ ‘No, not for a moment.’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “你有没有怀疑过他对你不忠呢？”“没有﹐从来没有。”

Exponent.DEF: used to say that it is completely impossible that something could ever happen
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Dad will never agree to that – not in a million years!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 爸爸决不会同意的——绝对不可能！

Exponent.DEF: used to emphasize that something never happened
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At no time did anyone suggest that the drug was dangerous.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 从来没有人说过这药有危险。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At no time were the prisoners mistreated.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 囚犯从未受过虐待。

Sense.DEF: seeming to continue for a very long time
Sense.TRAN: 永远不会完结的﹔永无休止的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Keeping the house neat and clean is a never-ending battle.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 让家里保持干净整洁是一场打不完的仗。

Sense.DEF: never again
if you buy something on the never-never, you buy it by making small regular payments over a long period
an imaginary place where everything is perfect
Sense.TRAN: 〔想象中的〕世外桃源﹐理想乐土

Sense.DEF: in spite of a fact that you have just mentioned
Sense.EXAMPLE: What you said was true. It was, nevertheless, a little unkind.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你说的都是实话﹐只不过有点刻薄。

Sense.DEF: recently made, built, invented, written, designed etc
Sense.TRAN: 新造的﹔新建的﹔新发明[创作﹐设计]的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the city’s new hospital
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市里新建的医院
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new issue of ‘Time’ magazine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一期《时代周刊》
Sense.EXAMPLE: new products on the market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 市场上的新产品
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hardest part of this job is understanding the new technology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项工作最难的地方是理解新技术。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new range of drugs
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一系列新药

Sense.DEF: recently bought
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you like my new dress?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你喜欢我新买的连衣裙吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve just moved into their new home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们刚刚搬进新家。

Sense.DEF: having just developed
Sense.EXAMPLE: new leaves on the trees
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 树上的嫩叶
Sense.EXAMPLE: a young man with new ideas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个有新观念的年轻人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a new generation of women writers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新一代女作家

GramExa.GLOSS: hope etc that you have only just started to feel
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 新的希望/信心/乐观态度等
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a medical breakthrough that offers new hope to cancer patients
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 给癌症患者带来新希望的医学突破

Sense.DEF: not used or owned by anyone before
Sense.EXAMPLE: New and second hand books for sale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 出售新书及二手书。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I got a used video camera for £300 – it would have cost £1,000 if I’d bought it new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我花300英镑买了一台二手摄像机﹐如果买新的要花1,000英镑。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jake arrived in his brand new completely new car.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克开着他的新车到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a spanking new completely new conference centre
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一座全新的会议中心

Sense.DEF: in excellent condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: Your watch just needs cleaning and it’ll be as good as new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的手表只要清洁一下就会跟新的一样。

Sense.DEF: not experienced before
Sense.EXAMPLE: Learning a new language is always a challenge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学习一门新的语言总是一项挑战。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Living in the city was a new experience for Philip.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在城市里生活对菲利普来说是一种新的经历。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This idea was new to him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个想法对他来说很新鲜。

GramExa.PROPFORM: that’s a new one on me
GramExa.GLOSS: used to say that you have never heard something before
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘The office is going to be closed for six weeks this summer.’‘Really? That’s a new one on me.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “办事处今年夏天要关闭六个星期。”“是吗？我还是头一次听说这事。”

Sense.DEF: having recently arrived in a place, joined an organization, or started a new job
Sense.TRAN: 新来的﹔新加入的﹔刚开始的
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re new here, aren’t you?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是新来的﹐是吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry if you make mistakes. You’re still new to the job.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别怕犯错﹐你才刚刚开始干这份工作呢。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: training for new employees
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对新员工的培训

GramExa.GLOSS: the newest person in a job, school etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s not always easy being the new kid on the block.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 当新手并非总是件轻松的事。

GramExa.GLOSS: the newest person in a job, organization etc - used humorously
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 新雇员﹔新成员〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: recently replaced or different from the previous one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you met Keith’s new girlfriend?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你见过基思新交的女朋友吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll let you have my new phone number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会告诉你我的新电话号码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new regime in the country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该国的新政权

Sense.DEF: recently discovered
Sense.EXAMPLE: the discovery of a new planet
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一颗新行星的发现
Sense.EXAMPLE: new oilfields in Alaska
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿拉斯加的新油田
Sense.EXAMPLE: important new evidence that may prove her innocence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能证明她清白的重要新证据

Sense.DEF: modern
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new breed of politicians
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新型的政治家

Sense.DEF: new potatoes, carrots etc are grown early in the season and eaten when young
a period that is just beginning, especially one that seems to offer better opportunities
Sense.EXAMPLE: They went to Australia to start a new life there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们去澳大利亚开始新的生活。

Sense.DEF: to feel much healthier and have a lot more energy than before, or to have a different attitude
Sense.EXAMPLE: I lost 19 pounds and felt like a new man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我体重减了19磅﹐感到自己像换了一个人。

Subsense.DEF: someone who has recently arrived or started work somewhere
a new baby
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The children are thrilled with the new arrival.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚出生的宝宝让孩子们非常兴奋。

Sense.DEF: new members of a group or organization who will bring new ideas and be full of energy
Sense.TRAN: 〔团体或组织中的〕新鲜血液﹐新成员﹐新生力量
Sense.EXAMPLE: What we need in this company is some new blood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们这家公司需要的是新生力量。

Sense.DEF: someone who has just started work in a high position in an organization and who is expected to make a lot of changes
Sense.TRAN: 〔期待带来变革的〕新上任官员
Sense.EXAMPLE: The company seems set to make a fresh start under a new broom.
