Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来该公司在新领导的带领下会有一个新的开始。

Sense.DEF: used as a friendly greeting to mean ‘how are you?’
new ideas, styles etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: This charming hotel is a delightful blend of the old and the new.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家漂亮的宾馆是新与旧的完美融合。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is thought to be the new fashion that will replace an existing thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t you know that vodka is the new water, my dear?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你难道不知道现在都喝伏特加代替水了吗﹐亲爱的？

Sense.DEF: recently made, formed etc
Sense.TRAN: 新造的/新建立的/新提出的等

Exponent.EXAMPLE: a new sports centre
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新的体育中心
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a new edition of the book
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该书的新版

Exponent.DEF: completely new
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a brand new car
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 簇新的车

Exponent.DEF: made, produced etc a short time ago
Exponent.EXAMPLE: recent research into brain chemistry
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新近的脑化学研究

Exponent.DEF: the most recent
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Have you seen his latest film?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看过他最新的电影了吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the latest fashions from Paris
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 来自巴黎的最新时尚

Exponent.DEF: different from earlier things of the same kind because of using new methods, equipment, or designs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: modern technology
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代技术
Exponent.EXAMPLE: modern farming methods
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代农耕方法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a modern kitchen
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现代化的厨房

Exponent.DEF: new and completely different from what other people have done or thought of before, especially in a way that seems interesting
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The play is highly original.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个剧本非常有创意。

Exponent.DEF: fresh ideas, evidence, or ways of doing things are new and different, and are used instead of previous ones
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We need a fresh approach to the problem.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要用新的办法来解决这个问题。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Police think they may have found some fresh evidence that links him to the murder.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 警方认为他们可能找到了一些新的证据﹐证明他和这宗谋杀案有关。

Exponent.DEF: new and different in a surprising and unusual way – used especially about a suggestion, experience, or way of doing something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指建议﹑经历或做事方式〕新的﹐新奇的﹐新颖的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The club have come up with a novel way of raising cash.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家俱乐部想出了一个新颖的筹资方法。

Exponent.DEF: completely new and showing a lot of imagination – used especially about a design or way of doing something
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指设计或做事方式〕创新的﹐革新的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an attractive website with an innovative design
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 设计新颖﹑有吸引力的网站

Exponent.DEF: completely new in a way that has a very big effect – used especially about an idea, method, or invention
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指观点﹑方法或发明〕革命性的﹐突破性的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a revolutionary treatment for breast cancer
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 治疗乳腺癌的突破性疗法
Exponent.EXAMPLE: His theories were considered to be revolutionary at the time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的理论在当时被认为是革命性的。

Exponent.DEF: used about something that is new and modern but which you disapprove of
Exponent.EXAMPLE: My grandfather hated all this newfangled technology.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖父讨厌所有这些新奇技术。

Sense.DEF: relating to spiritual beliefs, types of medicine, and ways of living that are not traditional Western ones
Sense.TRAN: 新潮的﹐新时代的〔指非西方传统的精神信仰﹑医学和生活方式〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the New Age movement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新时代生活运动

Sense.DEF: New Age beliefs and ways of living
Sense.TRAN: 新潮生活﹐新时代生活方式

Sense.DEF: a member of a group of people in Britain who refuse to live the way other people live in ordinary society, and go from place to place living in vehicles
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国以车为家四处漫游的〕新潮一族﹐新时代旅行者

Sense.DEF: someone who has just started doing something, especially using the Internet or computers
Sense.TRAN: 新手〔尤指使用因特网或计算机的新手〕

Sense.DEF: a child that has just been born
a house or houses that are being built, or that have been built very recently
Sense.TRAN: 正在建造[刚刚建成]的房子

Sense.DEF: someone who has only recently arrived somewhere or only recently started a particular activity

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m a relative newcomer to the retail business.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在零售行业相对来说还是个新手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a special award for the most promising newcomer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 颁发给最有前途新人的特殊奖项

Sense.DEF: something that did not exist before

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The most glamorous newcomer to the Volkswagen Golf range is the revamped GTi 16 valve.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 大众高尔夫系列最具魅力的新车型是经改良的GTi 16缸气门款。

Sense.DEF: an economic system that is based on computers and modern technology, and is therefore dependent on educated workers
Sense.TRAN: 〔依赖计算机﹑现代科技和高素质员工的〕新经济
Sense.EXAMPLE: As we move into a new economy, trade unions will have to reinvent themselves to stay relevant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向新经济转型时﹐工会也必须革新以免落伍。

Sense.DEF: recently designed or produced - usually used to show disapproval or distrust
Sense.TRAN: 新设计的﹔新生产的﹔新奇的〔一般含贬义或表示不信任〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: newfangled ideas about children’s education
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于儿童教育的新奇想法

Sense.DEF: recently obtained, found, or achieved
Sense.EXAMPLE: He enjoyed his new-found freedom.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很享受才获得的自由。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the children’s new-found friends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们新结识的朋友

Sense.DEF: a young man whose attitudes and behaviour are a reaction to those of the New Man. New Lads do not feel embarrassed about enjoying traditionally male activities such as drinking too much alcohol, playing or watching sport, making rude jokes, and looking at pictures of attractive women.
Sense.TRAN: 新派青年〔思想和行为与“新派男子”(New Man)相反的年轻人〕

Sense.DEF: different from before, especially more modern or more attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new-look Labour party
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 以新面貌出现的工党
Sense.EXAMPLE: the new-look football team
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 面貌焕然一新的足球队

Sense.DEF: elected etc very recently
Sense.TRAN: 新当选的/新成立的/刚到的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: the newly appointed director
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新任命的董事
Sense.EXAMPLE: newly fallen snow
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚下的雪

Sense.DEF: a man and a woman who have recently married
a man who is considered to be very modern because he shares the work of looking after his children, cooking, cleaning the home etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔分担家务及照料子女的〕新派男子

Sense.DEF: things such as the Internet, DVDs etc that use very modern technology
people who have become rich by working, rather than by getting money from their families
Sense.TRAN: 新富﹐新贵〔指不是靠继承家庭财产﹐而是通过自己努力而致富的人〕

Sense.DEF: money that makes someone rich and that is recently earned, rather than from their families
Sense.TRAN: 新钱〔指不是继承来的﹐而是最近赚得的发家致富的钱〕

Sense.DEF: the moon when it first appears in the sky as a thin crescent
the time of the month at which the moon is first seen
a small potato that is taken from the ground early, and that has a very good taste
people who have recently become very rich, as opposed to people whose families have always been rich
information about something that has happened recently
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope to have some good news for you soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望很快就能给你好消息。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We are delighted at the news that our daughter is expecting a baby.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 听到女儿就要生宝宝的消息﹐我们很高兴。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s the latest news on your university application?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的大学申请有什么最新消息吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Everyone is shocked by the news of the arrests.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 每个人都对逮捕的消息感到震惊。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: News is an uncountable noun. Use singular forms with it, not plural ones.
F2NBox.TRAN: news是不可数名词﹐要和单数形式连用﹐不可与复数形式连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The news was good (NOT不说 were good).
I was surprised by this news (NOT不说 these news).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我听到这个消息很吃惊 。

Sense.DEF: reports of recent events in the newspapers or on the radio or television
Sense.EXAMPLE: a late evening news broadcast
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚间新闻节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve got the news headlines coming up at half past twelve.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 12点半我们将播放新闻提要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a news and current affairs programme
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻时事节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: Here’s the sports news from Jane Murray.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下面是简．默里发来的体育新闻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the latest news from the Olympic stadium
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 从奥林匹克体育场传来的最新消息

GramExa.EXAMPLE: news on the latest developments in the talks
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于会谈最新进展的新闻

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Several evening papers carried the news that a cabinet minister was about to resign.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好几家晚报报道了一名内阁部长将要辞职的消息。

GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 当地/地区/国内/国际新闻

Sense.EXAMPLE: Twenty years ago environmental issues rarely made the news were considered important enough to be in the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 20年前﹐环境问题很少成为新闻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Hong Kong is in the news this morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天上午的新闻中报道了香港。

Sense.EXAMPLE: His resignation was front page news was important news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的辞职成了头版新闻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Never before has a news story triggered such sensational sales of the newspaper.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从来没有一则新闻报道能给这份报纸带来如此令人振奋的销量。

Sense.DEF: a regular television or radio programme that gives you reports of recent events
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或电台的〕新闻报道﹐新闻节目
Sense.EXAMPLE: the ten o’clock news
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十点新闻播报
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s watch the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看看新闻节目吧。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Be quiet. I want to listen to the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安静点﹐我要听听新闻。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It must be true – I heard it on the news last night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这肯定是真的﹐我昨晚在新闻节目中听到的。

GramExa.GLOSS: turn the television or radio on for the news
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 打开电视[广播]收看[收听]新闻

Sense.DEF: if the facts about something are good or bad news for someone, they are likely to make life better or worse for them
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no legal market for African ivory, which is good news for the elephants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非洲象牙没有合法的交易市场﹐这对大象来说是个福音。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is likely to cause trouble
Sense.TRAN: 他/她是个祸星〔指某人可能会带来麻烦〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Stay away from that guy, he’s bad news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 离那家伙远一点﹐他不是个好东西。

Sense.DEF: if someone or something is news, people are interested in them at the moment and want to know about them
Sense.EXAMPLE: European fashions are big news right now in the States.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲时尚目前正风靡美国。

Sense.DEF: used when you are surprised or annoyed because you have not been told something earlier
Sense.TRAN: 我一点都不知道！〔表示惊讶或生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘The meeting’s been cancelled.’ ‘That’s news to me!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “会议取消了。”“我一点都不知道！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you are going to tell someone the facts about something, which they will probably not like to hear
Sense.TRAN: 我有消息要告诉你〔可能是对方不愿意听的消息〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You may think I’m finished, but I’ve got news for you – I’ll be back.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你可能认为我完蛋了——不过告诉你﹐我会卷土重来的。

Sense.DEF: used when you have not received any news about someone and you hope this means that nothing bad has happened

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He’s feeling much better, so that’s good news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他感觉好很多了﹐这是个好消息。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: They’re getting married? That’s wonderful news!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们要结婚了？这是好消息啊！

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: good news that makes you happy

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m afraid I have bad news,’ said Jackson.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: “恐怕我带来了坏消息。”杰克逊说。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very bad
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Have you heard the terrible news about Simon?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你听说西蒙的不幸消息了吗？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Mom sent a letter with all the latest news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈来信告知所有的近况。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: news that you have already heard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She wasn’t surprised; it was old news to her.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她并不吃惊﹔这对她来说不是新闻。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’ve got some important news to tell you.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有重要消息要告诉你。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: an important piece of news
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The big news is that Polly and Richard are going to get married.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个大新闻——波莉和理查德要结婚了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I could tell by his face that he had some news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从他脸上看出来﹐他有什么消息。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Jack called him to tell him the good news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克打电话告诉他这个好消息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell someone some bad news
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Two policemen came to the door to break the news about her husband.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 两名警察上门报告了有关她丈夫的坏消息。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: tell a lot of people the news
Collocate.EXAMPLE: After she had the baby, her husband made phone calls to spread the happy news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她生下孩子后﹐她丈夫到处打电话报告喜讯。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: hear about something that has happened
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was really upset when she heard the news.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她听到这个消息非常难过。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: say that you are pleased about some news
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Environmental groups welcomed the news that the area would be protected.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 环保组织对这个地区将受到保护的消息表示欢迎。

Collocate.COLLOC: greet the news with surprise/delight etc
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: react to the news in a particular way
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 听到消息感到吃惊/高兴等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Fans greeted the news of the victory with a loud cheer.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 球迷们听到获胜的消息大声欢呼起来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a lot of people find out the news from other people
Collocate.EXAMPLE: News spreads fast in a small town.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 小镇里消息传得很快。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Leo thought about this piece of news carefully.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 利奥仔细地想了想这个消息。

Collocate.COLLOC: the good news is ..., the bad news is ...
Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to introduce a piece of good and bad news
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The good news is that most stores have the game in stock; the bad news is that it’s not cheap.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 好消息是大多数商店都有这个游戏﹐坏消息是这个游戏价格不菲。

Sense.DEF: an organization that collects news stories and supplies them to newspapers, radio, and television
someone who owns or works in a shop that sells newspapers, magazines, sweets and cigarettes
a shop which sells newspapers, magazines, sweets and cigarettes
a period of time when news about a particular event is not allowed to be reported
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Indian government has imposed a news blackout.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 印度政府实施了一次新闻封锁。

Sense.DEF: a short news programme on radio or television, reporting only the most important information
a very short news programme on radio or television, broadcast suddenly in the middle of another programme when something very important has happened
Sense.TRAN: 新闻快讯〔指插在电台或电视其他节目中播出的重要新闻〕

Sense.DEF: a news programme on radio or television
someone who reads the news on radio or television
Sense.TRAN: 〔电台或电视的〕新闻播音员﹐新闻播报员

Sense.DEF: using new ideas in a type of music or art
Sense.EXAMPLE: new school hip hop artists
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新流派嘻哈乐艺人

Sense.DEF: a meeting at which someone, especially someone famous or important, speaks to people who work for newspapers or news programmes
Sense.TRAN: 记者招待会﹐新闻发布会
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman told a news conference that some members of staff would lose their jobs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 董事长在一次新闻发布会上宣布将要裁员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At a news conference yesterday, the two men described their ordeal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 在昨天的记者招待会上﹐那两名男子描述了他们的可怕经历。

Sense.DEF: a very short news programme on radio or television, broadcast suddenly in the middle of another programme when something very important has happened
Sense.TRAN: 新闻快讯〔指插在电台或电视其他节目中播出的重要新闻〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We interrupt this programme to bring you a newsflash.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们暂时中断本节目﹐向大家插播一条新闻快讯。

Sense.DEF: a discussion group on the Internet, with a place where people with a shared interest can exchange messages
Sense.TRAN: 〔网上兴趣相投的人互换信息的〕新闻组﹐专题讨论组

Sense.DEF: someone who collects information for a newspaper or news programme
a short written report of news about a club, organization etc that is sent regularly to people who are interested
Sense.TRAN: 〔俱乐部﹑团体等给特定读者定期寄发的〕通讯﹐简报
Sense.EXAMPLE: The society publishes a newsletter twice a year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该社团一年出版两次简报。

Sense.DEF: someone who writes or reports news for a newspaper, radio, or television
a set of large folded sheets of printed paper containing news, articles, pictures, advertisements etc which is sold daily or weekly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had read about it in the newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于这件事她已经在报纸上看到了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a series of newspaper articles about life in Cuba
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刊登在报纸上的一系列关于古巴生活的文章

Sense.DEF: sheets of paper from old newspapers
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wrap the plates in newspaper to stop them from breaking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用旧报纸把盘子包起来﹐免得打碎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bella laid the flowers out carefully on a sheet of newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贝拉小心地把花摊开放在一张报纸上。

Sense.DEF: a company that produces a newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLE: He works for a local newspaper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在本地的一家报社工作。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Which newspaper do you read?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看什么报纸？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: buy one regularly
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We don’t get a newspaper; we tend to watch the news on TV.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们不买报纸﹐一般都看电视新闻。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I saw in the newspaper that he had died.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在报纸上看到他死了。

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 出现在报纸上﹐登上报纸
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her photo appeared in all the newspapers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的照片登上了所有的报纸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: has an article on something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The newspapers reported that the police were treating the death as a suicide.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上报道说﹐警方把这起死亡事件作为自杀处理。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The story was in all the national newspapers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事上了所有的全国性报纸。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The store advertises in the local newspaper.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店在当地的报纸上做了广告。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that is published every day/week/Sunday
a small-sized newspaper, especially one with not much serious news
a newspaper with a lot of serious news and good writing

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I read quite an interesting newspaper report on the war.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在报纸上看到一则关于这场战争的很有趣的报道。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: ‘Wine is good for you,’ announced a recent newspaper headline.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近有报纸的大标题称:“葡萄酒有利健康。”

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a regular article in a newspaper written by a particular journalist
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She writes a regular newspaper column about gardening.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在写一个园艺方面的定期专栏。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a story cut out of a newspaper
owner

Exponent.EXAMPLE: The New York Times is a popular daily newspaper.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 《纽约时报》是一份畅销的日报。

Exponent.DEF: a newspaper. Paper is more common than newspaper in everyday English.
Exponent.TRAN: 报纸〔在日常英语中比newspaper常用〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There was an interesting article in the local paper today.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 今天本地报纸上登了一篇有趣的文章。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the Sunday papers
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期日报纸

Exponent.DEF: newspapers and news magazines in general, and the people who write for them
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the freedom of the press
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻自由

Exponent.DEF: newspapers, magazines, television, radio, and the Internet, considered as a group that provides news and information
Exponent.EXAMPLE: This issue has received a lot of attention in the media.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一问题获得媒体的大量关注。

Exponent.DEF: a newspaper that has small pages, a lot of photographs, short stories, and not much serious news
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The tabloids are full of stories about her and her boyfriend.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 通俗小报上全是有关她和她男友的报道。

Exponent.DEF: a serious newspaper printed on large sheets of paper, with news about politics, finance, and foreign affairs
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the quality broadsheets
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 严肃的大报

Sense.DEF: someone who writes or reports news for a newspaper
a newsstand
cheap paper used mostly for printing newspapers on
someone who reads the news on television or radio
Sense.TRAN: 〔电视或电台的〕新闻播音员﹐新闻播报员

Sense.DEF: a short film of news that was shown in cinemas in the past
Sense.TRAN: 〔旧时在电影院播放的〕新闻短片

Sense.DEF: an official statement giving information to the newspapers, radio, and television
Sense.EXAMPLE: The University has issued a news release announcing the results of their experiments.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该大学发表了一篇新闻稿﹐公布他们的实验结果。

Sense.DEF: the office in a newspaper or broadcasting company where news is received and news reports are written
Sense.TRAN: 〔报社或广播公司的〕新闻编辑室

Sense.DEF: a small newspaper with only a few pages
a place on a street where newspapers and magazines are sold
a woman who writes or reports for a newspaper, radio, or television
important or interesting enough to be reported in newspapers, on the radio, or on television
Sense.TRAN: 有新闻价值的﹐值得报道的
Sense.EXAMPLE: newsworthy events
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 值得报道的事件

Sense.DEF: a newsy letter is from a friend or relative and contains a lot of interesting news
a small animal with a long body, short legs, and a tail, which lives partly in water and partly on land
the part of the Bible which describes the life of Jesus Christ and what he taught, and the life of the first Christians
relating to the laws of physics that were discovered by the scientist Isaac Newton
Sense.EXAMPLE: Newtonian mechanics
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 牛顿力学

Sense.DEF: one of several complete towns built in Britain since 1946
Sense.TRAN: 〔英国自1946年以来建立的〕新市镇

Sense.DEF: a brain disease that kills people, which may be caused by eating beef that is affected by bse
a group of people who try to introduce new ideas in music, films, art, politics etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔在音乐﹑电影﹑艺术﹑政治等方面引入新观念的〕新浪潮(派)

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a new wave of feminism in the sixties and early seventies
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: (20世纪)60年代和70年代初的一轮女权主义新浪潮

Sense.DEF: a type of music that was popular in the 1970s and early 1980s, which uses synthesizers and a strong beat, and in which the words are sung without much emotion
Sense.TRAN: 新浪潮音乐〔流行于20世纪70年代和80年代初〕

Subsense.DEF: North, Central, and South America
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Christopher Columbus’s voyage of discovery to the New World
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯托弗．哥伦布发现新大陆的航程

Subsense.DEF: wines from the New World are from non-European countries such as South Africa, New Zealand, and the United States
Subsense.TRAN: 新世界的酒〔产自非欧洲国家﹐例如南非﹑新西兰和美国〕

Sense.DEF: the time when people celebrate the beginning of a new year
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re going to spend Christmas and the New Year with my parents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们打算和我父母一起过圣诞节和新年。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business will be closed over New Year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新年期间公司不营业。

GramExa.GLOSS: used as a greeting

Sense.EXAMPLE: Our neighbours invited us round to see in the new year celebrate the beginning of the year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 邻居邀请我们去他们家迎新年。

Sense.DEF: the first few weeks of the year
Sense.EXAMPLE: Prices are expected to go up in the new year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 预计新年伊始物价会上涨。

Sense.DEF: a decision to do something better or to stop doing something bad in the new year
Sense.EXAMPLE: I haven’t made any New Year resolutions – I never stick to them anyway.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还没有下新年决心——反正我从来都做不到。

Sense.DEF: 1st January, the first day of the year
31st December, the last day of the year
someone from New Zealand
the next event, day, time etc is the one that happens after the present one, or the previous one
Sense.EXAMPLE: I just missed my flight to Chicago. When’s the next one?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我刚错过去芝加哥的航班。下一班是几点钟？
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll look at the proposals at the next meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一次会议我们要研究一下这些提议。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over the next couple of months, try to relax more and get more exercise.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来的几个月里﹐要尽量多放松﹑多运动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping to open the factory some time next year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望工厂能在明年某个时候开工。

GramExa.GLOSS: on or during the following day, week etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She called me and we arranged to meet the next day.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她给我打了电话﹐我们约好第二天见面。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Next time I go skiing, I’ll wear warmer clothes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一次去滑雪的时候﹐我要穿得暖和一点。

Sense.DEF: the next house, room, place etc is the one that is nearest to where you are now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn left at the next corner.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下一个拐角向左转。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We could hear them arguing in the next room.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们能听到他们在隔壁房间里争论。

Sense.DEF: the next person or thing in a list, series etc comes after the one that you are dealing with now
Sense.EXAMPLE: Read the next two chapters before Friday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五之前看完接下来的两章。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do they have the next size up a slightly bigger size?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们有没有大一号的尺寸？

Sense.DEF: almost as big, more common etc than the one you are talking about
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cancer-related diseases are the next biggest killers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 与癌症相关的疾病是第二大杀手。

Sense.DEF: the thing or situation that is almost as good as the one you really want
Sense.TRAN: 仅次于最好的东西[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: If I can’t be home for Christmas, phoning you on the day is the next best thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果圣诞节我回不了家﹐就退而求其次﹐到那天给你打个电话。

Sense.LEXUNIT: the next thing I/she etc knew
Sense.DEF: used when something surprising happens very suddenly
Sense.EXAMPLE: The next thing I knew, I was lying face down on the pavement.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 等我反应过来时﹐我已经趴在人行道上了。

Sense.DEF: as any other man or person
Sense.EXAMPLE: I am as keen to do well as the next man.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我像别人一样渴望自己能干得出色。

Sense.DEF: immediately afterwards
Sense.EXAMPLE: With John here, you never know what will happen next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有约翰在这里﹐你永远都不会知道接下来会发生什么事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next, put it in the oven for 20 minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 然后把它放到烤箱里烤20分钟。

Sense.DEF: the next time
Sense.EXAMPLE: When I next saw her she completely ignored me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我再次见到她时﹐她压根儿没有理我。

Sense.DEF: the person or thing in a list, series etc that comes after the person or thing you are dealing with now
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s next on the shopping list?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 购物单上的下一项是什么？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who will be the next to go?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁是下一个？

Sense.DEF: the day, week etc that follows the next one
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you remembered it’s Susie’s birthday the week after next?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你还记得下下个星期是苏茜的生日吗？

Sense.DEF: the one before the last one
Sense.EXAMPLE: the next to last day of their visit
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们来访结束前的一天

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that it is now their turn to speak or their turn to do something
to be the next person, especially to have a job or position
in the house, room etc next to yours or someone else’s
Sense.EXAMPLE: the boy next door
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁的男孩
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her office is just next door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的办公室就在隔壁。

Sense.DEF: next to another building, room etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: They live next door to the shop.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在商店的隔壁。

Sense.DEF: the people living in the house or apartment next to yours
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you seen next door’s new car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看到隔壁邻居的新车了吗？

Sense.DEF: the person who lives in the house or apartment next to yours
the apartment etc that is next to yours
your closest living relative or relatives
Sense.EXAMPLE: May I have your name, address and next of kin, please?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请告诉我您的姓名﹑住址和直系亲属。

Sense.DEF: very close to someone or something, with no other person, building place, etc in between
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a little girl sitting next to him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有个小女孩坐在他旁边。

Sense.DEF: very little
Sense.EXAMPLE: He knows next to nothing about antiques.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他对古董几乎一窍不通。

Sense.DEF: used to give a list of things you like, hate etc in order to say what is first on the list
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next to soccer, I like playing tennis best.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢踢足球﹐其次是打网球。

Sense.DEF: in comparison with someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Next to her, I’m a very poor cook.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和她比起来﹐我的厨艺太差了。

Sense.DEF: almost impossible, useless etc
Sense.TRAN: 几乎不可能的/几乎没有用的等
Sense.EXAMPLE: This crossword puzzle is next to impossible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个纵横字谜几乎不可能做出来。

Sense.DEF: a connection or network of connections between a number of people, things, or ideas
Sense.TRAN: 〔人﹑事物或思想之间的〕关系﹐关联﹐联系﹐联结

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nexus of social relationships
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 错综复杂的社会关系

Sense.DEF: the organization in charge of the highest level of professional American football in the US. The NFL consists of two leaguesgroups of teams who play against each other , the National Football Conference (NFC) and the American Football Conference (AFC). Every year, the teams that win these leagues play each other in the Super Bowl.
an organization which helps people, protects the environment etc and which is not run by a government

the organization in charge of the highest level of professional ice hockey in the US and Canada. The NHL consists of two leaguesgroups of teams who play against each other, the Eastern Conference and the Western Conference. Every year, the teams that win these leagues play each other in the Stanley Cup.
Sense.TRAN: 〔美国和加拿大的〕国家冰球联盟

Sense.DEF: the British system that provides free medical treatment for everyone, and is paid for by taxes
Sense.TRAN: 国民医疗服务体系〔英国的一种免费医疗制度〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: NHS hospitals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 国民医疗服务体系覆盖的医院

GramExa.GLOSS: free from the NHS
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 由国民医疗服务体系支付
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Can I get my glasses on the NHS?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我配眼镜可以由国民医疗服务体系支付吗？

Sense.DEF: a type of vitamin that is good for your skin and your nervous system
Sense.TRAN: 烟酸〔一种有益于皮肤和神经系统的维生素〕

Sense.DEF: the pointed metal part at the end of a pen
someone in authority or someone who thinks they are important
Sense.TRAN: 上司﹔要人﹔自以为了不起的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: And how’s his nibs this morning?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么这位大人物今天上午怎样了？

Sense.DEF: to eat small amounts of food by taking very small bites
Sense.EXAMPLE: He nibbled the biscuit cautiously.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他小心地啃着饼干。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a fish nibbling at my bait.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有条鱼正在咬我的鱼饵。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He nibbled on a piece of raw carrot.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他啃着一根生胡萝卜。

Sense.DEF: to gently bite someone in a loving way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He began to nibble her ear affectionately.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他开始深情地轻咬她的耳朵。

Sense.DEF: to take away small amounts of something so that the total amount is gradually reduced
Sense.EXAMPLE: All these expenses are nibbling away at our savings.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有这些开支正在一点一点地耗掉我们的积蓄。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Scottish National Party is beginning to nibble away at Labour’s majority.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏格兰民族党正开始一步步削弱工党的多数派地位。

Sense.DEF: a small bite of something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She took a nibble of her cookie.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她咬了一小口曲奇。

Sense.DEF: small things to eat, like crisps and peanuts, especially at a party
Sense.TRAN: 少量食品﹔〔尤指聚会上的〕小吃

Sense.DEF: a small amount of interest in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve had the house on the market for a month and not even had a nibble yet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们把房子挂牌出售一个月了﹐至今仍无人问津。

Sense.DEF: a type of battery that can be recharged, and that is used in cameras and small electronic equipment
pleasant, attractive, or enjoyable
Sense.TRAN: 令人愉快的﹐吸引人的﹐美好的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve got a very nice house.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的房子真漂亮。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you have a nice time?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们玩得开心吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s such a nice day good weather, why not go for a swim?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气真好﹐为什么不去游泳呢？
Sense.EXAMPLE: What a nice surprise!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 真是个惊喜！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You look nice in that suit.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你穿那套西装看上去不错。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Mm, something smells nice!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐什么东西那么香！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nice long holiday
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 愉快的悠长假期
GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nice new car
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的新车

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The house seemed nice and tidy.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这房子看上去非常整洁。

Sense.EXAMPLE: One of the nice things about Christmas is having all the family together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 圣诞节的一个好处是全家可以聚首一堂。
Sense.HINTTRAN: You can use nice and followed by another adjective after be. 在be之后可以跟nice and加另一个形容词: The weather was nice and warm. 天气暖洋洋的。 But before a noun you must leave out ‘and’. 但是用在名词之前则必须省略and: a nice hot (NOT不说nice and hot) drink 一杯热腾腾的饮料

Sense.DEF: friendly, kind, or polite
Sense.EXAMPLE: Dave’s a really nice guy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫是个很友善的人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s not a very nice thing to say about your sister!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这么说你姐姐不太好吧！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Tim spilt wine all over the sofa, but Martha was very nice about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆把酒洒得沙发上都是﹐不过玛莎对此很宽容。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They were very nice to me while I was ill.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我生病的时候他们对我很好。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is nice of sb (to do sth)
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It was nice of you to help.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你帮了忙﹐真好。

Sense.EXAMPLE: He told me, in the nicest possible way, that I was interfering too much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他尽可能客气地告诉我﹐我干涉得太多了。

Sense.DEF: used to say what you like or what you think would be good or useful
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s quite nice to live so close to work.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 住得离上班地点那么近真是件好事。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is nice to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It would be nice to have a break.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 要是能休息一下就好了。

GramExa.GLOSS: used to accept an offer or agree with a suggestion
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 太好了〔用于接受别人的提议〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you like a cup of coffee?’ ‘Yes, that’d be nice.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “要喝杯咖啡吗？”“是的﹐太好了。”

Sense.EXAMPLE: I thought it would be a nice idea to send them some flowers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得给他们送些花是个好主意。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It would be nice if you could let us know in advance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你能事先通知我们﹐那就好了。

Sense.DEF: used to mean that you feel happier when you know something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I still haven’t heard any news – it would be nice to know what’s happening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我还是没有得到任何消息﹐要是能知道发生了什么事就好了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s nice to know that there’s someone nearby if she needs help.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 知道当她需要帮助的时候有人在她身边﹐这样就放心了。

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye to someone, especially to customers in shops and restaurants when they are leaving
Sense.TRAN: 谢谢光临！ 再见！〔尤为商店店员﹑餐厅服务员向顾客告别时的用语〕

Sense.DEF: used as a friendly greeting when you meet someone for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 很高兴认识你〔初次见面时的礼貌用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hello. It’s nice to meet you at last.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你好。 终于见到你了﹐我真高兴。

Sense.DEF: used when you say goodbye to someone you have met for the first time
Sense.TRAN: 能认识你真高兴〔初次见面后的告别用语〕

Sense.DEF: used in a humorous or angry way when you really think that something or someone is not at all good or pleasant
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a nice way to treat a friend, I must say!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得说﹐你这样对待朋友太不像话了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well, we’re in a nice mess now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀﹐我们现在搞得一团糟。

Sense.DEF: used when someone has made a guess or suggestion, or has attempted to do something, to say that it is good, but not quite correct or successful
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘We could phone Mark to come and pick us up.’ ‘Nice try, Clive, but we haven’t got his number.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们可以给马克打电话让他来接我们。”“这主意好是好﹐克莱夫﹐不过我们没有他的电话号码。”

Sense.DEF: used when someone has just said or done something clever, amusing, or helpful
Sense.TRAN: 真聪明！ 真好笑！ 好极了！
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Dad said he’d help pay for it.’ ‘Nice one!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “爸爸说他会帮我们付账。”“太好了！”

Sense.DEF: if someone is as nice as pie, they are not angry with you when you were expecting them to be
Sense.TRAN: 非常友好﹔〔出乎意料地〕没有生气

Sense.LEXUNIT: nice work if you can get it
Sense.DEF: used humorously to say that someone has a very easy or enjoyable job, especially one which you would like to do
Sense.TRAN: 〔认为对方的工作轻松有趣〕能有这样的好事就好了〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: involving a very small difference or detail
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice point of law
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律上的微妙难断之处

Sense.DEF: having high standards of moral and social behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s a nice girl like you doing in a place like this?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你这样一个正派姑娘在这种地方干什么？

Sense.DEF: used when saying that part of something is good or well done, but a more important part is bad or badly done
Sense.TRAN: 〔一部分〕是好的﹐不过〔更重要的那部分〕不好
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nice video, shame about the song.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 录像倒是不错﹐不过歌曲不怎么样。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The first thing you noticed about him was his niceness.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 你对他的第一印象是他为人和善。

Exponent.DEF: friendly, kind, or polite. In written and formal English, it is better to use a more specific and interesting adjective than nice.
Exponent.TRAN: 友善的﹐友好的﹐礼貌的〔在书面语中和正式场合最好使用更明确生动的形容词〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I like Clare – she’s really nice.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我喜欢克莱尔她人非常好。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was nice of them to offer to help.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们很好﹐主动说帮忙。

Exponent.DEF: friendly, polite, and easy to talk to – used especially about someone that you do not know very well
Exponent.TRAN: 〔尤指不太熟悉的人〕友好的﹐讨人喜欢的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I only met her once or twice but she seemed pleasant.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我只见过她一两次﹐不过她好像人不错。

Exponent.DEF: very kind and gentle
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Kylie’s a very caring, sweet person.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯莉是个非常体贴善良的人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was sweet of you to send me a card.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你太好了﹐给我寄来贺卡。

Exponent.DEF: behaving in a polite and friendly way, which makes people like you and want to do things for you
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The salesman was very charming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 销售员非常礼貌客气。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a charming hostess
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 细心周到的女主人

Exponent.DEF: interesting or amusing in a way that makes people like you – a rather formal word
Exponent.TRAN: 动人的﹐迷人的〔比较正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She can be very engaging.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有时候非常可爱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an engaging smile
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 迷人的微笑

Exponent.DEF: easy to like and seeming nice and friendly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Bobby was a likeable kid with an angelic face.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 博比是个讨人喜欢的孩子﹐长着一张天使般的面孔。

Exponent.DEF: having a nice kind character and not getting angry easily
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Everyone likes Mike because he’s always so good-natured.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都喜欢迈克﹐因为他总是脾气很好。

Exponent.DEF: used about someone who you like and admire a lot
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He’s a great guy!
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个了不起的家伙！

Exponent.DEF: very nice, kind, and friendly
Exponent.EXAMPLE: All the people I met on the course were lovely.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上这门课遇到的人都很可爱。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a lovely man
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 友善的男人

Section.SECHEADING: DESCRIBING SOMETHING YOU LIKE OR ENJOY 形容所喜欢的事物

Exponent.DEF: pleasant or enjoyable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Did you have a nice day?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你今天玩得开心吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was nice to be back home again.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 又回家了﹐真好。

Exponent.DEF: very nice
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had a lovely time at the beach.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在沙滩上玩得非常开心。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The hotel was lovely.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 那酒店非常好。

Exponent.DEF: if something is fun, you enjoy it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The holiday was great fun.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 假期非常有趣。

Exponent.DEF: giving you pleasure
Exponent.TRAN: 令人愉快的﹐使人快乐的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We had a very enjoyable evening.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们度过了一个非常愉快的夜晚。

Exponent.DEF: very enjoyable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It was a wonderful concert.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一场非常棒的音乐会。

Exponent.DEF: very enjoyable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: ‘How was the party?’ ‘It was great!’
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: “聚会怎么样？”“棒极了！”
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We all had a brilliant time.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们大家都玩得非常开心。

Exponent.DEF: used about something that seems pleasant and has a lot of qualities that make you like it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a charming little village in the Italian countryside
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 意大利乡间一座迷人的小村庄
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I thought the restaurant was rather charming.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得这家餐馆非常不错。

Exponent.DEF: very pleasant or enjoyable
Exponent.EXAMPLE: There are many delightful walks in the area.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区有许多宜人的步行小道。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: a delightful evening
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 惬意的夜晚

Exponent.DEF: a pleasurable experience or feeling is one that you enjoy
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Shopping in the old city can be a pleasurable experience.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在老城区购物有时是一种愉快的体验。

Sense.DEF: attractive
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice-looking young man
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英俊的小伙子
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nice-looking car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 漂亮的汽车

Sense.DEF: in a satisfactory, pleasant, or attractive way
Sense.TRAN: 令人满意地﹔令人愉快地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was handsome and nicely dressed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他相貌英俊﹐衣着考究。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The table fits in nicely with the rest of the furniture.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 桌子和其他家具非常相配。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The wound healed up nicely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 伤口愈合得很好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The garden’s coming along very nicely now it is growing well.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花园里的花草现在长得很好。

Sense.DEF: in a pleasant, polite, or friendly way
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m sure he’ll help if you ask him nicely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敢肯定如果你好好求他﹐他会帮忙的。

Sense.DEF: to be successful and be earning a lot of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: The business is doing quite nicely.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 生意很兴隆。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Ed’s doing very nicely for himself out in Japan.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃德在日本干得很好。

Sense.DEF: used when saying that something is very suitable and is just what you want
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Will cheese sandwiches be okay?’ ‘Yes, that’ll do nicely.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “干酪三明治行不行？”“行﹐非常好。”

Sense.DEF: exactly or carefully
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nicely calculated distance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精确计算出的距离

Sense.DEF: a small detail or point of difference, especially one that is usually considered to be part of the correct way of doing something
Sense.TRAN: 细微区别﹔细微之处﹔细节
Sense.EXAMPLE: social niceties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社交上的细节
Sense.EXAMPLE: legal niceties
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法律细节

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the niceties of political diplomacy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治外交方面的细微之处

Sense.DEF: exactly
if you find your niche, you find a job or activity that is very suitable for you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Amanda soon found her niche at the club.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阿曼达很快就在俱乐部里找到了一份理想的工作。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s managed to create a niche for himself in local politics.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他终于在当地政坛闯出了一方天地。

Sense.DEF: an opportunity to sell a product or service to a particular group of people who have similar needs, interests etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品或服务的〕商机﹔市场定位

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He spotted a niche in the market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发现了市场中的一个商机。

Sense.DEF: a hollow place in a wall, often made to hold a statue
relating to selling goods to a particular small group of people who have similar needs, interests etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: niche marketing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对性营销
Sense.EXAMPLE: a niche market
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小众市场
Sense.EXAMPLE: a niche product
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 针对特定群体的产品

Sense.DEF: just before it is too late, or just before something bad happens
Sense.EXAMPLE: Luckily, help arrived in the nick of time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 幸运的是援兵及时到来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: in good nick/in bad nick etc
Sense.DEF: in good condition or in bad condition
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s an old car but it’s still in good nick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是辆旧车﹐但性能仍然不错。

Sense.DEF: a very small cut made on the edge or surface of something
a police station
to steal something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone’s nicked my wallet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人偷了我的钱包。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You nicked those pens from my desk.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你从我的书桌上偷走了那些钢笔。

Sense.DEF: to make a small cut in the surface or edge of something, usually by accident
Sense.EXAMPLE: He nicked his hand on some broken glass.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他被一些碎玻璃割破了手。

Sense.DEF: if the police nick you, they catch you and charge you with a crime
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re nicked!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你被捕了！

Sense.DEF: a hard silver-white metal that is often combined with other metals, for example to make steel. It is a chemical element : symbol Ni
Sense.TRAN: 镍〔一种化学元素﹐符号为Ni〕

Sense.DEF: a coin in the US or Canada that is worth five cents
to not give enough attention or money to something, with the result that it is not dealt with effectively
Sense.TRAN: 漫不经心地对待﹔吝啬地处理

Sense.DEF: unimportant or involving little money
Sense.TRAN: 不重要的﹔只涉及小钱的

Sense.DEF: a name given to someone, especially by their friends or family, that is not their real name and is often connected with what they look like or something they have done
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指给朋友或家人取的〕绰号﹐外号﹔诨名

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We had nicknames for all the teachers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们给所有老师都起了外号。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Stephen earned himself the nickname Hawkeye.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯蒂芬得了个“鹰眼”的绰号。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She was nicknamed Sunny because of her happy nature.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因生性快乐而被人叫做“开心果”。

Sense.DEF: a substance in tobacco which makes it difficult for people to stop smoking
a small piece of material containing nicotine which you stick on your skin to help you stop smoking
Sense.TRAN: 〔贴在皮肤上帮助戒烟的〕尼古丁贴片﹐戒烟贴

Sense.DEF: the use of products that contain a small amount of nicotine,for example nicotine patches, to help people stop smoking
Sense.TRAN: 〔帮助戒烟的〕尼古丁替代疗法

Sense.DEF: the daughter of your brother or sister, or the daughter of your wife’s or husband’s brother or sister
something that is nifty is good because it is clever, skilful, or effective
Sense.TRAN: 精巧的﹔有技巧的﹔有效的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nifty little gadget for squeezing oranges
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个榨橙汁的精巧小玩意儿

Sense.DEF: a niggardly gift, amount, salary etc is much too small and is given unwillingly
Sense.EXAMPLE: niggardly wages
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 微薄的工资
Sense.EXAMPLE: a niggardly 2% increase
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仅仅2%的增长

Sense.DEF: unwilling to spend money or be generous
Sense.EXAMPLE: a niggardly person
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吝啬的人

Sense.DEF: a very offensive word for a black person. Do not use this word.
if something niggles you, you keep worrying about it or feeling annoyed about it and you cannot forget it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Something’s been niggling her all day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有什么事烦了她一整天。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It niggles me that we can’t go home yet and get warm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很生气﹐我们到现在还不能回家暖和暖和。

Sense.DEF: to argue or make criticisms about small unimportant details
Sense.EXAMPLE: She niggled over every detail of the bill.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 账单上的每个细节她都要挑刺。

Sense.DEF: a slight feeling
Sense.EXAMPLE: a niggle of doubt
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一丝疑虑

Sense.DEF: a slight criticism or complaint
a slight physical pain
Sense.EXAMPLE: a niggle in his knee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他膝盖上轻微的疼痛

Sense.DEF: a slight doubt etc that you cannot stop thinking about
Sense.TRAN: 使人心烦的疑虑/担心/怀疑等

Sense.DEF: a niggling injury or problem is a slight one that does not go away
Sense.TRAN: 〔伤害或问题不严重却不断〕烦人的﹐隐隐不去的

Sense.DEF: almost
Sense.EXAMPLE: There were nigh on 40 people there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里有近40个人。

Sense.DEF: near or soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Winter draws nigh will start soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冬天即将来临。

Sense.DEF: the dark part of each 24-hour period when the sun cannot be seen and when most people sleep
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was a cold moonlit night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是个寒冷的月夜。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t sleep too well last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚睡得不太好。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: At night the temperature drops below zero.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间气温降至零下。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He woke up twice during the night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他夜里醒了两次。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Many animals hunt by night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多动物夜间出来猎食。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a storm on Friday night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期五晚上有过一场暴风雨。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use at night when talking about what generally or regularly happens then.
F2NBox.TRAN: 要说夜间一般或经常发生什么的时候用at night
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The noise of the traffic keeps me awake at night.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜里车流的声音总是吵得我睡不着 。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use in the night when talking about an event that happens at some time during the night.
F2NBox.TRAN: 要说夜里某个时间发生什么的时候用in the night
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There had been heavy rain in the night.
F2NBox.EXPL: Use by night to say what a person or animal does at night.
F2NBox.TRAN: 要说某人或某动物在夜间做什么时用by night
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We travelled by night.
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are mentioning a time before midnight, use at night.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指午夜前的某个时间用at night
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: ten o’clock at night
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are mentioning a time after midnight, use in the morning.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指午夜后的某个时间用in the morning
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: four in the morning

Sense.DEF: the time during the evening until you go to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had a really good meal last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚我们吃了一顿非常美味的晚餐。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They stay in and watch television every night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们每天晚上待在家里看电视。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She recognised him from the night before the previous evening.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她前一天晚上就认出他了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My parents are coming for dinner tomorrow night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我父母明晚要过来吃晚饭。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There’s a party at Ben’s place on Saturday night.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期六晚上本的家里有个聚会。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We were on our way back from a night out an evening when you go to a party, restaurant, theatre etc at the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在晚上看完戏回家的路上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anna doesn’t like him walking home late at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 安娜不想让他深夜走路回家。

GramExa.GLOSS: an evening when a particular event happens, especially at a bar, club etc
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 问答比赛夜/学生夜等〔尤指在酒吧﹑俱乐部等举办的活动〕

Sense.DEF: if you do something nights, you do it regularly or often at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: I work nights, so I’m usually asleep during the day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上夜班﹐因此我白天通常在睡觉。

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye to someone when it is late in the evening or when they are going to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Night! See you tomorrow!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚安！明天见！

Sense.DEF: used to say goodbye to someone, especially a child, when they are going to bed
Sense.TRAN: 晚安！〔尤用于对小孩子说〕

Sense.DEF: all the time
Sense.TRAN: 夜以继日地﹐日夜不停地
Sense.EXAMPLE: The store is guarded day and night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家商店日夜都有人看守。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We had to work night and day to get it finished.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为了完成那项任务﹐我们夜以继日地干。

Sense.DEF: at any time
Sense.EXAMPLE: You can call me any time, night or day.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你随时可以给我打电话。

Sense.DEF: every night for a long period
Sense.TRAN: 〔长期以来〕每晚﹐一夜又一夜地
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s out drinking night after night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天晚上都出去喝酒。

Sense.DEF: the first performance of a play or show
Sense.EXAMPLE: We saw ‘Riverdance’ on its opening night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们看了《大河之舞》的首场演出。

Sense.LEXUNIT: spend the night with sb/spend the night together
Sense.DEF: to sleep with someone and have sex with them
Sense.TRAN: 和某人过夜〔并发生性关系〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: And you thought we spent the night together?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那么你认为我们在一起过夜了？

Sense.DEF: a night when you sleep well
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ll feel better after a good night’s sleep.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好好睡一晚﹐你会感觉好些的。

Sense.DEF: to go to bed later or earlier than usual
Sense.EXAMPLE: I think I’ll have an early night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想我要早点睡觉。

Sense.DEF: at the end of the day, just before you go to bed
Sense.EXAMPLE: You should water plants either first thing in the morning or last thing at night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要么早上起来给花草浇水﹐要么临睡之前浇。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: It rained last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨晚下雨了。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I should be back by tomorrow night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我应该明天晚上之前回来。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: I haven’t seen him since Thursday night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期四晚上以后我就没见过他了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you go to bed early
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I’m really tired – I need an early night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我实在累了——我要早点睡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: when you go to bed late
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We had a late night last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨夜我们很晚才睡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a night when you do not sleep or you work hard
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Everyone was tired and grumpy. It had been a long night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大家都累了﹐脾气不好﹐因为一宿没睡觉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had spent a sleepless night wondering what to do.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一夜无眠﹐思量如何是好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep somewhere
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We spent two nights at the Grand Hotel.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在格兰德酒店住了两个晚上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: sleep at someone’s house
Collocate.EXAMPLE: You’re welcome to stay the night if you like.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你愿意﹐欢迎你晚上住这里。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: not sleep well, especially when you are ill
Collocate.EXAMPLE: I had a bad night last night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我昨晚没睡好。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: it starts to become dark
Collocate.EXAMPLE: It grew colder as night fell.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜幕降临﹐天更冷了。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: continues

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We looked up at the stars in the night sky.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们抬头仰望夜空中的星星。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The night air was scented with pine wood.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜晚的空气中飘散着松木的清香。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: He looked as if he’d been up all night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看上去像是一宿没睡。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used to emphasize that something continues for the whole night
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The noise continued all night long!
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 吵闹声持续了整整一夜。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We often get to bed very late at night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们经常很晚才睡觉。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: used when something happens very late at night, and you are surprised
Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 晚上这个时候〔表示吃惊〕
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Why are you calling me at this time of night?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 你晚上这个时候打电话给我干吗？

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: until very late at night
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Staff worked late into the night to make necessary repairs.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 员工干到很晚﹐进行必要的修理。

Collocate.COLLOC: in the middle of the night
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She woke up suddenly in the middle of the night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她半夜里突然醒来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: in the middle of the night when it is quiet
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He drove through the countryside in the dead of night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在寂静的夜里﹐他驱车行驶在乡间。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The phones rang day and night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 电话日夜响个不停。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: all the time
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She nagged at him morning, noon, and night.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她没日没夜地跟他唠叨。

Sense.DEF: an alcoholic drink that you have at the end of the evening, just before you go to bed
a soft hat that people used to wear in bed
a class which takes place during the evening for people who work during the day
clothes that you wear in bed
a place where people go to dance and drink, which is open late at night

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people often say club rather than nightclub.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们经常说club﹐而不说 nightclub
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Do you want to go out to a club afterwards?
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 接下来你想去夜总会吗？

Sense.DEF: a special hole in the outside wall of a bank into which a customer can put money or documents safely when the bank is closed
Sense.TRAN: 夜间保险箱〔装在银行外墙上﹐供顾客在银行关门后存钱或投放文件〕

Sense.DEF: a piece of clothing, like a thin dress, that a woman wears in bed
work that is done during the night

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She is on night duty at the hospital.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在医院值夜班。

Sense.DEF: the time when it begins to get dark in the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t worry, we’ll be back by nightfall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别担心﹐我们傍晚之前会回来的。

Sense.DEF: a nightdress
someone who enjoys staying awake all night
a nightdress
a small bird that sings very beautifully, especially at night

(1820–1910)an English nurse who became greatly admired when she set up a hospital for soldiers in Turkey during the Crimean War. She became known as the Lady with the Lamp, because she walked around the hospital in the evenings with a lamp to check that everything was in order. She set up a school for nurses, making nursingthe job of being a nurse into a real profession. Someone who cares for ill people is sometimes compared to Florence Nightingale.
Sense.TRAN: 南丁格尔〔1820–1910﹐英国护士。关心照顾病人的人有时被比作是南丁格尔〕

Sense.DEF: entertainment in the evening
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel is only a five minute walk from both the beach and the nightlife.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这家宾馆距离海滩和夜生活区都只需步行五分钟。

Sense.DEF: a small electric light that you put in a child’s room at night
happening every night
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nightly talk show
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每晚播出的谈话节目

RunOn.EXAMPLE: The band plays twice nightly in the bar.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那支乐队每晚在该酒吧表演两场。

Sense.DEF: a very frightening dream

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Years after the accident I still have nightmares about it.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 事故发生很多年后﹐我依然会做噩梦。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a recurring nightmare one which you have again and again
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一再出现的噩梦

Sense.DEF: a very difficult, unpleasant, or frightening experience or situation
Sense.TRAN: 棘手的[不愉快的﹐可怕的]经历[事情]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic was a nightmare.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通情况非常糟糕。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: This has been an absolute nightmare for me and my family.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这对我和我的家庭来说一直都是件非常可怕的事。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the nightmare of going through divorce
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 经历离婚过程的痛苦

Sense.EXAMPLE: It was every teacher’s worst nightmare the worst thing which could have happened.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对每位老师来说﹐那都是一场最可怕的梦魇。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nightmare journey
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 糟糕的旅程

Sense.DEF: something terrible that you fear may happen in the future

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the nightmare of a nuclear war
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核战争的梦魇

GramExa.GLOSS: the worst or most frightening situation that you can imagine

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys staying awake all night
someone who works at the main entrance of a hotel during the night
a special hole in the outside wall of a bank into which a customer can put money or documents safely when the bank is closed
Sense.TRAN: 夜间保险箱〔装在银行外墙上﹐供顾客在银行关门后存钱或投放文件〕

Sense.DEF: classes that take place in the evening for people who work during the day
a period of time at night when people regularly work, especially in a factory

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She’s on the night shift this week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她这星期上夜班。

Sense.DEF: the group of people who work on the night shift
Sense.EXAMPLE: The night shift was just arriving.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上夜班的人正在陆续到来。

Sense.DEF: a long loose shirt that someone, especially a man, wears in bed
a place people go to at night for entertainment
Sense.EXAMPLE: my favourite New York night spot
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我最喜欢的纽约夜间娱乐场所

Sense.DEF: a small table beside a bed
a short thick stick carried as a weapon by police officers
the time during the night

GramExa.EXAMPLE: animals that hunt at nighttime
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 夜间猎食的动物

Sense.DEF: someone whose job is to guard a building at night
clothes that you wear in bed at night
a very offensive word for a black person. Do not use this word.
Sense.TRAN: 黑鬼〔对黑人的冒犯性用语〕

Sense.DEF: the belief that nothing has any meaning or value
Sense.TRAN: 虚无主义〔认为一切都没有意义或价值〕

Sense.DEF: the idea that all social and political institutions should be destroyed
Sense.TRAN: 政治虚无主义〔主张摧毁一切社会和政治机构的思想〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is connected with a particular activity or set of beliefs
Sense.TRAN: 与〔某活动或信仰〕有关的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a peacenik someone who supports peace
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平爱好者

Sense.DEF: nothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new machine reduced labour costs to almost nil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新机器把劳动成本几乎降到零。

Sense.DEF: the number zero, used in sports results
Sense.EXAMPLE: Our team won by two goals to nil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我队以二比零获胜。

Sense.DEF: able to move quickly and easily with light neat movements
Sense.EXAMPLE: nimble fingers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 灵巧的手指
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nimble climber
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 敏捷的攀登者

Sense.DEF: an ability to think quickly or understand things easily
a dark cloud that may bring rain or snow
a halo
Sense.TRAN: 〔神像等头上的〕光轮﹐光环﹐光晕

Sense.DEF: someone who does not want a particular activity or building near their home – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 邻避者〔指反对在自家附近进行某种活动或兴建某种建筑的人﹐含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: a type of battery that can be recharged and that is used in cameras and small electronic equipment
an insulting word for someone who is stupid or not good at doing something
a stupid person
the number 9
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s only been in this job for nine months.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干这份工作才九个月。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We open at nine nine o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们9点开始营业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kay was taught by her mother till she was nine nine years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯一直由她妈妈教到九岁。

Sense.DEF: almost always
Sense.TRAN: 十之八九﹐几乎总是﹐几乎每次
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nine times out of ten we can solve the problem over the phone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们基本上都可以通过电话来解决问题。

Sense.DEF: a thing or event that makes people very excited for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 轰动一时的事物﹔昙花一现的新鲜事

Sense.DEF: to make lucky escapes from dangerous situations
a game in which you roll a ball at nine bottle-shaped objects to try to hit them so that they fall
if people or things drop like ninepins, many of them fall down or become ill or injured suddenly all at the same time
Sense.TRAN: 大量倒下﹔大批病倒[受伤]
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s just three weeks into the season and players are dropping like ninepins.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 进入本赛季才三个星期﹐球员们就伤病不断。

Sense.DEF: the number 19
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was nineteen minutes past seven.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当时是7点19分。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was only nineteen 19 years old.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我当时只有19岁。

Sense.DEF: if you talk nineteen to the dozen, you talk very quickly and without stopping

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the nineteenth the 19th day of the month.

Sense.DEF: (1949) a novel by George Orwell which describes an imaginary society of the future, where the government has complete control of everyone’s lives, thoughts, and behaviour, and watches everything they do. The leader of this government is known as Big Brother, and there are pictures of him everywhere, showing the words ‘Big Brother is watching you’. The book has had a great influence on the way that people think about and talk about politics, and people sometimes use the phrase ‘Nineteen Eighty-Four’ to describe a society that is too strictly controlled.
Sense.TRAN: 《一九八四》〔1949年发表﹐乔治．奥威尔小说。人们有时用Nineteen Eighty-Four一词来形容一个被过度控制的社会〕

Sense.DEF: an expression used humorously by golf players meaning the bar where they drink after playing
Sense.TRAN: 第十九穴〔幽默用法﹐指高尔夫球员比赛结束后去喝酒的酒吧〕

Sense.DEF: between nine o’clock and five o’clock, the normal working hours of an office worker
Sense.TRAN: 朝九晚五〔早上9点至下午5点﹐是办公室工作人员正常的工作时间〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She didn’t like working nine to five.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不喜欢朝九晚五的工作。

Sense.DEF: the number 90
the years from 1990 to 1999
Sense.EXAMPLE: America was far richer in the nineties.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 90年代的美国要富裕得多。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The industry received a lot of bad publicity in the early nineties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该行业在90年代早期受到了大量负面宣传。

Sense.DEF: to be aged between 90 and 99
Sense.TRAN: 在九十到九十九岁之间﹐是九十多岁

GramExa.EXAMPLE: My grandfather was in his early nineties when he died.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我祖父去世的时候90岁出头。

Sense.DEF: if the temperature is in the nineties, it is between 90 degrees and 99 degrees

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Temperatures were still in the high nineties.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 温度仍然接近100度。

Sense.DEF: in the past, a Japanese fighter with special skills
a silly person
coming after eight other things in a series
Sense.EXAMPLE: in the ninth century
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在9世纪
Sense.EXAMPLE: her ninth birthday
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的9岁生日

RunOn.EXAMPLE: I’m planning to leave on the ninth ninth day of the month.

Sense.DEF: one of nine equal parts of something
to go somewhere quickly or for a short time
Sense.TRAN: 快走﹐急忙离去﹔去一会儿
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have we time to nip down the pub for a quick drink?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们有没有时间到酒吧去小坐一会儿喝点什么？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Another car nipped in moved quickly into a space in front of me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 另一辆车突然插到我前面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve got to nip home and change my clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我得赶快回家去换一下衣服。

Sense.DEF: to bite someone or something lightly
Sense.EXAMPLE: She gently nipped the lobe of his ear.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她轻咬着他的耳垂。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The fish swam all around her and nipped at her legs.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 鱼儿在她身边游来游去﹐轻轻咬着她的双腿。

Sense.DEF: to prevent something from becoming a problem by stopping it as soon as it starts
Sense.TRAN: 把某事物消灭在萌芽状态﹔对某事物一开始即加以阻止
Sense.EXAMPLE: Try to nip this kind of bad behaviour in the bud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要尽早制止这种不良行为。

Sense.DEF: to suddenly and quickly press something tightly between two fingers, edges, or surfaces
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sally nipped her cheeks to make them look less pale.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉拧了拧自己的脸颊﹐好让脸色看上去不那么苍白。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He nipped his finger in the door.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的手指被门夹了一下。

Sense.DEF: if cold weather or the wind nips at part of your body or at a plant, it hurts or damages it
Sense.TRAN: 〔严寒天气或寒风〕冻得人疼痛﹔把植物冻坏

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The frost nipped at our fingers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 严寒的天气让我们手指冻得生疼。

Sense.DEF: to remove a small part of something, especially a plant, by pressing it tightly between your finger and thumb
Sense.TRAN: 掐掉﹐摘去〔尤指植物的一部分〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: She nipped off a dead flower.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她掐掉了一朵凋谢的花。

Sense.DEF: the act or result of biting something lightly or pressing something between two fingers, edges, or surfaces
Sense.EXAMPLE: His dog gave me a painful nip on the leg.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的狗咬疼了我的腿。

Sense.DEF: a small amount of strong alcoholic drink

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nip of brandy
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一点白兰地酒

Sense.DEF: coldness in the air
informal

Subsense.DEF: equally likely to happen or not happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We made it to the airport, but it was nip and tuck.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们赶到了机场﹐不过险得很。

Subsense.DEF: if two competitors are nip and tuck in a race or competition, they are doing equally well
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The fourth quarter was nip and tuck, but the Bulls won 92-90.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第四节两队不相上下﹐不过公牛队最后以92比90取得了胜利。

Subsense.DEF: a medical operation on your face or stomach that is done to make you look younger or thinner
Subsense.EXAMPLE: I might consider getting a nip and tuck in a few years’ time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 过几年我可能会考虑去做个整容手术。

Sense.DEF: a child
the small dark circular part of a woman’s breast. Babies suck milk through their mother’s nipples.
one of the two small dark circular parts on a man’s chest
the rubber part on a baby’s bottle that a baby sucks milk through
a part in an engine or machine made of rubber or plastic and shaped like a nipple. It has a hole in it which liquid can flow or be poured through.
Sense.TRAN: 〔发动机或机器上的〕(乳头状)注油口﹐加油嘴

Sense.DEF: weather that is nippy is slightly cold
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s a bit nippy out there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面冷飕飕的。

Sense.DEF: able to move quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nippy little car
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 小巧灵便的汽车

Sense.DEF: a piece of cloth covering the face below the eyes, which some Muslim women wear
Sense.TRAN: 尼卡伯〔一些穆斯林妇女戴的面纱〕

Sense.DEF: the final state of complete knowledge and understanding that is the aim of believers in Buddhism
a condition of great happiness and a feeling of peace
Sense.TRAN: 极乐世界﹐无忧无虑的境界

Sense.DEF: an egg of a louse a small insect that sucks blood, that is sometimes found in people’s hair
a silly person
when someone argues about small unimportant details or tries to find small mistakes in something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Soames was getting impatient with his daughter’s constant nit﹣picking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 索姆斯对于女儿的不断挑剔失去了耐心。

Sense.DEF: used in the name of substances containing nitrogen and oxygen. Nitrates are often used to improve soil.
Sense.EXAMPLE: potassium nitrate
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 硝酸钾
Sense.EXAMPLE: high levels of nitrates in drinking water
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 饮用水中的大量硝酸盐

Sense.DEF: a powerful acid that is used in explosives and other chemical products
a gas that has no colour or smell, and that forms most of the Earth’s air. It is a chemical element: symbol N
Sense.TRAN: 氮〔一种化学元素﹐符号为N〕

Sense.DEF: a chemical used to make a powerful liquid explosive and also in some medicines
a gas used by dentists to reduce pain
Sense.TRAN: 氧化亚氮﹐一氧化二氮﹔笑气

Sense.DEF: the basic and practical facts of a subject or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: Let’s get down to the nitty-gritty and work out the costs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们来谈谈实质性问题﹐把成本计算出来吧。

Sense.DEF: a silly person
to answer no to something or say that you will not allow something
Sense.EXAMPLE: They nixed the idea of filming in Ireland.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们否决了在爱尔兰拍摄的建议。

Sense.DEF: no
used to give a negative reply to a question, offer, or request
Sense.TRAN: 不﹐不行〔对问题﹑提议或请求表示否定或拒绝〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you Italian?’ ‘No, I’m Spanish.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你是意大利人吗？”“不﹐我是西班牙人。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you want any more?’ ‘No thanks.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你还要再来点吗？”“不要了﹐谢谢。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Could you help me write this?’ ‘No, sorry, I haven’t got time at the moment.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能帮我写这个吗？”“抱歉﹐不行﹐我现在没时间。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: He wanted to take me to a disco but I said no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他想带我去迪斯科舞厅﹐但是我拒绝了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sixty percent of people voted no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 60%的人投了反对票。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If you’re asking whether I feel the same way about her, the answer is no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你问的是我对她是否也有相同的感觉﹐答案是没有。

Sense.DEF: used to say that you disagree with a statement
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You’re always complaining about work.’ ‘No, I’m not!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你总在抱怨工作。”“不﹐我没有！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that you agree with a negative statement
Sense.TRAN: 是﹐对〔对否定陈述表示赞同〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘They shouldn’t drive so fast.’ ‘No, it’s really dangerous.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他们开车不该那么快。”“没错﹐那样真的很危险。”

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone not to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: No, Jimmy, don’t touch that switch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别﹐吉米﹐别碰那个开关。

Sense.DEF: used to show that you are shocked, surprised, annoyed, or disappointed by what someone has just told you, or by what has just happened
Sense.TRAN: 不会吧﹐不可能〔表示惊讶﹑生气或失望〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘She’s nearly fifty.’ ‘No, you’re kidding!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “她快50岁了。” “不可能﹐你在开玩笑吧！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oh no, I’ve lost my wallet!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哦﹐不好﹐我把钱包丢了！

Sense.DEF: used to correct what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 不﹐不对〔用于纠正自己刚说的话〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s the director, no, the assistant director, of the company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是这家公司的经理﹐不﹐是副经理。

Sense.LEXUNIT: won’t take no for an answer
Sense.DEF: if someone won’t take no for an answer, they are determined that you should agree to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He insists on taking us all out to dinner and he won’t take no for an answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他坚持要带我们大家出去吃晚饭﹐不容我们拒绝。

Sense.DEF: used before comparatives to mean ‘not even a small amount’
Sense.TRAN: 一点也不…〔用于比较级之前〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll pay you $75 and no more.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会付给你75美元﹐就这些。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re no better than the rest of them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一点也不比他们其余的人好。

Sense.DEF: not one or not any
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no food left in the fridge.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 冰箱里没剩下什么食物了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: No trains will be affected by this incident.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不会有列车受到这起事件的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a house with no central heating
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一所没有中央暖气系统的房子
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no excuse for that kind of behaviour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种行为没有借口。

Sense.DEF: used on signs to say that something is not allowed
Sense.EXAMPLE: No parking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止停车
Sense.EXAMPLE: No smoking
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁止吸烟

Sense.DEF: very soon or very quickly
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll be home in no time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们马上就到家。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that it is not possible to do something
Sense.TRAN: 不可能做某事〔用于强调〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no knowing what this lunatic will do next.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也说不准这个疯子接下来会干什么。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is no denying the suffering of these families they are definitely suffering.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些家庭所遭受的痛苦是无可否认的。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the opposite of a particular description is true
Sense.TRAN: 不是﹐并不〔用于强调情况相反〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: That girl’s no fool she is intelligent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女孩一点也不傻。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Larry’s no friend of mine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉里根本不是我的朋友。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If he has to do it all himself, it will be no bad thing a good thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果他必须一个人去做﹐那也不是什么坏事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a question of no great importance
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不太重要的问题

Sense.DEF: a negative answer or decision
Sense.EXAMPLE: The answer was a definite no.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答是绝对不行。

Sense.DEF: a vote against a proposal in parliament

Sense.TRAN: a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= number 第…号
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mozart’s piano concerto no. 27
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 莫扎特第27钢琴协奏曲

Sense.DEF: the address of the official home of the British prime minister
Sense.TRAN: 唐宁街十号〔英国首相官邸〕

Sense.DEF: a no-account person does not achieve very much because they are so lazy
Sense.TRAN: 没出息的﹐混日子的﹐不长进的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a no-account drifter who died of drink
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个浑浑噩噩﹑酗酒而亡的流浪汉

Sense.DEF: in the Bible, the large boat built by Noah to save his family and the animals from a flood that covered the earth
a rich person with a high social position
Sense.TRAN: 有钱有势的人﹐上流人士

Sense.DEF: an act of bowling the ball in the game of cricket in a way that is not allowed by the rules
to make someone do what you want by illegally offering them money or threatening them
Sense.EXAMPLE: The jury had been nobbled and the case had to be reheard.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 陪审团被收买﹐案件必须重审。

Sense.DEF: to prevent a horse from winning a race, especially by giving it drugs
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指给赛马服药〕使不能取胜

Sense.DEF: to get someone’s attention, especially in order to persuade them to do something
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为说服某人做某事而〕引起〔某人〕的注意
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was nobbled by my deaf old aunt and couldn’t get away.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我被失聪的老阿姨拖住了无法脱身。

Sense.DEF: one of the prizes given each year to people who have done important work in various types of activity. There are prizes for special achievements in physics, chemistry, economics, literature, and peace. The Nobel prizes were established by Alfred Nobel and are given in Sweden.
the group of people in some countries who belong to the highest social class and have titles such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’
the quality of being noble
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nobility of his intentions
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他崇高的志向

Sense.DEF: morally good or generous in a way that is admired
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s very noble of you to spend all your weekends helping the old folk.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你心地真好﹐周末的时间全都用来帮助老人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: noble ideals
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 崇高的理想

Sense.DEF: belonging to the nobility

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a member of an ancient noble family
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 古老贵族家庭成员
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The Marquis would have to marry a woman of noble blood.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那位侯爵必须和有贵族血统的女子结婚。

Sense.DEF: something that is noble is very impressive and beautiful
Sense.EXAMPLE: the old church with its noble tower
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有宏伟塔楼的老教堂

Sense.DEF: a noble gas or metal is not affected chemically by other substances
someone who comes from a society that is less developed or interested in money than western countries, making them morally better than people who live in western countries
a member of the highest social class with a title such as ‘Duke’ or ‘Countess’
a man who is a member of the highest social class and has a title such as ‘Duke’
the idea that people who belong to a high social class should behave in a kind and generous way towards people of a lower social class
Sense.TRAN: 位高则任重; 贵人行为理应高尚

Sense.DEF: a woman who is a member of the highest social class and has a title such as ‘Duchess’
Sense.TRAN: 女贵族〔如女公爵或公爵夫人〕

Sense.DEF: in a morally good or generous way that should be admired
Sense.EXAMPLE: They chose to die nobly rather than to betray their king.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们宁可高尚地死去﹐也不愿背叛自己的国王。

Sense.DEF: having parents who are members of the nobility
no one
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knocked on the door but nobody answered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我敲了敲门﹐但没人应门。
Sense.HINTTRAN: Do not write this as ‘no body’. 不要写成no body。

Sense.DEF: very much, very well, or very fast
Sense.EXAMPLE: We get along like nobody’s business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们相处得很好。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not important and has no influence
Sense.TRAN: 无名小卒﹐小人物﹐无足轻重的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was a nothing and a nobody with everything to prove.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一无所成﹐事事都有待证明。

Sense.DEF: a decision that is easy, and that you do not need to think about, used when you want to emphasize that it is really very easy
Sense.TRAN: 无需动脑子的事﹐简单的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Joining the savings plan is a no-brainer. Just do it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参加储蓄计划的事根本不用考虑了﹐赶快行动吧。

Sense.DEF: in Britain, a reduction in the amount that you have to pay for car insurance, because you have not claimed any money during a particular period
Sense.TRAN: 无索赔赠金﹐无索赔折扣〔英国汽车保险﹐若车主在某段时间内未提出赔款要求可享有的回扣〕

Sense.LEXUNIT: vote of no-confidence/no-confidence vote/motion of no-confidence etc
Sense.DEF: an official vote where people can say if they no longer think someone or something is good enough
Sense.TRAN: 不信任投票/不信任动议等
Sense.EXAMPLE: fears that he may lose a vote of no-confidence in parliament
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对他可能在议会不信任投票中失败的担心
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman has survived four no-confidence motions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席已在四次不信任动议表决中侥幸过关。

Sense.DEF: another form of no-account
an animal that is nocturnal is active at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hamsters are nocturnal creatures.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仓鼠是夜行动物。

Sense.DEF: happening at night
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rebecca paid a nocturnal visit to the flat.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 丽贝卡夜访那所公寓。

Sense.DEF: a piece of music, especially a soft beautiful piece of piano music
to move your head up and down, especially in order to show agreement or understanding
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指表示赞同或理解而〕点(头)
Sense.EXAMPLE: I asked her if she was ready to go, and she nodded.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我问她是否已准备好出发﹐她点了点头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Mom nodded her head sympathetically.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妈妈同情地点了点头。

GramExa.GLOSS: show your approval etc by nodding
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Corbett nodded his acceptance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科比特点头表示认可。

Sense.DEF: to move your head down and up again once in order to greet someone or give someone a sign to do something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge nodded at the foreman to proceed.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官点头示意首席陪审员继续说。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She nodded to us as she walked by.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她走过时向我们点了点头。

Sense.DEF: to know a little about a subject but not a lot
Sense.EXAMPLE: Students will need to have a nodding acquaintance with Spanish.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学生们将需要粗通西班牙语。

Sense.DEF: to know someone but not very well
to begin to sleep, usually when you do not intend to and are sitting somewhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: I missed the movie because I kept nodding off.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一直在打瞌睡﹐结果错过了电影。

Sense.DEF: an act of nodding
Sense.EXAMPLE: The woman greeted us with a nod of the head.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个女人向我们点点头打招呼。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I showed the doorman my card and he gave a friendly nod.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我向门卫出示了卡片﹐他友善地点了点头。

Sense.LEXUNIT: give sb the nod/get the nod from sb
Sense.DEF: to give or be given permission to do something
Sense.TRAN: 同意某人/得到某人的许可
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re waiting for the boss to give us the nod on this one.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在等老板同意此事。

Sense.DEF: by general agreement and without people discussing it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The chairman’s proposals are usually passed on the nod.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主席的提议通常是无需讨论就一致通过的。

Sense.LEXUNIT: a nod’s as good as a wink
Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you have understood something, although it was said in an indirect way
being or connected with a node
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nodal point of the transport system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通系统的枢纽

Sense.DEF: your head or brain
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s easy enough to do if you just use your noddle think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事很容易﹐你只要动动脑筋就行了。

Sense.DEF: the place on the stem of a plant from which a leaf or branch grows
Sense.TRAN: 茎节〔植物茎上生叶的部分〕

Sense.DEF: a place where lines in a network cross or join
a part of a computer network where messages can be received or sent
Sense.TRAN: 〔计算机网络中信息收发的〕节点

Sense.DEF: a lymph node
a small round raised part, especially a small swelling on a plant or someone’s body
christmas – used especially in songs and on cards
Sense.TRAN: 圣诞节〔尤用于歌词及贺卡中〕

Sense.DEF: the plural of no3
a no-fault divorce is one in which both people agree not to be married any longer and do not have to say whose fault this is
Sense.TRAN: 〔离婚案中〕不追究过错的﹐无过失的

Sense.DEF: no-fault car insurance will pay for the damage done in an accident, even if you caused the accident
Sense.TRAN: 〔汽车保险〕不追究过失责任的

Sense.DEF: an area that only particular aircraft are allowed to enter, and in which other aircraft could be attacked
a no-frills product or service includes only basic features and is not of the highest possible quality
Sense.TRAN: 〔产品或服务〕只包括最基本功能的﹐只满足最基本需要的
