Sense.EXAMPLE: no-frills accommodation
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只提供必需品的住宿

Sense.DEF: a small amount of an alcoholic drink
your head or brain
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use your noggin think.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动动脑子。

Sense.DEF: an area that people should not go to because it is very dangerous
Sense.EXAMPLE: This part of the city was a no-go area for the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这片城区对于警察来说是个危险地带。

Sense.DEF: a subject that cannot be discussed because it is private or because it may offend people
Sense.EXAMPLE: She made it clear that her private life was a no-go area.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她明确表示禁止提及她的私生活。

Sense.DEF: a no-holds-barred discussion, situation etc is one in which there are no rules or limits
Sense.TRAN: 〔讨论﹑情况等〕不受任何限制的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Viewers had been promised a no-holds-barred interview with the former mayor.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 电视观众得到保证将会看到一次与前市长无所不谈的访问。

Sense.DEF: a person or animal who you think has no chance of winning something or of being successful
Sense.TRAN: 无用的人﹔注定要失败的人[动物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: a bunch of complete no-hopers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一帮无能之辈

Sense.DEF: not in any way or in any situation – usually used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 决不﹔毫不﹐一点也不〔常为幽默用法〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I never liked her nohow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从未喜欢过她。

Sense.DEF: a sound, especially one that is loud, unpleasant, or frightening
Sense.TRAN: 噪声﹐杂音﹔嘈杂声﹐喧闹声
Sense.EXAMPLE: What’s that noise?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是什么声音？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the noise of the traffic
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 交通噪音

Sense.EXAMPLE: Try not to make a noise when you go upstairs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 上楼时尽量不要弄出声。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a strange whistling noise in his ears.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听到奇怪的杂音。

Sense.EXAMPLE: There was a lot of noise outside.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面很吵闹。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Noise levels have been reduced by 20%.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪音水平下降了20%。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the problem of aircraft noise near airports
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 机场附近飞机噪音的问题

Sense.DEF: to say things which suggest what your opinion or attitude is, without saying it directly
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides were making hopeful noises about the hostages.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 双方都在表示人质还有希望。

Sense.DEF: to say the things that other people want or expect to hear
Sense.EXAMPLE: The health minister seems to be making all the right noises.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 卫生部长似乎只是在随声附和。

Sense.DEF: to say that you are considering doing something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He is now making noises about starting his own business.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他表示正在考虑自己创业。

Sense.LEXUNIT: make a (lot of) noise about sth
Sense.DEF: to talk about something a lot, so that people will notice it – used in order to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 经常谈论某个话题〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: modern men who make a noise about the fact that they know how to look good
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总是夸耀自己懂得如何打扮的时髦男子

Sense.DEF: unwanted signals produced by an electrical circuit
pieces of unwanted information that can prevent a computer from working effectively
Sense.TRAN: 〔妨碍计算机正常运行的〕垃圾信息

Sense.DEF: the sounds, voices etc that come from actors who are not on the stage at the time
if news or information is noised abroad, people are talking about it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Rumours of an election are being noised abroad.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外界纷纷传言要举行选举。

Sense.DEF: without making any sound
Sense.EXAMPLE: We crept noiselessly down the hall.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们蹑手蹑脚地穿过走廊。

Sense.DEF: very loud or continuous noise which is considered unpleasant and harmful to people
very unpleasant
Sense.TRAN: 极讨厌的﹔十分令人不快的
Sense.EXAMPLE: noisome smells
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 令人生厌的气味

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is noisy makes a lot of noise
Sense.TRAN: 喧闹的﹔吵闹的﹔噪声大的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The kids have been really noisy today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们今天实在是吵。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a noisy engine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 噪声大的发动机

Sense.DEF: a place that is noisy is full of noise
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bar was very noisy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒吧里非常嘈杂。

Sense.DEF: a member of a tribe that travels from place to place instead of living in one place all the time, usually in order to find grass for their animals
Sense.TRAN: 游牧民﹐游牧部落中的一员

Sense.DEF: nomadic people are nomads
Sense.EXAMPLE: nomadic herdsmen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 游牧民

Sense.DEF: if someone leads a nomadic life, they travel from place to place and do not live in any one place for very long
Sense.EXAMPLE: The son of an air force pilot, he had a somewhat nomadic childhood.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 因为是空军飞行员的儿子﹐他童年的生活有点漂泊不定。

Sense.DEF: an area of land that no one owns or controls, especially an area between two borders or opposing armies
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指边界处或敌对阵地间的〕无人地带﹐真空地带

Sense.DEF: a situation or type of activity that is not either of two things or is a combination of two things

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the no-man’s land between art and science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 介于艺术和科学之间的模糊领域

Sense.DEF: someone who is not successful and who you have no respect for
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m not going to listen to that no-mark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种无能之辈的话我不要听。

Sense.DEF: a name that someone uses instead of their real name, especially someone who is fighting in a war
Sense.TRAN: 化名﹐假名〔尤用于战争时期的军人〕

Sense.DEF: a name used by a writer instead of their real name
a system of naming things, especially in science

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the nomenclature of science
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 科学术语

Sense.EXAMPLE: zoological nomenclature
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 动物命名法

Sense.DEF: a very small sum of money, especially when compared with what something would usually cost or what it is worth
Sense.TRAN: 象征性的金额/收费/费用等
Sense.EXAMPLE: A nominal charge is made for use of the tennis courts.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 使用这些网球场只是象征性地收取费用。

Sense.DEF: officially described as being something, when this is not really true
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nominal head of the rebellion
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次叛乱名义上的领导人
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their conversion to Christianity was only nominal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们只是名义上皈依了基督教。

Sense.DEF: a nominal value etc does not show what something is really worth or really costs, because it does not take into account changes in the price of other goods and services
Sense.TRAN: 票面价值/名义价格/名义收入等
Sense.EXAMPLE: If prices rise and the nominal wage remains constant, the real wage falls.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果物价上涨而名义工资保持不变﹐其实等于工资降低。

Sense.DEF: relating to nouns or used as a noun
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nominal use of the present participle
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在分词的名词性用法

Sense.DEF: officially described as being something, when this is not really true
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nominally Christian country
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 名义上信奉基督教的国家
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was nominally in charge of his father’s printing company.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他名义上掌管着父亲的印刷公司。

Sense.DEF: to officially suggest someone or something for an important position, duty, or prize

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Ferraro was the first woman to be nominated for the job of vice president.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 费拉罗是第一位获得副总统职位提名的女性。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has been nominated as Best Actress for her part in the film ‘Forever Together’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她因在电影《相遇》中扮演的角色而获最佳女演员提名。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I nominate John to represent us at the meeting.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我提议约翰代表我们去参加这次会议。

Sense.DEF: to give someone a particular job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Next year Mr Jenks will retire and Mr Broadbent will be nominated as his replacement.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 明年詹克斯先生退休﹐布罗德本特先生将获任命接替他的职位。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was nominated to the legislative council.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她被任命为立法委员会委员。

Sense.DEF: the act of officially suggesting someone or something for a position, duty or prize, or the fact of being suggested for it

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Who will get the Republican nomination for president?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁会获得共和党总统候选人提名？

Sense.EXAMPLE: All the committee’s nominations were approved.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该委员会的所有提名均获得批准。

Sense.DEF: the name of a book, film, actor etc that has been suggested to receive an honour or prize
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nominations for the Academy Awards were announced Tuesday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期二宣布了奥斯卡金像奖的提名。

Sense.DEF: the act of giving someone a particular job, or the fact of being given that job

GramExa.EXAMPLE: O’Neil’s nomination as chief executive
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 任命奥尼尔为首席执行官

Sense.DEF: a particular form of a noun in some languages, such as Latin and German, which shows that the noun is the subject of a verb
someone who has been officially suggested for an important position, duty, or prize
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Democratic Party presidential nominee
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 民主党被提名的总统候选人

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a nominee for the post of vice president
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 被提名为副总统的人

Sense.GRAMTRAN: 构成形容词﹑名词和副词
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something is not a particular thing, or does not do a particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-British visitors
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非英籍游客
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-smoker someone who does not smoke
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不吸烟的人
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-stop flight one in which a plane flies from one place to another without stopping on the way
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直飞航班

Sense.DEF: used to refer to a situation where a particular action did not happen or will not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-payment of taxes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 未缴纳税款
Sense.EXAMPLE: They were very disappointed at his non-appearance the fact that he did not go to an event where he was expected.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们对于他缺席感到非常失望。

Sense.DEF: someone between 90 and 99 years old
a situation in which two countries do not attack or fight each other
Sense.EXAMPLE: Both sides are now committed to non-aggression.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在双方都承诺互不侵犯。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The countries will come together next week to sign a new non-aggression treaty.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些国家下周将共同签署一份新的互不侵犯条约。

Sense.DEF: non-alcoholic drinks do not contain alcohol
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-alcoholic wine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不含酒精的葡萄酒
Sense.EXAMPLE: Do you have anything non-alcoholic?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你们有没有不含酒精的饮料？

Sense.DEF: a non-aligned country does not support, or is not dependent on, any of the powerful countries in the world
Sense.EXAMPLE: the non-aligned countries of Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 欧洲的不结盟国家

Sense.DEF: no-name products are not made by a well-known company and so do not have a well-known name
Sense.EXAMPLE: a no-name personal computer
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非品牌的个人电脑

Sense.DEF: failure to go to a place or event where you are supposed to go
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was taken into care because of his non-attendance at school.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他由于旷课而被送进收容所。

Sense.DEF: a non-binding agreement or decision does not have to be obeyed
Sense.TRAN: 〔协议或决定〕无约束力的﹐不一定要遵守的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The industry has signed a non-binding agreement to reduce pollution.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该企业签署了一份无法律约束力的减轻污染协议。

Sense.DEF: a nonce word or phrase has been invented for a particular occasion and is only used once
Sense.TRAN: 〔词或短语〕临时造的﹐只使用一次的

Sense.DEF: behaving calmly and not seeming interested in anything or worried about anything
Sense.TRAN: 若无其事的﹔毫不在乎的
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Has he got a girlfriend?’ Jill asked, trying to sound nonchalant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “他有女朋友吗？”吉尔装出无所谓的样子问道。

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他毫不在乎地微微一笑。

Sense.DEF: someone who is in the army, navy etc during a war but who does not actually fight, for example an army doctor
Sense.TRAN: 〔军队中的〕非战斗人员〔如军医〕

Sense.DEF: someone who is not in the army, navy etc during a war
an nco
deliberately not expressing your opinion or intentions clearly
Sense.TRAN: 态度不明朗的﹔不表态的﹔含糊的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The doctor was non-committal about my mother’s chances of recovery.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生对我母亲能否康复没有明确表态。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The driver mumbled a non-committal reply.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 司机含含糊糊地回答了一声。

Sense.DEF: failure or refusal to do something that you are officially supposed to do

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Companies can be prosecuted for non-compliance with the law.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司如违反法规可能会被起诉。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not accept the ways of thinking or behaving accepted by most other people in their society or group
Sense.TRAN: 不遵守规范的人﹐不遵循常规的人

Sense.DEF: relating to one of the Protestant Christian churches that have separated from the Church of England
a noncontributory pension or insurance plan is paid for by your employer only, and not by you
Sense.TRAN: 〔退休金或保险金计划〕由雇主支付的﹐非分摊的

Sense.DEF: not likely to cause any arguments or disagreements
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the proposals are fairly non-controversial.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数提议都不会引起任何争议。

Sense.DEF: the refusal to do something that someone in authority tells you to do, especially as a protest
a noncount noun is uncountable
a form of punishment which does not involve being sent to prison
Sense.TRAN: 监外执行的判决/惩罚等

Sense.DEF: a parent who does not have their child living with them after a divorce or separation, because of a court’s decision
Sense.TRAN: 〔离婚后〕无监护权的父[母]/父亲/母亲

Sense.DEF: non-dairy foods are not made with milk, butter, cream etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-dairy ice cream
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非奶制冰激凌

Sense.DEF: not relating to one particular religion or religious group
Sense.TRAN: 不限于特定宗教派别的﹐跨教派的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-denominational school
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非特定教派的学校

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is nondescript looks very ordinary and is not at all interesting or unusual
Sense.TRAN: 没有独特之处的﹐平凡无奇的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a rather nondescript suburban house
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 很普通的郊区房子

Sense.DEF: a foreigner working in Britain who does not pay tax in Britain on the money they make in other countries
Sense.TRAN: 非本国居民〔在英国工作的外国人﹐他们在其他国家所得的收入无需在英国纳税〕

Sense.DEF: not any amount of something or not one of a group of people or things
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish I could offer you some cake but there’s none left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我真想能请你吃些蛋糕﹐但一点也没剩的了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Although these were good students, none had a score above 60.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 虽然这些都是好学生﹐但是没有一个考到60分以上。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She waited for a reply, but none came.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她等着答复﹐可是什么也没等到。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even an old car is better than none.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一辆旧车也比没有车强。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Despite her illness, she had lost none of her enthusiasm for life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管身患疾病﹐但她对生活的热情丝毫未减。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I know what people are saying – but none of it is true.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我知道人们在说什么﹐但都不是真的。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: None of my friends phone me any more.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 再也没有朋友给我打电话了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Was there any mail?’ ‘No, none at all.’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “有没有信件？”“没﹐一封也没有。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone refuses to allow someone to do something or to behave in a particular way
Sense.TRAN: 坚决不允许某人(做)某事﹔不接受某人(做)某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: We offered to pay our half of the cost but Charles would have none of it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们提出我们那一半费用自己出﹐但是查尔斯坚决不答应。

Sense.DEF: only a particular person or type of person
Sense.EXAMPLE: a task that none but a man of genius could accomplish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 只有天才方能完成的任务

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that the person involved in something is famous, impressive, or surprising
Sense.EXAMPLE: The mystery guest turned out to be none other than Cher herself.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 神秘嘉宾原来就是雪儿她本人。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: When you are using none of before a plural noun or pronoun, you can use a plural or singular verb after it. You should use a singular verb in formal writing.
F2NBox.TRAN: none of用于复数的名词或代词之前﹐后面可以用复数或单数动词﹐在正式文体中则应用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: None of us care (OR 或 cares) what happens to him.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谁都不关心他怎么了。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: None of us is able to escape the consequences of our actions.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们谁都无法逃避自己行为所带来的后果。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use another negative word (eg ‘not’) with none.
F2NBox.TRAN: none不应与其他否定词(如not)连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: We got 3 points and they got none (NOT 不说 they didn’t get none).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们得了三分﹐他们一分未得。
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I didn’t want any of them (NOT 不说 I didn’t want none of them).
F2NBox.HEADING: none, neither
F2NBox.EXPL: Use none to talk about a group of three or more things or people.
F2NBox.TRAN: none用于指三个或三个以上的人或物
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: None of my friends came.
F2NBox.EXPL: To talk about two things or people, use neither.
F2NBox.TRAN: 指两个人或物﹐用neither
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Neither of my parents wanted me to marry him.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的父母都不想让我嫁给他。

Sense.DEF: not any worse, better etc than before
Sense.TRAN: (某事)一点也没有变得更差/更好等
Sense.EXAMPLE: She seems none the worse for her experience.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次经历好像对她没有什么不良影响。

Sense.DEF: not having any more understanding or knowledge about something than you had before
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was none the wiser after his explanation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他解释过后我还是不明白。

Sense.DEF: not at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was none too pleased to have to take the exam again.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要重考一次﹐根本高兴不起来。

Sense.DEF: someone who has no importance or power and who is not special in any way
Sense.TRAN: 无足轻重的人﹔无能的人

Sense.DEF: not completely necessary
Sense.EXAMPLE: All non-essential travel was cancelled.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有非必要的旅行都被取消了。

Sense.DEF: in spite of the fact that has just been mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 然而﹐但是﹔尽管如此﹐虽然如此
Sense.EXAMPLE: The region was extremely beautiful. Nonetheless Gerard could not imagine spending the rest of his life there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那个地区非常漂亮﹐然而杰拉德却无法想象自己要在那里度过余生。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The paintings are complex, but have plenty of appeal nonetheless.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些画复杂难懂﹐不过还是不乏吸引力。

Sense.DEF: an event that is disappointing because it is much less interesting, exciting, or important than you expected
Sense.TRAN: 远不如预料中那么有趣[兴奋﹐重要]的事﹔令人大失所望的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the end, the match turned out to be a non-event.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那场比赛最终令人大失所望。

Sense.DEF: one of the directors of a company who gives advice, but who does not make decisions about how the company is run
something that is nonexistent does not exist at all, or is not present in a particular place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: On a Sunday morning traffic was almost nonexistent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天的早晨﹐路上几乎没有车辆行人。

Sense.DEF: having all the fat removed
Sense.EXAMPLE: nonfat milk
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 脱脂牛奶

Sense.DEF: books about real facts or events, not imagined ones
Sense.TRAN: 非小说类文学作品﹐写实作品

Sense.DEF: a non-finite verb does not show a particular tense or subject, and is either the infinitive or the participle form of the verb, for example ‘go’ in the sentence ‘Do you want to go home?’
nonflammable materials or substances do not burn easily or do not burn at all
a non­governmental organization is independent and not controlled by a government
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emergency aid is being provided by non-governmental relief organizations.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非政府救助组织正在提供紧急援助。

Sense.DEF: the practice by a government of not getting involved in the affairs of other countries
Sense.EXAMPLE: The British government may have to abandon its policy of non-intervention.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英国政府可能必须放弃其不干涉政策。

Sense.DEF: non-iron material does not need to be ironed after it has been washed
not criticizing people
Sense.TRAN: 不论断别人的﹐不指责人的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A counsellor should always be sympathetic and non-judgmental.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 辅导员应该总是富有同情心﹐而且不应论断是非。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not a member of a particular club or organization
Sense.EXAMPLE: The price will be £30 for members, £33 for non-members.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会员价是30英镑﹐非会员价是33英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: non-members of the Labour Party
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 非工党人士

GramExa.EXAMPLE: imports from non-member countries
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从非成员国进口的产品

Sense.DEF: a non-negotiable principle or belief is one that you refuse to discuss or change
Sense.TRAN: 不可谈判的﹐无商量余地的﹔不能更改的
Sense.EXAMPLE: He emphasized that the government’s anti-nuclear position was non-negotiable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他强调政府的反核立场是不可动摇的。

Sense.DEF: a cheque, bond etc that is non-negotiable can only be exchanged for money by the person whose name is on it
something that you must not do because it is considered to be unacceptable behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 不准干的事﹔不能接受的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: Colouring your hair was a no-no at that time.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 染发在那时是绝不允许的。

Sense.DEF: very practical and direct, without wasting time on unnecessary things
Sense.TRAN: 实事求是的﹐务实的﹔直截了当的﹐不绕弯子的
Sense.EXAMPLE: his no-nonsense attitude to business
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在业务上的务实态度

Sense.DEF: very small pieces of coloured sugar used to decorate cakes
a piece of chocolate covered with nonpareils
Sense.TRAN: 沾有彩色珠子糖的巧克力

Sense.DEF: someone or something that is much better than all the others
Sense.EXAMPLE: reviews by film critic nonpareil Pauline Kael
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无与伦比的影评家宝琳•凯尔所写的影评

Sense.DEF: not supporting the ideas of any political party or group
Sense.TRAN: 不支持任何党派的﹐无党派的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-partisan research group
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无党派研究小组

Sense.DEF: when you do not pay the money that you owe in tax, rent etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She was finally evicted in April for non-payment of rent.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她终因付不起房租在4月份被赶了出来。

Sense.DEF: so surprised by something that you do not know what to say or do
Sense.TRAN: 惊讶不已的﹔不知所措的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Billy was completely nonplussed by Elliot’s refusal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 比利被埃利奥特的拒绝搞得完全不知所措。

Sense.DEF: a non-prescription drug is one that you can buy in a shop without a written order from a doctor
a non­profit organization uses the money it earns to help people instead of making a profit
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-profit educational institution
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非营利教育机构

Sense.DEF: the limiting of the number of nuclear or chemical weapons in the world, especially by stopping countries that do not yet have them from developing them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Over 20 countries have now signed the Nuclear Non-proliferation Treaty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前已有20多个国家签署了《不扩散核武器条约》。

Sense.DEF: a non-refundable amount of money cannot be paid back to you
Sense.TRAN: 不可偿还的﹔不能退款的
Sense.EXAMPLE: There is a £40 deposit, which is non-refundable.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有一笔40英镑的押金﹐是不能退还的。

Sense.DEF: non-renewable types of energy such as coal or gas cannot be replaced after they have been used
Sense.EXAMPLE: All countries are being asked to cut down on their use of non-renewable resources.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 所有国家都被要求减少利用不可再生资源。

Sense.DEF: someone who does not live permanently in a particular country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: A lot of houses in the area are being bought by non­residents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个地区的许多房屋正在被非本地居民购买。

Sense.DEF: someone who is not staying in a particular hotel
Sense.EXAMPLE: The hotel restaurant is open to non­residents.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒店餐厅对非住客开放。

Sense.DEF: if a course, activity etc is non-residential, you are not provided with a place to stay while you are doing it
Sense.TRAN: 〔课程﹑活动等〕不提供住宿的﹔走读的

Sense.DEF: non-residential areas or buildings are not places where people live

a non-restrictive relative clause gives additional information about a particular person or thing rather than saying which person or thing is being mentioned. For example, in the sentence ‘Perry, who is 22, was arrested yesterday’, the phrase ‘who is 22’ is a non-restrictive clause.
a non-returnable amount of money cannot be paid back to you
Sense.EXAMPLE: Please send this form back with a non-returnable deposit of £60.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 请将表格连同60英镑订金寄回﹐订金恕不退还。

Sense.DEF: things that are non-returnable cannot be taken back to a shop and used again
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-returnable bottles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不可回收的瓶子

Sense.DEF: not using scientific methods to collect information and form opinions
Sense.TRAN: 非科学的﹔不使用科学方法的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report is based on non-scientific data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那篇报道所依据的并非科学数据。

Sense.DEF: ideas, opinions, statements etc that are not true or that seem very stupid
Sense.TRAN: 荒谬的想法[看法]﹔胡说﹐废话
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’m a prisoner in my own home.’ ‘Nonsense!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我在自己家里就像个囚犯。”“胡说！”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: ‘Nobody cares about me.’ ‘That’s absolute nonsense, Mary!’
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: “没人关心我。”“玛丽﹐你这完全是胡扯！”

GramExa.EXAMPLE: all this nonsense about health foods
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有关健康食品的一派胡言

Sense.EXAMPLE: If you ask me, these modern teaching methods are a load of nonsense a lot of nonsense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 要我说﹐这些现代教学方法全是一派胡言。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was talking utter nonsense as usual.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他像平常一样又在胡说八道了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The government’s housing policy is a nonsense.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 政府的住房政策太荒谬了。

Sense.EXAMPLE: By 1832 the idea had become an economic nonsense.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 到了1832年﹐那种观点已经成为经济学的谬论。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is (a) nonsense to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It is nonsense to say that mistakes are never made.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从来不犯错误这种说法真荒唐。

Sense.DEF: behaviour that is stupid and annoying
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’re to stop that nonsense, do you hear me?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你不能再那样胡闹了﹐听见没有？

GramExa.PROPFORM: not stand/put up with/take any nonsense
GramExa.GLOSS: not accept such behaviour
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She won’t stand any nonsense from the kids in her class.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她不允许孩子们在她的课上胡闹。

Sense.DEF: speech or writing that has no meaning or cannot be understood
Sense.EXAMPLE: Computer programs look like complete nonsense to me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对我来说﹐计算机程序就好像是天书﹐不知所云。

Sense.DEF: to make an action, system, or plan useless or ineffective
Sense.TRAN: 使某事物失去作用[意义]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having the army still in power makes a nonsense of last year’s elections.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 军队继续掌权使得去年的选举失去了意义。

Sense.DEF: poetry that is humorous because it does not have a sensible meaning
ideas, actions, or statements that are nonsensical are not reasonable or sensible
Sense.TRAN: 无意义的﹔愚蠢的﹔荒谬的
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is a nonsensical argument.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是一场毫无意义的争论。

Sense.DEF: a statement which does not seem to be connected in a reasonable or sensible way with what was said before
Sense.TRAN: 前后不连贯的陈述﹐不根据前提的推论

Sense.DEF: a non-slip surface prevents you from slipping and falling
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-slip bath mat
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 防滑浴垫

Sense.DEF: someone who does not smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: an area reserved for non-smokers
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非吸烟人士专用的区域

Sense.DEF: a non-smoking area is one where you are not allowed to smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-smoking restaurant
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 禁烟的餐馆

Sense.DEF: used to describe someone who does not smoke
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-drinking, non-smoking fitness fanatic
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不喝酒﹑不吸烟的健康迷

Sense.DEF: a non-specific medical condition could have one of several causes
Sense.TRAN: 〔疾病等〕原因不明确的﹐非特异性的
Sense.EXAMPLE: children with non-specific abdominal pain
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 患非特异性腹痛的儿童

Sense.DEF: not exact or detailed, or not relating to one particular thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: The description was deliberately non-specific.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 描述故意模棱两可。

Sense.DEF: non-standard ways of speaking are not usually considered to be correct by educated speakers of a language
Sense.EXAMPLE: Non-standard dialects of English are regional dialects.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英语中不规范的方言都是地区性的方言。

Sense.DEF: not the usual size or type
Sense.TRAN: 〔尺寸或类型〕不标准的﹐不规则的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-standard disk size
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非标准磁盘尺寸

Sense.DEF: an idea, a plan, or a person that has no chance of success
Sense.TRAN: 无成功机会的想法[计划﹐人]
Sense.EXAMPLE: In its present form the scheme is a non-starter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一方案照其现有模式是行不通的。

Sense.DEF: a non-stick cooking pan has a special inside surface which prevents food from sticking to it
without any stops or pauses
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nonstop flight to Los Angeles
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 直飞洛杉矶的航班

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She talked nonstop for over an hour.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一刻不停地讲了一个多小时。

Sense.DEF: not making someone feel afraid or worried
Sense.TRAN: 没有威胁的﹐不令人害怕的
Sense.EXAMPLE: It is important to create a safe, non-threatening environment for children.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为孩子们创造一个安全轻松的环境很重要。

Sense.DEF: not poisonous or harmful to your health
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-toxic paint
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无毒油漆

Sense.DEF: different from the way something happened or from what was considered typical in the past
Sense.TRAN: 非传统的﹔不符合传统的
Sense.EXAMPLE: older, non-traditional university students
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 较年长的另类大学生
Sense.EXAMPLE: non-traditional workdays
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非传统工作日

Sense.DEF: non-union workers do not belong to a trade union official organization for workers
businesses or organizations that are non-union do not officially accept trade unions, or do not employ their members
Sense.TRAN: 不承认工会的﹔不雇用工会会员的

Sense.DEF: not using words
Sense.TRAN: 不用言辞表达的﹐非语言的
Sense.EXAMPLE: nonverbal forms of communication
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非语言交际形式

Sense.DEF: the practice of opposing a government without using violence, for example by not obeying laws
Sense.TRAN: 非暴力反抗﹔非暴力主义
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was committed to non-violence.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她致力于非暴力反抗。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a policy of non-violence
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非暴力政策

Sense.DEF: not using or not involving violence
Sense.EXAMPLE: a non-violent protest against the government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 非暴力的反政府抗议
Sense.EXAMPLE: an increase in the amount of violent and non-violent crime
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 暴力及非暴力犯罪数量的增长

Sense.DEF: someone who does not belong to a white race
a long thin piece of food made from a mixture of flour, water, and eggs, usually cooked in soup or boiling water
Sense.EXAMPLE: Serve the meat with rice or noodles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肉配米饭或面条一起上。

Sense.DEF: a small quiet place which is sheltered by a rock, a big tree etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: a shady nook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 阴凉的隐蔽处

Sense.DEF: a small space in a corner of a room
Sense.EXAMPLE: the table in the breakfast nook
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 放置在早餐角的桌子

Sense.DEF: every part of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: We searched every nook and cranny.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们搜遍了每个角落。

Sense.DEF: the activity of having sex – used humorously
12 o’clock in the daytime

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We left home at noon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们在中午离开了家。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He rarely gets up before noon.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他很少在中午之前起床。

Sense.EXAMPLE: We met at 12 noon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们中午12点见了面。

Sense.DEF: happening or appearing at noon
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was impossible to work in the heat of the noonday sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 正午炎炎的烈日下无法工作。

Sense.DEF: not anyone
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one likes being criticized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人喜欢受到批评。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no one else I really want to invite apart from you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 除你之外﹐我不太想再邀请其他人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Has no one phoned about the car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人打电话问那辆车的事吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one can say I didn’t warn you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁也不能说我没有警告过你。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法: no one, nobody
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use another negative word (eg ‘not’) with no one and nobody.
F2NBox.TRAN: no one和nobody不应与其他否定词(如not)连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: Nobody could hear me (NOT 不说 No body could not hear me).
No one did anything about the problem (NOT 不说 No one did nothing ...).
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有人去解决这个问题 。
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use ‘of’ after no one and nobody. Use none of or, if you are talking about two people, neither of.
F2NBox.TRAN: no one和nobody后面不要使用of﹐而要用none of﹐指两个人时用neither of
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: None of them saw him.
Neither of his parents had come to the wedding.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的父母都没来参加婚礼 。

Sense.DEF: a ring formed by the end of a piece of rope, which closes more tightly as it is pulled, used especially for killing someone by hanging them
used to say ‘no’ when you answer someone
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Hungry?’ ‘Nope, I just ate.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “饿吗？”“不饿﹐我刚吃过。”

Sense.DEF: nowhere
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no place left to hide.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 已经无处可藏了。

Sense.DEF: used when mentioning two things that are not true or do not happen
Sense.EXAMPLE: He can neither read nor write he cannot read or write.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他既不会读也不会写。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Hilary was neither shocked nor surprised by the news.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 希拉里对这个消息既没有感到震惊﹐也没有觉得意外。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Neither Matt nor Julie said anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马特和朱莉都没有说什么。

Sense.DEF: used after a negative statement in order to introduce another negative statement containing a similar kind of information
Sense.TRAN: 也不〔用于否定句之后﹐引导另一含相似意义的否定句〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t expect children to be rude, nor do I expect to be disobeyed.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不希望孩子们没礼貌﹐也不希望他们不听我的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was not my fault, nor his.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不是我的错﹐也不是他的。

Sense.DEF: used after a negative statement to say that the negative statement is also true for someone or some­thing else
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I don’t want to go.’ ‘Nor do I.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我不想去。”“我也不想去。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: They couldn’t understand it at the time, and nor could we.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们当时无法理解﹐我们也是。

Sense.DEF: a prefix meaning ‘north’, used especially by sailors
Sense.EXAMPLE: nor’east
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 东北
Sense.EXAMPLE: nor’west
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 西北

Sense.DEF: relating to the northern European countries of Denmark, Norway, Sweden, Iceland, and Finland, or to their people
Sense.EXAMPLE: the Nordic countries
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北欧国家

Sense.DEF: the usual or normal situation, way of doing something etc

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Short term contracts are now the norm with some big companies.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 签订短期合同是目前一些大公司的惯常做法。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Joyce’s style of writing was a striking departure from the literary norm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 乔伊斯的写作风格与传统的文学风格大相径庭。

Sense.DEF: generally accepted standards of social behaviour
Sense.EXAMPLE: terrorists who violate the norms of civilized society
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 违反文明社会准则的恐怖分子

Sense.DEF: the normal or average standard

GramExa.EXAMPLE: 28% of children tested below the norm.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有28%的儿童化验结果低于正常水平。

Sense.DEF: usual, typical, or expected
Sense.TRAN: 正常的﹔平常的﹔意料之中的
Sense.EXAMPLE: A normal working week is 40 hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一个正常的工作周是40小时。

GramExa.PROPFORM: it is normal (for sb) to do sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s normal to feel nervous before an exam.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 考试之前觉得紧张是正常的。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Her room was untidy, but that was quite normal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的房间很乱﹐不过那也很正常。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She was assessed in the normal way, and placed on the waiting list.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她接受了正常的评估后被列入等候名单。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All I want is to lead a normal life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想要的只是能过正常的生活。

Sense.DEF: someone who is normal is mentally and physically healthy and does not behave strangely
Sense.EXAMPLE: He seems a perfectly normal little boy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看起来是个完全正常的小男孩。
Sense.EXAMPLE: They can’t be normal to do something like that.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 会做那样的事﹐他们一定心理不正常。

Exponent.DEF: usual, typical, and as you would expect it to be
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Is this cold weather normal for the time of year?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时候这样冷的天气正常吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It had been another normal working day in the office.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 又是一个普通的办公室工作日。

Exponent.DEF: not special, unusual, or different from normal
Exponent.EXAMPLE: They lived in an ordinary three-bedroomed house.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们住在一幢普通的三居室房子里。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Would you like a regular salad or a Caesar salad?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你要普通的色拉还是恺撒色拉？

Exponent.DEF: around the usual level or amount
Exponent.EXAMPLE: She is of average height.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 她中等个子。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He is of above average intelligence.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的智力在中等以上。

Exponent.DEF: normal – used about methods of doing something, or about the size, shape, features etc of products
Exponent.TRAN: 〔做某事的方法或产品的大小﹑形状﹑特征等〕标准的﹐常规的
Exponent.EXAMPLE: It’s standard practice to X-ray hand-baggage at most airports.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 扫描手提行李是多数机场的常规做法。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: We stock shoes in all the standard sizes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们的鞋子备有所有标准尺寸。

Exponent.DEF: used about things that are done regularly as part of a series of things
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The fault was discovered during a routine check of the plane.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这一故障是在飞机的一次例行检查中发现的。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: routine tasks such as shopping and cooking
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 购物和做饭之类的日常事务

Exponent.DEF: used about things that happen or that you use as part of normal life
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He painted scenes of everyday life in France.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他描画法国日常生活场景。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Sally was still dressed in her everyday clothes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨莉仍穿着平常的衣服。

Exponent.DEF: used about birds and plants that are of the most usual type, and in the phrase the common people people who are not rich and powerful
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the common goldfish
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 普通的金鱼
Exponent.EXAMPLE: an alliance between the aristocracy and the common people
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 贵族和普通老百姓的联盟

Exponent.DEF: of the kind that is usually used – used when comparing this with a different or special type
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The engine is more efficient than a conventional diesel engine.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种引擎比传统引擎效率高。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: the drugs used in conventional medicine
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统医学所用的药
Exponent.EXAMPLE: conventional weapons not nuclear, chemical, or biological
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 常规武器

Sense.DEF: the usual state, level, or amount
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thankfully, train services are now back to normal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢天谢地﹐火车服务现在恢复正常了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Slowly her heartbeat returned to normal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的心跳逐渐恢复正常。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Car sales are still below normal for the time of year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个时期的汽车销量仍然低于正常水平。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The journey took longer than normal.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅途超过了平常所需的时间。

Sense.DEF: a situation in which things happen in the usual or expected way
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’re hoping for a return to normality as soon as possible.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们希望尽快恢复正常。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ll soon get back to some semblance of normality.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们会很快恢复到稍微正常一些的状态。

Sense.DEF: if you normalize a situation, or if it normalizes, it becomes normal again
Sense.EXAMPLE: Journalists are reporting that the situation has now normalized.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新闻记者报道说﹐局势现已恢复正常。

Sense.DEF: if two countries normalize relations, or if relations normalize, the two countries behave in a normal way towards each other again
Sense.TRAN: (使)〔国家关系〕正常化﹐(使)邦交正常化
Sense.EXAMPLE: Relations between the countries were formally normalized in 1997.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 两国关系于1997年正式恢复正常。

Sense.DEF: usually
Sense.EXAMPLE: The journey normally takes about two hours.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这段旅程通常需要大约两小时。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Normally, I park behind the theatre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 通常我把车停在剧院后面。

Sense.DEF: in a normal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: The system seems to be working normally now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前该系统似乎运行正常。

Sense.DEF: built in the style that was popular during the 11th and 12th centuries in Europe
Sense.TRAN: 〔建筑〕诺曼式的﹐诺曼风格的〔指11至12世纪时欧洲盛行的一种建筑风格〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: a Norman church
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 诺曼式教堂

Sense.DEF: relating to the Normans, the northern French people who took control of England in the 11th century
describing or establishing a set of rules or standards of behaviour
Sense.TRAN: 合乎规范的﹔按规定准则的
Sense.EXAMPLE: normative guidelines for senators
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 参议员行为准则

Sense.DEF: relating to the people of ancient Scandinavia or their language
Sense.TRAN: 古代斯堪的纳维亚人的﹔古代斯堪的纳维亚语的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Norse legends
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 古代斯堪的纳维亚传奇故事

Sense.DEF: the language that was spoken by the people of ancient Scandinavia
a viking
Sense.TRAN: 古代斯堪的纳维亚人﹐北欧海盗﹐维京人

Sense.DEF: the direction that is at the top of a map of the world, above the Equator. It is on the left if you are facing the rising sun
Sense.EXAMPLE: Which way is north?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哪边是北？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: winds blowing from the north
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 北方吹来的风

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Cheshunt is a few miles to the north of London.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 切森特位于伦敦以北几英里。

Sense.DEF: in the north or facing the north
Sense.EXAMPLE: The north side of the building doesn’t get much sun.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大楼的北面很少晒到太阳。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He lives in North Wales.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他住在威尔士北部。

Sense.DEF: a north wind comes from the north
towards the north
Sense.EXAMPLE: The birds fly north in summer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 夏季鸟儿向北飞。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Chicago is four hours north of Indianapolis.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 芝加哥位于印第安纳波利斯以北﹐车程四小时。

Sense.EXAMPLE: a north-facing window
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朝北的窗户

Sense.DEF: to or in the north of the country
Sense.TRAN: 往〔国家的〕北部﹔在〔国家的〕北部
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve moved up north.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们搬到北部去了。

Sense.DEF: the northeastern states of the US, especially during the Civil War (1861–1865) when they fought against the South
the northern part of England, which includes the area north of the Midlands and south of the Scottish border, and contains several large cities, including Manchester, Leeds, Liverpool, and Newcastle
the richer countries of the northern parts of the world, especially Europe and North America
Sense.TRAN: 北半球富裕国家〔尤指欧洲和北美洲〕

Sense.DEF: travelling or leading towards the north
Sense.EXAMPLE: a northbound bus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北行的公共汽车
Sense.EXAMPLE: the northbound lane of the A1
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: A1号公路的北行车道

Sense.DEF: in or from the north of England
Sense.EXAMPLE: a low north-country voice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 低沉的英格兰北部嗓音

Sense.DEF: the direction that is exactly between north and east

RunOn.EXAMPLE: He headed northeast across the open sea.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 他朝东北方向穿越公海。

Sense.DEF: a northeast wind comes from the northeast
in the northeast of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the northeast outskirts of Las Vegas
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 拉斯维加斯的东北郊区

Sense.DEF: a strong wind or storm coming from the northeast
towards or in the northeast
Sense.TRAN: 向东北方的﹔在东北方的
Sense.EXAMPLE: They set off in a northeasterly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们向东北方向出发。

Sense.DEF: a northeasterly wind comes from the northeast
in or from the northeast part of a country or area
Sense.TRAN: 东北部的﹔来自东北部的
Sense.EXAMPLE: the northeastern states of the US
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 美国东北部各州

Sense.DEF: towards the northeast
towards or in the north
Sense.EXAMPLE: We set off in a northerly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向北出发。

Sense.DEF: a northerly wind comes from the north
in or from the north of a country or area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a man with a northern accent
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 带有北方口音的男子
Sense.EXAMPLE: Northern Europe
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 北欧

Sense.DEF: someone from the northern part of a country
the half of the world that is north of the Equator
furthest north
Sense.EXAMPLE: the northernmost tip of the island
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 岛屿的最北端

Sense.DEF: the most northern point on the surface of the Earth
towards the north
Sense.EXAMPLE: We sailed northwards.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向北航行。

Sense.DEF: the direction that is exactly between north and west
the northwestern part of a country

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她乘车前往西北部的博尔德。

Sense.DEF: a northwest wind comes from the northwest
in the northwest of a place
Sense.EXAMPLE: the northwest suburbs of the city
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 城市西北部的郊区

Sense.DEF: a strong wind or storm coming from the northwest
towards or in the northwest
Sense.EXAMPLE: We headed off in a northwesterly direction.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们向西北方向进发。

Sense.DEF: a northwesterly wind comes from the northwest
in or from the northwest part of a country or area
Sense.TRAN: 西北部的﹔来自西北部的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a town in northwestern Canada
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 加拿大西北部的一座城镇

Sense.DEF: towards the northwest

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= numbers 第…号

Sense.DEF: the part of a person’s or animal’s face used for smelling or breathing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Someone punched him on the nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有人一拳打在他的鼻子上。

Subsense.DEF: if something bad or illegal happens under someone’s nose, they do not notice it even though it is happening very close to them and they should have noticed it
Subsense.TRAN: (就)在某人眼皮底下﹐(就)当着某人的面
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The drugs were smuggled in right under the noses of the security guards.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 毒品就在保安人员的眼皮底下走私进来。

Subsense.DEF: if something is right under someone’s nose, they cannot see it even though it is very close to them
Subsense.TRAN: 就在某人眼前〔却看不见〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The key was right under my nose all the time.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 原来钥匙一直就在我面前。

Sense.DEF: to become involved in something that does not concern you, in a way that annoys people
Sense.TRAN: 多管闲事﹔插手与己无关的事
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always has to stick her nose into matters that do not concern her.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是非要插手和自己无关的事情。

Sense.DEF: to avoid becoming involved in something that does not concern you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish he’d keep his nose out of my business!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他别来过问我的事！

Sense.DEF: to refuse to accept something because you do not think it is good enough for you
Sense.TRAN: 瞧不起(某事物)﹐(对某事物)嗤之以鼻
Sense.EXAMPLE: My children turn their noses up at home cooking.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的孩子都看不上家里做的饭菜。

Sense.LEXUNIT: with your nose in the air
Sense.DEF: behaving as if you are more important than other people and not talking to them
Sense.TRAN: 目中无人地﹔瞧不起人地
Sense.EXAMPLE: She just walked past with her nose in the air.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她目中无人地走了过去。

Sense.DEF: to be naturally good at finding and recognizing something
Sense.TRAN: 天生擅长寻找[识别]某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: a reporter with a good nose for a story
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 擅长发掘素材的新闻记者

Sense.DEF: to annoy someone very much
Sense.EXAMPLE: I wish he wouldn’t keep interrupting. It really gets up my nose.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望他不要一直打断我﹐那样真让我恼火。

Sense.DEF: to make sure you do not get into trouble, or do anything wrong or illegal
Sense.TRAN: 遵纪守法﹔行为检点﹔不卷入是非
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sid’s got to keep his nose clean or he’ll end up back in prison.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 德必须检点一些﹐否则还得回去坐牢。

Sense.DEF: exactly
Sense.EXAMPLE: He gets up at 6 a.m. on the nose every morning.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他每天早上6点准时起床。

Sense.LEXUNIT: keep your nose to the grindstone
Sense.DEF: to work very hard, without stopping to rest
Sense.TRAN: 努力工作﹐一刻不停地苦干
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim had decided he was going to keep his nose to the grindstone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆下定决心努力工作。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have your nose in a book/magazine/newspaper
Sense.DEF: to be reading a book etc, especially with a lot of interest
Sense.TRAN: 专心致志地看书/杂志/报纸
Sense.EXAMPLE: She always had her nose in a book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她总是埋头看书。

Sense.DEF: if a horse wins a race by a nose, it only just wins
to look around a place in order to try to find something, when there is no one else there
Sense.TRAN: 〔当某处无其他人时〕四处观看﹔四处寻找

Sense.LEXUNIT: put sb’s nose out of joint
Sense.DEF: to annoy someone, especially by attracting everyone’s attention away from them
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指通过抢夺众人的注意力〕使某人气歪鼻子﹐使某人眼红
Sense.EXAMPLE: His nose has been a bit out of joint ever since Marion got here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自从玛丽昂来这儿以后﹐他被冷落得鼻子都快气歪了。

Sense.DEF: cars, buses etc that are nose to tail are in a line without much space between them
Sense.EXAMPLE: Traffic was nose to tail for three miles.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 车辆首尾相接堵了三英里长。

Sense.DEF: the pointed front end of a plane, rocket etc
the smell of a wine or tobacco

Crossrefto.REFLEX: cut off your nose to spite your face
look down your nose at sb/sth
as plain as the nose on your face
rub sb’s nose in it/in the dirt

Collocate.EXAMPLE: See that guy over there, the one with the big nose?
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到那边那家伙了吗﹐那个大鼻子的？

Collocate.EXAMPLE: She had high cheekbones and a small nose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她有高高的颧骨﹐小小的鼻子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: His nose was long and his chin square.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他有长长的鼻子﹐方方的下巴。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Her nose was long, straight and elegant.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的鼻子又长又挺﹐非常雅致。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: with liquid coming out
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A runny nose may be the result of an allergic reaction.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 流鼻涕可能是过敏反应引起的。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: so that you cannot breathe easily
Collocate.EXAMPLE: My nose is really blocked and I can't smell anything.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的鼻子塞得厉害﹐什么都闻不出来。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: because you are cold or drunk, or have a cold
Collocate.EXAMPLE: His nose was red from the cold.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的鼻子冻得发红。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: one that curves up at the end
one that curves down at the end
one that curves out near the top
one that is not straight because the bone has been broken by a hit or fall
clear your nose by blowing strongly into a piece of soft paper or cloth
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She blew her nose on a large white handkerchief.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她拿着一块白色的大手帕擤鼻涕。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: wipe liquid away from your nose
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The boy wiped his nose on his sleeve.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 男孩把鼻涕擦在袖子上。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: remove substances from inside your nose with your finger
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Stop picking your nose, Freddy.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 不要抠鼻子﹐弗雷迪。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: move the muscles near your nose when you do not like something
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Susan looked at the meal and wrinkled her nose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 苏珊看着饭菜﹐皱起鼻子。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: so that you cannot smell a bad smell
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The smell was so revolting that I had to hold my nose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 那气味恶心极了﹐我只得捏住鼻子。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: Close your eyes and breathe through your nose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 闭上眼睛﹐用鼻子呼吸。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: liquid is coming out
Collocate.EXAMPLE: She was crying hard and her nose was running.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 她使劲哭﹐鼻涕直流。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: the upper part, between your eyes
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Sam pushed his glasses up on the bridge of his nose.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨姆推了推鼻梁上的眼镜。

Sense.DEF: if a vehicle, boat etc noses forward, or if you nose it forward, it moves forward slowly
Sense.TRAN: 〔车辆﹑船只等〕缓慢地前行﹔将〔车辆﹑船只等〕缓慢地向前开

GramExa.PROPFORM: nose its way along/through etc sth
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The bus nosed its way along the street.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那辆公共汽车沿街道缓缓前行。

Sense.EXAMPLE: She carefully nosed the car forward through the traffic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她小心地在车流中将车慢慢向前开。

Sense.DEF: to look around a place in order to try to find something, when there is no one else there
Sense.TRAN: 〔当某处无其他人时〕探查﹐打探﹐搜寻(某事物)
Sense.EXAMPLE: What were you doing nosing around in my office?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你独自在我的办公室里探头探脑干什么？

Sense.DEF: to try to find out private information about someone or something, especially in a way that is annoying
to discover some information that someone else does not want you to discover
Sense.EXAMPLE: The media always manage to nose out some interesting facts about a politician’s past life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 媒体总是能想方设法挖出政客过去生活中的趣闻轶事。

Sense.DEF: to defeat someone by a very small amount in a race, competition etc
a bag that holds food and is hung around a horse’s head
if you have a nosebleed, blood starts flowing from your nose
the pointed front part of an aircraft, missile, or rocket
Sense.TRAN: 〔飞机﹑导弹或火箭的〕头部﹐前锥体

Sense.DEF: a sudden very large fall in the price, value, or condition of something
Sense.TRAN: 〔价格﹑价值或状况的〕急降﹐猛跌
Sense.EXAMPLE: The pound took a nosedive on the foreign exchange market today.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 英镑今天在外汇交易市场上出现暴跌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The economy went into a nosedive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济形势急转直下。

Sense.DEF: a sudden steep drop made by a plane with its front end pointing towards the ground
Sense.EXAMPLE: Everyone screamed as the plane suddenly went into a nosedive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 飞机突然垂直俯冲﹐大家都尖叫起来。

Sense.DEF: if a price, value, or condition of something nosedives, it suddenly goes down or gets much worse
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sales have nosedived since January.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自1月份以来销售额骤降。

Sense.DEF: if a plane nosedives, it drops suddenly and steeply with its front end pointing towards the ground
a small arrangement of flowers
a medical operation on someone’s nose to improve its appearance
another spelling of nosy
food
a small amount of food eaten between meals
to eat
someone who does not arrive or appear somewhere they were expected to be, for example at a restaurant or a meeting
Sense.TRAN: 不能如约出席者〔如已预订餐厅座位或约定见面却不到场的人〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The bad weather meant there were a lot of no-shows at the game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天气不好导致有很多人没来观看比赛。

Sense.DEF: a big meal

Sense.TRAN: 禁烟的﹐不准吸烟的﹔不吸烟的

Sense.DEF: a feeling that a time in the past was good, or the activity of remembering a good time in the past and wishing that things had not changed
Sense.TRAN: 对过去美好时光的留恋﹐恋旧﹔怀旧

GramExa.EXAMPLE: nostalgia for the good old days
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对美好过去的留恋

Sense.EXAMPLE: He looked back on his university days with a certain amount of nostalgia.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他带着一点留恋﹐回忆起大学时光。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a wave of nostalgia for how great life was in the 1960s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一阵对20世纪60年代美好生活的强烈怀旧之情

Sense.DEF: if you feel nostalgic about a time in the past, you feel happy when you remember it, and in some ways you wish that things had not changed
Sense.EXAMPLE: Seeing those old school photographs has made me feel quite nostalgic.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看到那些学生时代的旧照片﹐我不禁产生了怀旧之情。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nostalgic look back at the 1950s
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对20世纪50年代的怀念

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He remained nostalgic about his days as a young actor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直怀念自己还是名年轻演员时的岁月。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Tim spoke nostalgically of his first visit to Peru.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 蒂姆留恋地谈起第一次去秘鲁时的情形。

Sense.DEF: one of the two holes at the end of your nose, through which you breathe and smell things
Sense.EXAMPLE: The smell of gunpowder filled his nostrils.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 火药味灌进他的鼻孔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the horse’s flaring nostrils widened nostrils
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 马儿张大的鼻孔

Sense.DEF: an idea that someone thinks will solve a problem easily, but will probably not help at all
Sense.TRAN: 〔实际上也许毫无用处的〕妙计﹐妙策
Sense.EXAMPLE: an economic nostrum
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 经济上的灵丹妙药

Sense.DEF: always wanting to find out things that do not concern you, especially other people’s private affairs
Sense.TRAN: 好管闲事的﹐爱打听别人事情的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Don’t be so nosy!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 别这么爱管闲事！
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nosy neighbor
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱管闲事的邻居

Sense.DEF: a thorough look around a place, especially somewhere that belongs to someone else and is private
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指对属于他人之地或隐秘处所的〕彻底查看
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d love to have a good old nosy in Josey’s room!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想好好看看乔西的房间！

Sense.DEF: someone who is too interested in finding out about other people’s affairs – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 爱打听别人事情的人﹐爱管闲事的人〔含贬义〕

Sense.DEF: used to make a word, statement, or question negative
Sense.TRAN: 不﹐没﹐不是〔用于把词语﹑陈述或问句等变为否定的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the stores do not open until 10 am.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数商店要到上午10点才开始营业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s not a very nice person.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她为人不太好。
Sense.EXAMPLE: You were wrong not to inform the police.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你没有通知警方是错误的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Can we go to the park?’ ‘No, not today, dear.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我们能去公园吗？”“不﹐今天不行﹐亲爱的。”

GramExa.GLOSS: used to emphasize what you are saying
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 根本不/一点也不…〔用于强调〕
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The changes were not at all surprising.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些变化根本不令人吃惊。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I do not like his attitude at all.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一点也不喜欢他的态度。

Sense.DEF: used in order to make a word or expression have the opposite meaning
Sense.TRAN: 不﹐不是〔用于使词语或说法表示相反的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Edinburgh isn’t far now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爱丁堡现在不远了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The food is not very good there.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那里的食物不太好吃。

GramExa.GLOSS: only a few, only a little etc
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not much is known about the disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该疾病的了解还不多。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not many people have read the report.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没多少人读过这篇报道。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Most of the hotels are not that cheap they are fairly expensive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 大多数宾馆没有那么便宜。

Sense.DEF: used instead of a whole phrase to mean the opposite of what has been mentioned before it
Sense.TRAN: 〔用来代替前面提到的整个语句﹐表示与其相反的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: No one knows if the story is true or not.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没人知道这事是真是假。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope to see you tomorrow, but if not, leave me a message.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望明天和你见面﹐不过如果不行的话﹐给我留个口信。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Is Mark still sick?’ ‘I hope not.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “马克还在生病吗？”“希望没有。”

Sense.DEF: in addition to being or doing something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Shakespeare was not only a writer but also an actor.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 莎士比亚不仅是个作家﹐而且还是位演员。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Not only do the nurses want a pay increase, they want reduced hours as well.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士们不仅要求提高工资﹐还要求缩短工作时间。

Sense.DEF: not any person or thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Not one of the students knew the answer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一个学生知道答案。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There wasn’t a cloud in the sky.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天空万里无云。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: person said thank you.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有一个人说谢谢。

Sense.DEF: used before a sentence or phrase to mean the opposite of what follows it, and to make the previous sentence seem less important
Sense.TRAN: 并不…〔用于表示前面的语句不太重要〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sarah has a new boyfriend not that I care I do not care.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 萨拉找了个新男友——我并不在乎。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Janice had lost some weight, not that it mattered it did not matter.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 贾尼丝体重减轻了一些﹐不过那没什么。

Sense.DEF: used to be polite when someone has thanked you or asked you to do something
Sense.TRAN: 别客气﹔没问题﹔一点也不介意
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Would you mind helping me with my suitcase?’ ‘Not at all.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你能帮我提一下行李箱吗？”“没问题。”

Sense.LEXUNIT: not the sharpest tool in the box/shed

Variant.LEXVAR: not the brightest crayon in the box

Sense.LEXUNIT: not the brightest bulb on the Christmas tree
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone is not very intelligent or is not able to learn things quickly or easily – used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔某人〕并不是很聪明﹐学东西并不快〔幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: used, especially by young people, to say that you really mean the opposite of what you have just said
Sense.TRAN: 才不是呢！〔尤为年轻人所用﹐表示与刚说的话相反的意思〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I really enjoy spending my day working here – not!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很喜欢白天在这儿上班——才不是呢！

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use another negative word (eg ‘no’, ‘nothing’, ‘nobody’, ‘never’) with not. Use any, anything, anybody, ever etc.
F2NBox.TRAN: not不应与其他否定词(如 no﹐ nothing﹐ nobody﹐ never)连用﹐而应与any﹐ anything﹐ anybody﹐ ever等连用
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: They didn’t have any money (NOT 不说 didn’t have no money).
I didn’t know anybody (NOT 不说 didn’t know nobody).
F2NBox.EXPL: When you use not with a to-infinitive, put it before the ‘to’.
F2NBox.TRAN: not和to的不定式连用﹐应放在to之前
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I try not to make errors (NOT 不说 try to not make errors).

Sense.DEF: important, interesting, excellent, or unusual enough to be noticed or mentioned
Sense.TRAN: 显要的﹔显著的﹔值得注意的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A notable feature of the church is its unusual bell tower.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这座教堂的一个特别之处就是它那座与众不同的钟楼。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Every country in the world signed the treaty, with one notable exception - the United States.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全世界每个国家都签署了那份条约﹐只有一个国家反其道而行之﹐就是美国。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The town is notable for its busy open-air market.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城镇因其热闹的露天市场而出名。

Sense.DEF: important or famous people
Sense.EXAMPLE: local notables
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 当地要人

Sense.DEF: used to say that a person or thing is a typical example or the most important example of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Some early doctors, notably Hippocrates, thought that diet was important.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 早期的一些医生﹐尤其是希波克拉底﹐认为饮食很重要。

Sense.DEF: in a way that is clearly different, important, or unusual
Sense.EXAMPLE: Emigration has notably increased over the past five years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去五年中﹐移居国外的人明显增加。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Notably absent from his statement was any hint of an apology.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的话里显然没有丝毫道歉的意思。

Sense.DEF: signed by a notary
someone, especially a lawyer, who has the legal power to make a signed statement or document official
Sense.TRAN: 公证人﹐公证员〔尤指律师〕

Sense.DEF: a system of written marks or signs used to represent something such as music, mathematics, or scientific ideas
a level on a scale that measures something, for example quality or achievement
Sense.EXAMPLE: Her new book is several notches above anything else she has written.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的新书比她的其他作品高出了好几个等级。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jackson raised his voice by a notch.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 杰克逊将嗓音提高了一度。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Spartans turned it up a notch in the second half.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 斯巴达人队在下半场中比分有所提高。

Sense.DEF: a V-shaped cut or hole in a surface or edge
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cut a notch near one end of the stick.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在手杖的一端刻一个V形记号。

Sense.DEF: a passage between two mountains or hills
to cut a V-shaped mark into something, especially as a way of showing the number of times something has been done
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指为记录次数而〕在…上刻下V字形切口﹐在…上开V形槽口

Sense.DEF: to notch something up
to achieve something, especially a victory or a particular total or score
Sense.TRAN: 赢得﹐获取〔尤指胜利或某一总数等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The Houston Astros have notched up another win.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 休斯敦太空人队又赢了一场比赛。

Subsense.DEF: something that you write down to remind you of something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Dave made a note of her address and phone number.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴夫记下了她的地址和电话号码。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Keep a careful note of any problems you have with the software.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 仔细记录使用这个软件时碰到的任何问题。

Subsense.LEXUNIT: make a (mental) note to do sth
Subsense.DEF: to decide that you must remember to do something later
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He made a mental note to arrange a time to meet her.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他提醒自己要安排一个时间和她见面。

Sense.DEF: information that a student writes down during a lesson, from a book etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can I borrow your lecture notes?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我能不能借用一下你的课堂笔记？

GramExa.GLOSS: write notes
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I read the first chapter and took notes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我阅读了第一章并作了笔记。

Sense.DEF: a short informal letter
Sense.EXAMPLE: I was going to write Kathy a note, but I decided to call her instead.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我原来准备给凯茜写个便条﹐但又决定还是打电话给她。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This is just a quick note to let you know that I won’t be in the office tomorrow.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我写这封短笺是想告诉你们我明天不在办公室。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a suicide note a note telling someone that you are going to kill yourself
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 自杀遗书
Sense.EXAMPLE: a thank you note a note to say thank you for something
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 感谢信

Sense.DEF: an official letter or document

GramExa.GLOSS: a note saying that you are too ill to go to work or school
a document showing that goods have been delivered
a formal letter from one government to another

Sense.DEF: a short piece of writing at the bottom of a page or at the end of a book or document which gives more information about something written in the main part
Sense.TRAN: 〔页尾﹑书或文件后的〕注释﹐注解﹐评注
Sense.EXAMPLE: The notes are at the back of the book.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 注解在书末。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A set of guidance notes is provided to assist applicants in completing the form.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 有填表须知帮助申请人填写表格。

Sense.DEF: a particular musical sound, or a symbol representing this sound

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She has a good voice but has trouble hitting the high notes.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她嗓音很好﹐但唱高音有困难。

Sense.DEF: a piece of paper money worth a particular amount of money
Sense.EXAMPLE: a ten-pound note
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一张十英镑的纸币

Sense.DEF: a type of feeling or quality when someone speaks or does something
Sense.TRAN: 〔话语或行为中所含的〕感情色彩﹐特征

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There was a note of doubt in her voice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她话语中带着些怀疑。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He brought a note of realism into the debate.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他给这场辩论带来一种务实的色彩。

GramExa.GLOSS: speaking in a particular way
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She ended her speech on a personal note.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以亲切的语气结束了发言。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: On a more serious note, I’d like to thank everyone for all their support.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 说点严肃的﹐我想要感谢各位给予的所有支持。

Sense.DEF: to succeed or not succeed in being right and suitable for a particular occasion
Sense.EXAMPLE: Bush is hoping to hit the right note again with voters.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 布什希望再次打动选民。

Sense.DEF: to pay attention to something
Sense.TRAN: 注意(到某事)﹐留意(到某事)
Sense.EXAMPLE: People were beginning to take note of her talents as a writer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人们开始注意到她的写作才能。
Sense.EXAMPLE: His first album made the music world stand up and take note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的第一张专辑引起了乐坛的反响和关注。

Sense.DEF: important, interesting, or famous
Sense.TRAN: 重要的[有意思的﹐著名的]人/物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The college has produced several architects of note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这所学院出过好几位著名的建筑师。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The village has a number of buildings of note.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 村里有一些著名建筑。

Sense.DEF: important or interesting and deserving particular attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: three recent novels that are especially worthy of note
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近出版的三本尤其值得关注的小说

Sense.DEF: to notice or pay careful attention to something
Sense.EXAMPLE: He carefully noted the time when they left the building.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们离开大楼的时候﹐他特别留意了一下时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please note that the bill must be paid within ten days.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请注意本账单必须在十天以内付清。

Sense.EXAMPLE: It should be noted that parking without a permit attracts a charge of £5.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 提请注意: 无停车许可者收费五英镑。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Note how she is holding her racket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 注意她是怎么握球拍的。

Sense.DEF: to mention something because it is important or interesting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The judge noted that Miller had no previous criminal record.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 法官指出米勒没有犯罪前科。

Sense.DEF: to write something down so that you will remember it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Note down the main points you want to include in your essay.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 记下你文章中想要包含的要点。

Sense.DEF: a book made of plain paper on which you can write notes
a small computer that you can carry with you
Sense.TRAN: 笔记本电脑﹐便携式电脑

Sense.DEF: a small folded piece of paper with a picture on it, for writing a short letter
well known or famous, especially because of some special quality or ability
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指因有特别之处而〕著名的﹐知名的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a noted author
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 著名作家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The city is noted for its 18th-century architecture.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 该城市因其18世纪的建筑而闻名。

Sense.DEF: a small folded piece of paper with a picture on it, for writing a short letter
a group of sheets of paper fastened together, used for writing notes
paper used for writing letters or notes

GramExa.GLOSS: with the sender’s address printed on it

Sense.DEF: important or interesting enough to deserve your attention
Sense.EXAMPLE: a noteworthy achievement
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显著的成就

Sense.DEF: used humorously when emphasizing that something is completely different from what you have been talking about. It is a changed form of ’another whole’.
Sense.EXAMPLE: Texas is a whole nother country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 得克萨斯是完全不同的地区。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s a whole ’nother ball game.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那是一种完全不同的球类运动。

Sense.DEF: not anything or no thing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nothing ever happens in this town.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这镇上从来都不会发生什么特别的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing in this box.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这盒子里什么也没有。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was nothing else the doctors could do.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生们没有别的办法了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: He had nothing more to say.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他没有更多要说的了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We know nothing about her family.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们对她的家庭一无所知。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t just stand by and do nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不能就那样袖手旁观。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I promised to say nothing about it to anyone.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我答应这件事对谁也不说。
Sense.EXAMPLE: We’ve heard nothing from her for weeks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们好几个星期没有她的音信了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s absolutely nothing to be ashamed of.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 根本没有什么好难为情的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Do you know much about business?’ ‘Nothing at all.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你对做生意了解得多吗？”“一窍不通。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: She had eaten virtually nothing at supper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 晚饭她几乎什么也没吃。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing wrong with the data.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些数据没什么差错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing new about this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这没有什么新鲜的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: A brief search was made but they found nothing untoward.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们简单地搜查了一番﹐没发现任何异常。

Sense.DEF: only
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’d had nothing but bad luck.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她净倒霉了。

Sense.DEF: if you have nothing against someone or something, they do not annoy or offend you
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have nothing against him personally.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我对他本人并不反感。

Sense.DEF: something which is considered unimportant, not interesting, or not worth worrying about
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What have you been doing?’ ‘Nothing. Just sitting here.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你都在干些什么？”“没干什么﹐只是在这里坐着。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing on television tonight.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今晚电视没什么可看的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘What did you do last weekend?’ ‘Oh, nothing much.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你上周末做了什么？”“嗯﹐没做什么事。”
Sense.EXAMPLE: Politics meant nothing was not important to me for years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来政治对我无关紧要。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The meal was nothing special it was not unusual or interesting – just fish with a cheese sauce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那顿饭没什么特别的——就是鱼配干酪酱。

Sense.DEF: zero
Sense.EXAMPLE: We beat them ten to nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们以十比零击败了他们。

Sense.LEXUNIT: have/be nothing to do with sb/sth
Sense.DEF: if you have nothing to do with someone or something, or if someone or something has nothing to do with you, you are not involved or connected with it
Sense.TRAN: 与某人/某事毫不相干﹔与某人/某事无关
Sense.EXAMPLE: He said that he had nothing to do with the decision.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他说他和那个决定毫不相干。
Sense.EXAMPLE: As I said, it’s nothing to do with me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我说了﹐这事与我无关。
Sense.EXAMPLE: That’s got nothing to do with you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那不关你的事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I want nothing to do with do not want to be involved the whole thing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想牵扯到这件事里去。
Sense.EXAMPLE: My staff had nothing whatsoever to do with this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的员工和这件事毫不相干。

Subsense.DEF: without paying for something or being paid for something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Why pay a plumber when my brother will do it for nothing?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我弟弟就可以免费干﹐何必花钱去请管子工呢？

Subsense.DEF: if you do something for nothing, you make an effort but do not get the result you want
Subsense.EXAMPLE: We went all that way for nothing.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们白白走了那么远的路。

Sense.DEF: no money or payment at all
Sense.EXAMPLE: This service will cost you nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这项服务不收费。
Sense.EXAMPLE: When a car has done that many miles, it’s worth nothing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 一辆车行驶了这么多里程﹐根本不值钱了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that something is very good
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing like a long hot bath after a day’s climbing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 爬了一天的山以后﹐没什么比得上好好泡个热水澡了。

Sense.DEF: used to say that what people are saying about someone or something is not true
Sense.EXAMPLE: It seems there’s nothing in the rumours that she’s pregnant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看来关于她怀孕的说法是无稽之谈。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize one good quality or feature that someone or something has, while suggesting that it might be the only good one
Sense.TRAN: 不说别的〔用于强调某一好的特性或特征﹐但暗示这可能是唯一的优点〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: If nothing else, the report points out the need for better math education.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不说别的﹐该报告起码指出了改进数学教育的必要性。

Sense.DEF: if a plan or action comes to nothing, it does not continue or does not achieve anything
Sense.TRAN: 〔计划或行动〕没有结果﹐终未实现

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize a particular quality that someone or something has
Sense.TRAN: 极其﹐非常〔用于强调某种特性〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: You’ve got to admit - he’s nothing if not persistent.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你得承认﹐他极为执着。

Sense.DEF: used to refuse to do something
used to say that something is easy to do
Sense.EXAMPLE: Anyone can use a computer. There’s nothing to it!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人人都会用电脑﹐很简单的！

Sense.LEXUNIT: it was nothing/think nothing of it
Sense.DEF: used when someone has thanked you a lot for something you have done for them
Sense.TRAN: 别放在心上﹐没什么〔用于回应他人的感谢〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Thank you so much.’ ‘Oh, it was nothing.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “太感谢你啦。”“哎呀﹐没什么。”

Sense.DEF: used to say strongly or angrily that something is not true or will not happen
Sense.TRAN: 绝对不行﹔绝对不可能〔用于严词否认〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘I’ll pay.’ ‘You’ll do nothing of the sort!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “我来付账。”“绝对不行！”

Sense.DEF: if someone has nothing on you, they are not better than you at something
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s got nothing on you when it comes to writing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说起写作﹐她可比不过你。

Sense.LEXUNIT: there’s nothing for it but to do sth
Sense.DEF: used when there is only one thing you can do in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 除了做某事以外别无他法
Sense.EXAMPLE: There was nothing for it but to go back the way we came.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们除了原路返回﹐没有别的办法。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use nothing with another negative word (eg ‘not’). Use anything.
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果有其他否定词(如not)﹐不要用nothing﹐而要用anything
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: I could not find anything suitable (NOT 不说 I could not find nothing suitable).

Sense.DEF: to have no qualities or features that are similar to someone or something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s nothing like her brother.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她一点都不像她的哥哥。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She looked nothing like her photograph.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她和照片上一点都不像。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something or someone has a particular quality or seems to be something
Sense.EXAMPLE: His behaviour was nothing short of rudeness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的行为简直就是无礼。

Sense.DEF: empty space or the complete absence of everything
Sense.EXAMPLE: Natalie found him looking into nothingness.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 纳塔莉发现他目光茫然。

Sense.DEF: the state of not existing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Is there only nothingness after death?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 人死后一切便化为乌有吗？

Sense.DEF: if you notice something or someone, you realize that they exist, especially because you can see, hear, or feel them
Sense.TRAN: 看到﹔听到﹔感觉到﹔注意(到)
Sense.EXAMPLE: He noticed a woman in a black dress sitting across from him.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他看到有位黑衣女子坐在他的对面。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t notice any smoke.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没注意到有烟。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you noticed any change in him?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你注意到他有什么变化了吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I noticed that her hands were shaking.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我注意到她的双手在颤抖。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: He never seems to notice when people take advantage of him.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他好像从来都感觉不到别人在利用他。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: She hadn’t noticed before quite how grey his hair was.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她以前没怎么注意到他的头发都白了那么多了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Did you notice him leaving the party early?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你有没有注意到他提前离开了聚会？

Sense.DEF: to get attention, or to make someone get attention
Sense.TRAN: 引起注意/使(某人)引人注目
Sense.EXAMPLE: These clothes will get you noticed and enhance your image.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些衣服会让你引人注目﹐还能改善你的形象。

Variant.LEXVAR: sb can’t help but notice sth

Sense.DEF: if someone can’t help noticing something, they realize that it exists or is happening even though they are not deliberately trying to pay attention to it
Sense.TRAN: 某人不禁注意到某事物
Sense.EXAMPLE: I couldn’t help noticing the bruises on her arm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我一眼就注意到她手臂上的瘀伤。

Exponent.DEF: to realize that something is there or that something is happening, because you can see, hear, or feel it
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I noticed that he was rather quiet during dinner.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我注意到他在晚饭时很沉默。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Children don’t seem to notice the cold.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 小孩子好像感觉不到冷。

Exponent.DEF: to notice something that is difficult to see, hear etc because it is very small, faint, or unclear. Detect is used about people and machines, and is more formal than notice.
Exponent.TRAN: 发现﹐察觉﹔探测〔尤指人和机器﹐比notice正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: X-ray telescopes can now detect virtually every type of astronomical object.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: X射线望远镜现在可以探测到几乎任何一类天体。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: He thought he detected a flicker of interest in her eyes.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 他觉得自己看出她眼中闪过一丝感兴趣的神情。

Exponent.DEF: to notice something, especially something that is difficult to see or that you see for a short time only. Spot is more informal than notice.
Exponent.TRAN: 发现﹐看出﹐注意到 〔不易看到或只瞄了一眼的东西﹔没有notice正式〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you spot the difference between these two pictures?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能看出这两幅画的不同点吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I’m glad you spotted the mistake before it was too late.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很高兴你及时发现了错误。

Exponent.DEF: to gradually begin to notice that something is happening or is true
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I became aware that Mum was getting a lot older.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我发现妈妈老了许多。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Tessa became conscious of a feeling of guilt.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 特莎感觉到有一种内疚感。

Exponent.DEF: to be able to notice something because you can see, smell, hear it etc
Exponent.TRAN: 〔通过看﹑闻﹑听等〕可以感觉到﹔看出
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I could tell that she had been drinking.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我觉得她喝过酒了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Can you tell I’ve lost weight?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你看得出我瘦了吗？

Exponent.DEF: used to say that you suddenly notice something or someone because they are interesting, attractive, or good at something
Exponent.TRAN: 某物/某人一下子吸引了你的注意
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I saw this shirt in the shop window and it just caught my eye.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在橱窗里看到这件衬衫﹐一下子就被吸引了。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Clarke caught the eye of boss Bryan Robson when he scored for Newry last week.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 克拉克上周为纽里城队进了球﹐一下子吸引了老板布赖恩．罗布森的注意。

Exponent.DEF: to notice something as a result of watching or studying it closely
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Psychologists observed that the mice became more aggressive in smaller cages.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 心理学家发现﹐笼子越小﹐老鼠的攻击性越强。

Exponent.DEF: to notice something, especially that something is happening, or is true, or needs to be done
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The company quickly perceived the need for change.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 公司迅速觉察到需要进行改革。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Doctors perceive that they do not have adequate time to spend with their patients.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 医生发觉他们没有足够的时间和病人相处。

Exponent.DEF: to see something happen because you are there at the time
Exponent.TRAN: 亲眼目睹﹐亲历〔某事的发生〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: People have witnessed some great economic changes during the last ten years.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去十年里﹐人们见证了几次重大的经济变革。

Tail.TailContent: This graph shows how common the different grammar patterns of the verb notice are. 本图表所示为动词notice构成的不同语法模式的使用频率。
Tail.PICCONTENT: notice sth/sb; notice (that); notice; notice who/what/how etc; notcie sb/sth doing sth; other; 10%; 20%; 30%; 40%

Sense.DEF: when you notice or pay attention to someone or something
Sense.EXAMPLE: I waved but they took no notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我挥了挥手﹐可是他们没有注意到。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I did not take much notice of her suggestions.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没太在意她的建议。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I hope you’ll take notice of what I’m going to tell you.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我希望你留心听我下面要对你讲的话。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This problem may have escaped your notice so far you may not have noticed it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可能你还没有注意到这个问题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: This never came to my notice I never knew about this.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从来没有注意到这一点。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several important matters that I’d like to bring to your notice that I would like you to know about.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有几件重要的事我想提醒你注意。

Sense.DEF: a written or printed statement that gives information or a warning to people
Sense.EXAMPLE: The notice on the wall said ‘No smoking’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 墙上的告示写着“禁止吸烟”。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ll put up a notice about the meeting.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我会贴一张会议通告的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: obituary notices about people who have just died in the newspaper
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 报纸上的讣告

Sense.DEF: information or a warning about something that is going to happen

GramExa.EXAMPLE: These rules are subject to change without notice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些规则如有更改﹐恕不另行通知。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They didn’t give me sufficient notice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们没给我充分的准备时间。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: When you’re on the mailing list, you’ll receive advance notice of upcoming events.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果你在我们的邮寄名单上﹐你会收到即将举办的活动的预告。

GramExa.GLOSS: a warning ten days etc before
GramExa.COLLOTRAN: 提前十天/三个月等的通知
GramExa.EXAMPLE: They closed the factory, giving the workers only a week’s notice.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们把工厂关了﹐只提前一周通知工人。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Firefighters were prepared to rush out at a moment’s notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 消防队员准备着随时出动。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: his failure to give notice of his intention to alter the property
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他未能通告变更产权的意图

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’ve been given notice to quit my flat I have been told that I must leave by a certain date.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我接到通知﹐限期搬出公寓。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Union members served strike notice warned that they would go on strike late last night.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 昨天深夜﹐工会会员正式发出罢工通知。

Sense.DEF: from now until another change is announced
