Sense.EXAMPLE: The office is closed until further notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 本办事处停止营业﹐直至另行通知。

Sense.DEF: to tell your employer that you will be leaving your job soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jim gave notice on Thursday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉姆星期四递交了辞呈。

Sense.DEF: if you do something at short notice, you do not have very much time to prepare for it
Sense.EXAMPLE: The trip was planned on short notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这次旅行安排得很仓促。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks for agreeing to see me at such short notice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢你在这么短时间内同意见我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a cancellation at very short notice
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 临时取消

Sense.DEF: a statement of opinion, especially one written for a newspaper or magazine, about a new play, book, film etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指报刊上对新剧﹑新书﹑新电影等的〕评价﹐评论﹐短评
Sense.EXAMPLE: The new play got mixed notices some good, some bad in the newspapers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那出新剧受到了各家报纸褒贬不一的评价。

Sense.DEF: easy to notice
Sense.TRAN: 容易注意到的﹐明显的﹐显著的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Alcohol has a noticeable effect on the body.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 酒精对身体有明显的影响。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was noticeable that many of them avoided answering the question.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 显而易见﹐他们中的许多人对这个问题都避而不答。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a noticeable improvement in air quality
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 空气质量的显著改善

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She has become noticeably more confident.
The children were noticeably affected by the divorce.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 孩子们受父母离婚影响很大。

Sense.DEF: a special board on a wall which notices can be fastened to
a notifiable disease or crime is one that by law must be reported to the government or to the police
Sense.TRAN: 〔疾病或罪行〕依法须向政府[警方]报告的

Sense.DEF: official information about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was given no prior notification.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我事先没有接到通知。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You should receive notification of the results within a week.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你应该会在一周内接到有关结果的通知。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We received official notification that Harry was missing.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到了哈里失踪的正式通知。

Sense.DEF: to formally or officially tell someone about something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: You will be notified of any changes in the system.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 系统中有任何变化都会通知你。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: In August we were notified that our article had been rejected.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 8月份我们接到通知﹐说我们的文章不予采用。

Sense.DEF: an idea, belief, or opinion

GramExa.EXAMPLE: misguided notions of male superiority
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 男尊女卑的错误观念
GramExa.EXAMPLE: The traditional notion of marriage goes back thousands of years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 传统的婚姻观念可追溯到几千年以前。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: She had only a vague notion of what she wanted to do.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 她对自己想做什么只有一个模糊的概念。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the notion that human beings are basically good
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 人性本善的观念

Sense.EXAMPLE: She had no notion what he meant.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她根本不明白他是什么意思。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: They reject the notion of group guilt.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们拒绝接受集体犯罪的概念。

Sense.DEF: small things such as thread and buttons that are used for sewing
existing only as an idea or plan, and not existing in reality
Sense.EXAMPLE: Their calculations were based on a notional minimum wage.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们的计算是以假定的最低工资为基础的。

Sense.DEF: the state of being famous or well-known for something that is bad or that people do not approve of

GramExa.EXAMPLE: John is already a writer of some notoriety.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 约翰已经是名声不好的作家了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The local church has gained notoriety for being different.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那座当地的教堂因与众不同而臭名远扬。

Sense.DEF: famous or well-known for something bad
Sense.TRAN: 臭名昭著的﹐声名狼藉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a notorious computer hacker
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 声名狼藉的电脑黑客
Sense.EXAMPLE: notorious cases of human rights abuses
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 臭名昭著的践踏人权案

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a judge notorious for his cruelty and corruption
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 一位因残忍和腐败而臭名远扬的法官

RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 统计数据有时也不可靠﹐这是人所共知的。
RunOn.EXAMPLE: The program is notoriously difficult to learn.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 众所周知这个程序很难掌握。

Sense.DEF: in spite of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Notwithstanding differences, there are clear similarities in all of the world’s religions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 世界上的宗教尽管各不相同﹐但都有明显的相似之处。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Fame and fortune notwithstanding, Donna never forgot her hometown.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管名利双收﹐但唐娜从未忘记自己的家乡。

Sense.DEF: a type of sticky soft sweet with nuts and sometimes fruit
the number 0
Sense.EXAMPLE: A billion is 1 with 9 noughts after it.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十亿是1后面加9个零。

Sense.DEF: used in some expressions to mean nothing
Sense.EXAMPLE: Peace negotiations came to nought were not successful.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 和平谈判毫无结果。

Sense.DEF: a game in which two players write ○ or × in a pattern of nine squares, trying to win with a row of three ○’s or three ×’s
Sense.TRAN: 画圈打叉游戏﹐画井游戏〔在“井”字的九个方格内﹐由两人轮流填写﹐谁能先把三个×或○列成一行即取胜〕

Sense.DEF: a word or group of words that represent a person (such as ‘Michael’, ‘teacher’ or ‘police officer’), a place (such as ‘France’ or ‘school’), a thing or activity (such as ‘coffee’ or ‘football’), or a quality or idea (such as ‘danger’ or ‘happiness’). Nouns can be used as the subject or object of a verb (as in ‘The teacher arrived’ or ‘We like the teacher’) or as the object of a preposition (as in ‘good at football’).
to give a person or other living thing the food and other substances they need in order to live, grow, and stay healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cream contains vitamin A to nourish the skin.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种护肤霜含有滋养肌肤的维生素A。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a well nourished baby
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养良好的婴儿

Sense.DEF: to keep a feeling, idea, or belief strong or help it to grow stronger
Sense.TRAN: 保持﹐怀有﹔培养〔感情﹑观念或信念〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: We need to nourish our hopes and dreams.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们应该怀有希望和梦想。

Sense.DEF: food that is nourishing makes you strong and healthy
the food and other substances that people and other living things need to live, grow, and stay healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: lack of proper nourishment
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缺乏适当的营养
Sense.EXAMPLE: The soil provides nourishment for plant roots.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 土壤为植物根部提供养分。

Sense.DEF: something that helps a feeling, idea, or belief to grow stronger

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a child starved for emotional nourishment
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 渴望情感呵护的孩子

Sense.DEF: intelligence and the ability to make good practical decisions
Sense.EXAMPLE: At least she had the nous to ring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 起码她还有点头脑知道打个电话。

Sense.DEF: having only recently become rich and spending a lot of money – used to show disapproval
a style of cooking from France where simple and healthy food is served in an attractive way, usually in small amounts on a big plate
Sense.TRAN: 新式烹饪〔一种源自法国的烹饪法﹐注重食物简单健康﹐讲究装盘美观〕
a written abbreviation of 书面缩写= November 十一月

Sense.DEF: a star which explodes and suddenly becomes much brighter for a short time
a long written story in which the characters and events are usually imaginary
Sense.EXAMPLE: a novel by Jane Austen
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 简．奥斯丁的小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took Vikram Seth three years to write his 1,349-page novel ‘A Suitable Boy’.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 维克拉姆．塞斯花费三年时间写成了他那部1,349页的小说《如意郎君》。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: a newly published science fiction novel
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 新出版的科幻小说

Sense.DEF: not like anything known before, and unusual or interesting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What a novel idea!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多么新奇的想法呀！

Sense.DEF: someone who writes novels
the story that was told in a film or television series, written afterwards as a book
Sense.TRAN: 〔由电影或电视连续剧〕改写成的小说
Sense.EXAMPLE: the novelization of Terminator 2
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《终结者2》的小说版

Sense.DEF: a story that is shorter than a novel, but longer than a short story
the quality of being new, unusual, and interesting

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the novelty of the ideas
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那些想法的新奇之处

Sense.EXAMPLE: Many toys have no attraction beyond their novelty value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 许多玩具除了有些新奇感之外﹐别无吸引力。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was fun for a while, but the novelty wore off it became boring.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 开始有一阵很好玩﹐可是新鲜感随后便消失了。

Sense.DEF: something new and unusual which attracts people’s attention and interest
Sense.EXAMPLE: Then the Internet was still something of a novelty.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那时因特网还是个挺新鲜的东西。

Sense.DEF: an unusual, small, cheap object, often given as a present
Sense.TRAN: 新颖小巧而廉价的物品
Sense.EXAMPLE: a selection of novelties and T-shirts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 可供选购的各种新鲜玩意和T恤衫
Sense.EXAMPLE: a novelty key-ring
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 新颖的钥匙圈

Sense.DEF: the 11th month of the year, between October and December

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He started work here last November.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他去年11月开始在这里工作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It snowed in early November.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 11月初下过雪。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The final will be played on Sunday November 6th.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 决赛将于11月6日星期天举行。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Five weeks later, on 6th November, they were secretly married.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 五周之后的11月6日，他们秘密结婚了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: There will be no performance November 6.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 11月6日没有演出。

Sense.DEF: someone who has no experience in a skill, subject, or activity
Sense.EXAMPLE: The computer course is ideal for novices.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这门计算机课程非常适合初学者。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I’m still a complete novice at the sport.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 对于这项运动而言我还完全是个新手。

Sense.EXAMPLE: This trail is not recommended for novice bikers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不建议自行车新手走这条小路。

Sense.DEF: someone who has recently joined a religious group to become a monk or nun
the period of being a novice

Sense.EXAMPLE: They now live in the city centre.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们目前住在市中心。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s nothing I can do about this right now exactly now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这事我现在也没有办法。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Sonia should have been home by now. Do you think she’s OK?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 索尼娅现在应该到家了。你觉得她没事吧？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Until now, doctors have been able to do very little to treat this disease.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 直到现在﹐医生对这种疾病几乎无能为力。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Please try to be more careful from now on starting from now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 从现在开始请尽量加倍小心。

GramExa.GLOSS: for a short time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Just leave your shoes on the back porch for now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 就暂时把你的鞋子留在后门廊吧。

GramExa.GLOSS: at the present time
GramExa.EXAMPLE: There are a lot of bargains in the shops just now.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 商店里现在有许多便宜货出售。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The bell has rung - stop writing now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 铃声已经响了﹐立即停笔。
Sense.EXAMPLE: If we leave now we’ll be there before dark.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果我们现在出发﹐天黑之前就能赶到那里。

Sense.DEF: used when you know or understand something because of something you have just seen, just been told etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: Having met the rest of the family, she now saw where he got his temper from.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 见到他家里的其他人之后﹐她这才明白他的脾气是从哪儿来的。

Sense.DEF: used to say how long ago something started
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve been going out together for a long time now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们至今已交往很长时间了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s been over five years now since I started working here.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在这儿工作至今已经五年多了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s now a month since we bought the car and it’s broken down three times already.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这辆车我们买了才一个月﹐已经坏过三次了。

Sense.DEF: sometimes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I hear from him every now and then.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我有时会收到他的来信。

Subsense.DEF: used when getting someone’s attention before continuing what you are saying or changing the subject
Subsense.TRAN: 好了〔用于在继续说话或改变话题前引起别人的注意〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now, let’s move on to the question of payment.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐我们接着来谈谈付款的问题吧。

Subsense.DEF: used at the beginning of a sentence when asking for information
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now what did you say your name was?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 呃﹐你刚才说你叫什么名字？

Subsense.DEF: used when pausing when you are thinking what to say next
Subsense.TRAN: 好﹐嗯〔在说话过程中停下来思索时用〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now, let’s see, oh yes – they wanted to know what time you’ll be back on Friday.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 嗯﹐让我想想﹐噢﹐对了他们想知道你星期五什么时候回来。

Subsense.DEF: used to say that if the situation was different, something different would happen
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now if I’d been in charge there’s no way I’d have let them use the van.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 不过如果是我负责的话﹐我决不会让他们用那辆小货车的。

Subsense.DEF: used to make someone calm, or comfort them when they are angry, upset etc
Subsense.TRAN: 好了﹐好了〔用于安慰别人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Come on now, don’t cry.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐别哭了。

Subsense.DEF: used when telling or reminding someone to do something
Subsense.TRAN: 这下〔用于告诉或提醒某人做某事〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now hurry up! I haven’t got all day.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐快点！ 我可没有太多时间。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Don’t forget now, you have a dental appointment Thursday afternoon.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这下可别忘了﹐你约好了星期四下午要去看牙医。

Sense.DEF: very soon
Sense.EXAMPLE: The guests will arrive any minute now.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 客人们很快就要到了。

Sense.DEF: a moment ago
Sense.EXAMPLE: Was that you singing just now?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 刚才是你在唱歌吗？

Sense.DEF: used to get someone’s attention before telling them to do something or asking them a question
Sense.TRAN: 喂﹐听着〔用于引起别人的注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now then, what seems to be the problem here?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 喂﹐这里出了什么问题？
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now then, try to sit up and have some of this soup.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 来﹐试着坐起来喝点这汤。

Sense.DEF: used when giving an opinion or asking someone to tell you something
Sense.TRAN: 听着﹐说吧〔用于发表意见或要求别人告知某事〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Well now, what’s all this I hear about you getting married?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 说吧﹐我听说你要结婚了﹐这到底是怎么回事？

Sense.DEF: used when saying what you are going to do next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Thanks, Norma, and now for a look at tomorrow’s weather.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢谢﹐诺尔玛﹐接下来看看明天的天气情况。

Sense.DEF: used when introducing the next activity, performer etc
Sense.TRAN: 接下来﹐下面〔用于介绍下一个活动或表演者等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: And now, live from New York, it’s David Letterman!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 下面﹐请看来自纽约的直播节目﹐大卫•莱特曼！

Subsense.DEF: used to make someone calm or comfort them when they are angry, upset etc
Subsense.TRAN: 好了﹐好了〔用于安慰别人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now now, don’t worry. Everything will be okay.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐好了﹐别担心﹐一切都会好的。

Subsense.DEF: used when telling someone not to behave badly
Subsense.TRAN: 行了﹐得了 〔用于劝阻别人〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Now now, leave your sister alone.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 行了﹐放过你妹妹吧。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you do not want to talk to them or do something now, because you are busy, tired etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Tell me a story.’ ‘Not now, Daddy’s working.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “给我讲个故事吧。”“现在不行﹐爸爸在工作呢。”

Sense.DEF: used when an attempt to do something has failed and you do not know what to do next
Sense.EXAMPLE: Kate tried each of the keys, but none of them fit. ‘Now what?’ she thought.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯特试了每一把钥匙﹐但都不对。“现在该怎么办呢？”她想。

Sense.DEF: used to tell someone that you agree very much with what they are saying
Sense.TRAN: 你说得对〔用于表示同意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Feel like going out for a beer?’ ‘Now you’re talking.’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “想出去喝杯啤酒吗？”“好啊。”

Sense.DEF: used to say that if someone does not do something now, they will not get another chance to do it
Sense.EXAMPLE: Quite suddenly, her mind was made up. It was now or never.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 突然间她下定了决心。机不可失﹐时不再来。

Sense.LEXUNIT: now’s the time (for sb) to do sth
Sense.DEF: used to say that someone should do something now, because it is the right time to do it
Sense.TRAN: 现在正是(某人)做某事的时候
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now’s the time to buy a car, while the interest rates are low.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 趁现在利率很低﹐正是买车的时候。

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed because someone keeps interrupting you or asking you things
Sense.TRAN: 又怎么了？〔表示因频频受到烦扰而生气〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Mom, can you come here for a minute?’ ‘What is it now?’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “妈妈﹐你过来一下好吗？”“又怎么啦？”

Sense.DEF: used when you are annoyed or amused because someone has just told you something they should have told you before
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘You didn’t need to make anything for dinner - Dad’s bringing home pizza.’ ‘Oh, now you tell me!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你其实不用做晚饭的﹐爸爸晚上带比萨饼回家。”“你为什么不早说呀！”

Sense.DEF: used to say that at one moment someone or something does one thing and immediately after, they do something else
Sense.EXAMPLE: The eagle glided through the sky, now rising, now falling.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那只鹰在空中滑翔﹐时而腾空﹐时而俯冲。

Exponent.DEF: at this time
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Where are you living now?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 你现在住在哪里？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The population is much larger now than it used to be.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在人口数量比过去大幅增长。

Exponent.DEF: now – used when describing what a situation is like
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The firm currently employs 113 people.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 该公司目前有雇员113人。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Currently, the starting salary is around £20,000.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前﹐起薪约为两万英镑。

Exponent.DEF: now – used when talking about a short period of time, after which the situation is likely to change
Exponent.TRAN: 这会儿﹐这阵子〔表示之后情况可能有变化〕
Exponent.EXAMPLE: I think she’s at lunch at the moment – can I ask her to call you back?
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我想她这会儿在吃午饭——让她给你回电好吗？
Exponent.EXAMPLE: At the moment I’m working in a restaurant, but I’m hoping to go to college.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 我目前在一家餐馆打工﹐但我还是希望上大学。

Exponent.DEF: now – used when you do not expect something that is true now to be permanent
Exponent.EXAMPLE: Many areas are inaccessible at present due to heavy snow.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 目前许多地方因大雪而无法前往。
Exponent.EXAMPLE: The official currency is the crown, presently about 30 to the dollar.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 官方货币是克朗﹐目前对美元的汇率约为30。

Exponent.DEF: now – used when a situation is likely to change, especially because an arrangement is only temporary
Exponent.EXAMPLE: You can stay here for the time being, until you find a flat.
Exponent.EXAMPLETRAN: 找到公寓之前你可以暂时住在这里。

Sense.DEF: because of something or as a result of something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now that we know each other a little better, we get along fine.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于彼此之间有了进一步了解﹐我们相处得不错。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to relax now the school year is over.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学年结束了﹐因此我想放松一下。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Now that I think of it, I acted the same way when I was his age.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我记得我在他这个年纪也是这样的。

Sense.DEF: now, compared with what happened in the past
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nowadays people are rarely shocked by the sex they see on television.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如今人们在电视上看见性爱镜头不太会感到吃惊了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Most people nowadays are aware of the importance of a healthy diet.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 现在大多数人都明白健康饮食的重要性。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that you will not agree or be able to do something
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Are you going to offer to work over the weekend?’ ‘No way!’
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “你打算主动提出周末加班吗？”“决不会！”
Sense.EXAMPLE: No way will we be finished by five o’clock.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们决不可能在5点钟之前结束。
Sense.EXAMPLE: There’s no way I’m going to pay £300 just for a weekend in Paris.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我决不会花300英镑就为了在巴黎度个周末。

Sense.DEF: not in any place or to any place

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I have no job and nowhere to live.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我没有工作﹐也没有地方住。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Nowhere is drug abuse more of a problem than in the US.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 没有什么地方的吸毒问题比美国更严重。

Sense.DEF: to have no success or make no progress
Sense.EXAMPLE: The proposal went nowhere in the Senate.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该提议在参议院毫无结果。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He was getting nowhere with the Bentley case.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他在本特利案件上没有获得任何进展。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: A negative attitude will get you nowhere.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 消极的态度会让你一无所成。

Sense.EXAMPLE: I soon realized that being tough was getting me nowhere fast was not helping me achieve anything.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很快就意识到态度强硬只会一无所获。

Sense.DEF: to not be in a place, or not be seen or found there
Sense.EXAMPLE: Typical - another street crime and the police are nowhere to be seen.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 总是这样﹐又一宗街头罪案﹐而警察却不见踪影。

Subsense.DEF: a long way from a particular place
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He swore he was nowhere near her house on the night she died.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他发誓说在她死的当夜﹐他根本不在她家附近。

Subsense.DEF: not at all

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The building’s nowhere near finished.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 这大楼完工还早着呢。

Subsense.EXAMPLE: She’s nowhere near as pretty as you are.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她远没有你漂亮。

Sense.DEF: happening or appearing suddenly and without warning
Sense.EXAMPLE: In the last few seconds, Gunnell came from nowhere to win another gold medal.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在最后几秒钟里﹐甘内尔突然发力﹐又赢得了一枚金牌。
Sense.EXAMPLE: From out of nowhere he asks me to marry him!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他竟突然间向我求婚！

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Do not use nowhere with another negative word (eg ‘not’). Use anywhere .
F2NBox.TRAN: 如果有其他否定词(如not)﹐不要用nowhere﹐而要用anywhere
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: You can’t smoke anywhere ( NOT 不说 can’t smoke nowhere ) in the building.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 这大楼里任何地方都不能吸烟。

Sense.DEF: relating to a situation in which whatever you choose to do it will have a bad result
Sense.TRAN: 无法取胜的﹔注定失败的
Sense.EXAMPLE: If my child is sick and I leave work, I’m a bad employee. If I don’t, I’m a bad mother. It’s a no-win situation.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 如果孩子生病了﹐我抛下工作就不是好员工﹐坚持上班又不是好母亲﹐怎么都不好啊。

Sense.DEF: nothing – used especially in the north of England
Sense.TRAN: 无﹐没有什么〔尤为英格兰北部用语〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’ve had nowt to eat since yesterday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我从昨天开始就没有东西可吃了。

Sense.DEF: harmful or poisonous
Sense.EXAMPLE: noxious fumes
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 有毒烟雾

Sense.DEF: a part that is fitted to the end of a hose, pipe etc to direct and control the stream of liquid or gas pouring out

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= near, used in addresses 【英】 在…附近〔用于地址〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sheffield Park Garden, nr Uckfield
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谢菲尔德公园﹐近阿克菲尔德

Sense.DEF: a US organization that supports people's rights to buy and keep guns, and opposes attempts to change the laws and introduce more strict controls on guns
an infection of the urethra

Sense.TRAN: the short form of 缩略式= ‘not’
Sense.EXAMPLE: hadn’t
didn’t
wouldn’t
isn’t

Sense.DEF: extremely, or as much as possible
Sense.EXAMPLE: It was boring to the nth degree.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那事令人厌烦透顶。

Sense.DEF: the most recent of a long series of similar things that have happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Even after I’d reminded him for the nth time, he forgot.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尽管我已提醒过他无数次﹐他还是忘了。

Sense.DEF: new
Sense.EXAMPLE: cool nu stuff
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 时髦的新玩意

Sense.DEF: a very slight, hardly noticeable difference in manner, colour, meaning etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔方式﹑颜色﹑意义等的〕细微差别
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was aware of every nuance in her voice.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他听得出她声音中的每一个细微变化。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the painting’s delicate nuances of color, tone, and texture
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 那幅画在色彩﹑色调及质感上的细微变化

Sense.EXAMPLE: subtle nuances of meaning
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 含义的细微差别

Sense.LEXUNIT: the nub of the problem/matter/argument etc
Sense.DEF: the main point of a problem etc
Sense.TRAN: 问题/事情/争论等的焦点[要点]
Sense.EXAMPLE: The real nub of the matter is money.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 问题的实质是钱。

Sense.DEF: a small rounded piece of something, especially a piece that is left after the rest has been eaten, used etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指吃剩或用剩的〕小块﹐小片

Sense.DEF: a woman who is nubile is young and sexually attractive – sometimes used humorously
Sense.TRAN: 〔女子〕年轻性感的〔有时为幽默用法〕

Sense.DEF: relating to or involving the nucleuscentral part of an atom, or the energy produced when the nucleus of an atom is either split or joined with the nucleus of another atom
Sense.EXAMPLE: France’s reliance on nuclear energy
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 法国对核能的依赖
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear power station
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核电站
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear-powered submarine
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核动力潜艇

Sense.DEF: relating to or involving the use of weapons that use nuclear energy

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the threat of nuclear attack
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 核攻击的威胁

Sense.EXAMPLE: concern about the country’s nuclear weapons program
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对该国核武器计划的关注
Sense.EXAMPLE: With the collapse of the former Soviet Union, the possibility of a nuclear holocaust a nuclear war that destroys much of the Earth was greatly reduced.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着苏联的解体﹐核浩劫爆发的可能性大大降低。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear testing area
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核试验区

Sense.DEF: a very powerful bomb that uses nuclear energy to kill a lot of people and destroy large areas
the threat of using nuclear weapons to stop an enemy from attacking
the process or activity of getting rid of nuclear weapons
a family unit that consists only of a husband, wife and children
Sense.TRAN: 〔仅由夫妻与子女组成的〕核心家庭﹐小家庭

Sense.DEF: the splitting of the nucleus central part of an atom which results in a lot of power being produced
places that are nuclear-free do not allow nuclear materials to be carried, stored, or used in that area
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuclear-free zone
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无核区

Sense.DEF: a nuclear reaction in which the nuclei central parts of atoms join together, which produces power without producing any waste
the area of physics which is concerned with the structure and features of the nucleus central part of atoms
Sense.TRAN: 核物理学〔研究原子核结构和属性的科学〕

Sense.DEF: a large machine that produces nuclear energy, especially as a means of generating (generate) electricity
waste material from nuclear reactors, which is radioactive
Sense.TRAN: 核废料〔核反应堆中核燃料使用后的放射性废弃物〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: the problems of nuclear waste disposal
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 核废物的处理问题

Sense.DEF: one of the two acids, dna and rna, that exist in the cells of all living things
the central part of an atom, made up of neutrons, protons, and other elementary particles
the central part of almost all the cells of living things
a small important group at the centre of a larger group or organization

GramExa.EXAMPLE: the nucleus of an effective team
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 高效团队的核心
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Marantz and Grohl form the nucleus of the Atlanta operation.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马兰茨和格勒构成了亚特兰大公司的核心。

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: I did some work as a nude model when I was in college.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我上大学的时候当过裸体模特。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Have you ever posed nude been photographed or painted while nude?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你拍过裸体照吗？

Sense.DEF: done by or involving people who are not wearing any clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: There are several nude scenes in the film.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 影片中有几处裸体镜头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: I have no desire to go to a nude beach a beach where people wear no clothes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想去裸体沙滩。

Sense.DEF: a painting, statue etc of someone not wearing clothes
Sense.TRAN: 裸体艺术品〔如人体画﹑人体雕塑等〕

Sense.DEF: not wearing any clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was standing there in the nude.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他光着身子站在那里。

Sense.DEF: to push someone gently, usually with your elbow, in order to get their attention
Sense.TRAN: 〔通常用肘〕轻推〔以引起某人的注意〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Jill nudged him in the ribs.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 吉尔用胳膊肘轻轻碰了一下他的肋部。

Sense.DEF: to move something or someone a short distance by gently pushing
Sense.EXAMPLE: She nudged the glass towards me.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她将杯子轻轻推向我。
Sense.EXAMPLE: David nudged me out of the way.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 戴维把我轻轻推向一边。

Sense.DEF: to move forward slowly by pushing gently

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I started to nudge my way to the front of the crowd.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我慢慢地挤到人群前面。

Sense.DEF: to gently persuade or encourage someone to take a particular decision or action

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We’re trying to nudge them towards a practical solution.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们正在努力劝说他们找出一种切实可行的解决方法。

Sense.DEF: to almost reach a particular level or amount
Sense.TRAN: 接近﹐靠近〔某程度或数量〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Outside the temperature was nudging 30 degrees Celsius.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 外面气温已经接近30摄氏度。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: Hannah gave me a gentle nudge.

Sense.DEF: someone who enjoys not wearing any clothes because they believe it is natural and healthy
the state of not wearing any clothes
Sense.EXAMPLE: The play contains scenes of nudity.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该剧有一些裸露场面。

Sense.DEF: having no value
a small rough piece of a valuable metal found in the earth
Sense.EXAMPLE: a gold nugget
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 天然金块

Sense.DEF: a small round piece of food
Sense.EXAMPLE: chicken nuggets
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 鸡块

Sense.DEF: a piece of valuable information, advice etc
Sense.TRAN: 有价值的信息/至理名言等
Sense.EXAMPLE: It took months to extract that nugget of information from them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 花了好几个月才从他们那儿套出一点有用的信息来。

Sense.DEF: a person, thing, or situation that annoys you or causes problems
Sense.TRAN: 讨厌[麻烦]的人[事物﹐情况]

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The dogs next door are a real nuisance.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 隔壁的那几只狗实在是讨厌。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What a nuisance! I’ve forgotten my ticket.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 真麻烦！我忘了带票。

GramExa.PROPFORM: I hate to be a nuisance…/Sorry to be a nuisance…
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I hate to be a nuisance, but could you move your car to the other side of the street?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不想给你添麻烦﹐不过你能不能把你的车挪到路那边去？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Stop making a nuisance of yourself annoying other people with your behaviour!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 别那样惹人讨厌！

GramExa.EXAMPLE: It’s a nuisance having to get up that early on a Sunday morning.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 星期天早上还得那么早起床﹐真烦人。

Sense.DEF: the use of a place or property in a way that causes public annoyance
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nightclub has been declared a public nuisance.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那家夜总会已被判定为妨害公众利益。

Sense.DEF: to attack a place using nuclear weapons
to cook food in a microwave oven
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nuke it for two minutes.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用微波炉加热两分钟。

Sense.DEF: a nuclear weapon
an agreement, contract etc that is null and void has no legal force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The contract was declared null and void.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该合同被宣布无效。

Sense.DEF: to officially state that something has no legal force
Sense.EXAMPLE: The election results were nullified because of voter fraud.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由于选票造假﹐选举结果被宣布无效。

Sense.DEF: to make something lose its effect or value
Sense.EXAMPLE: Recent inflation could nullify the economic growth of the last several years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 最近的通货膨胀可能会抵消过去数年的经济增长。

Sense.DEF: the fact that a marriage or contract no longer has any legal force
Sense.TRAN: 〔婚姻或合约的〕无效﹐无法律约束力
Sense.EXAMPLE: a decree of nullity
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 无效判决

Sense.DEF: a part of your body that is numb is unable to feel anything, for example because you are very cold
Sense.TRAN: 〔身体部位〕麻木的﹐失去感觉的
Sense.EXAMPLE: My fingers were so numb I could hardly write.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的手指麻木得几乎没法写字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The anaesthetic made his whole face go numb.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麻醉剂使他整个脸都失去了知觉。

Sense.DEF: unable to think, feel, or react in a normal way
Sense.TRAN: 〔思维﹑感觉或反应〕迟钝的﹐呆滞的

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I just sat there, numb with fear.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我呆坐在那里﹐吓得动弹不得。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: She watched numbly as Matt walked away.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 她呆呆地看着马特走掉。

RunOn.EXAMPLE: It caused some numbness in my hand.
RunOn.EXAMPLETRAN: 那让我的手感到有点麻木。

Sense.DEF: to make someone unable to feel pain or feel things they are touching
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cold had numbed her fingers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她的手指冻僵了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the numbing effect of the drug
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那种药物的麻醉效果

Sense.DEF: to make someone unable to think, feel, or react in a normal way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was numbed by the shock of his wife’s death.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 妻子去世的巨大打击使他变得很呆滞。

Sense.DEF: a word or sign that represents an amount or a quantity
Sense.EXAMPLE: They wrote various numbers on a large sheet of paper.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们在一张大纸上写下了很多不同的数字。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Add all the numbers together.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把所有数字加起来。

GramExa.GLOSS: one ending in 0
GramExa.EXAMPLE: A hundred pounds is a good round number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 取整到一百英镑就不错。
GramExa.EXAMPLE: I'm no good with numbers.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我不擅长数字。

Sense.DEF: a phone number
Sense.EXAMPLE: My new number is 502-6155.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我的新电话号码是502-6155。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I gave him my home number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我给了他我家的电话号码。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What’s your mobile number?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 你的移动电话号码是多少？

Sense.EXAMPLE: Sorry, you have the wrong number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 对不起﹐你拨错号码了。

Sense.DEF: a number used to show the position of something in an ordered set or list
Sense.EXAMPLE: Answer question number 4.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 回答第4题。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a number 17 bus
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 17路公共汽车

Sense.DEF: a set of numbers used to name or recognize someone or something

GramExa.EXAMPLE: What is your account number, please?
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 请问你的账号是多少？
GramExa.EXAMPLE: Press 1 to change the printer number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 变更打印机号码请按1。

Sense.EXAMPLE: Did you get the number registration number of the car?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你记下那辆车的车牌号码了吗？

Sense.DEF: an amount of something that can be counted

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The number of cars on our roads rose dramatically last year.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 去年道路上的汽车数量剧增。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: We have been friends for a number of years.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们已经是多年的朋友了。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The condors have dwindled to an estimated sixty in number.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 秃鹫已减少到仅约60只。

F2NBox.HEADING: GRAMMAR 语法
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a singular verb after the number of.
F2NBox.TRAN: the number of 之后用单数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: The number of farmers is decreasing.
F2NBox.EXPL: You are talking about the size of the group.
F2NBox.TRAN: 这是指群体的规模。
F2NBox.EXPL: Use a plural verb after a number of.
F2NBox.TRAN: a number of 之后使用复数动词
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: A number of options were suggested.
F2NBox.EXPL: You are referring to the group.
F2NBox.TRAN: 这是指群体本身。

Sense.DEF: how many people there are, especially people attending an event or doing an activity together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Can you give me some idea of numbers?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你能告诉我一个大致的人数吗？

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Visitor numbers increase in the summer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 游客人数在夏季有所增加。

Sense.EXAMPLE: The sheer weight of numbers large number of people on stage made the performance more impressive.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 庞大的演员阵容使演出更加令人难忘。

Sense.DEF: a piece of popular music that forms part of a longer performance
Sense.EXAMPLE: Madonna sang several numbers from her latest album.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 麦当娜唱了她最新专辑中的几首歌曲。

Sense.DEF: a copy of a magazine or newspaper printed on a particular date

GramExa.EXAMPLE: I was reading the latest number of ‘Surfing’.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我在看最近一期的《冲浪》。

Sense.EXAMPLE: back numbers old copies of The Times
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 《泰晤士报》的过期号

Sense.DEF: to understand something about someone that helps you deal with them
Sense.TRAN: 对某人心中有数﹐摸透某人的底
Sense.EXAMPLE: Judy had always had his number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 朱迪总是能看透他。

Sense.DEF: a black, elegant etc dress or suit, especially a woman’s
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指女性穿的〕黑色/高贵等的礼服
Sense.EXAMPLE: She was wearing a chic little number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她穿着一件时髦的礼服。

Sense.DEF: someone has the winning number in a competition
informal

Subsense.DEF: used to say that someone will stop being lucky or successful
used to say that someone will die – used humorously
Subsense.TRAN: 某人死期将到〔幽默用法〕
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She told her husband she didn’t mind going when her number was up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她跟丈夫说如果她气数已尽﹐要走就走吧。

Subsense.DEF: information about something that is shown using numbers
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Chris, have you got the numbers yet?
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 克里斯﹐你拿到数据了吗？

Subsense.DEF: an illegal game in the US in which people risk money on the appearance of a combination of numbers in a newspaper
Subsense.TRAN: 数字(彩票)赌博〔美国的一种非法游戏﹐就报纸上出现的某种数字组合下赌注〕
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 赌数字

Sense.DEF: if you do something by numbers, you do it in a basic way by following a set of simple instructions – used to show disapproval
Sense.TRAN: 按简单指令进行〔含贬义〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: The last thing we want is teaching by numbers.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们最不想要的就是死板的教学方法。

Sense.DEF: to hurt or damage someone or something badly
Sense.TRAN: 严重伤害[损坏]某人/某物
Sense.EXAMPLE: Tod really did a number on the old house. I don’t envy the new tenants.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 托德把那所老房子搞得一塌糊涂﹐我可不羡慕他后面的新租户。

Sense.DEF: if things are beyond number, there are so many of them that no one could count them all
a group of people

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Only three of our number could speak Italian.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们当中只有三个人会说意大利语。

Sense.EXAMPLE: They wanted to choose a leader from among their own number.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们想在自己人当中选出一位首领。

Sense.DEF: the form of a word, depending on whether one thing or more than one thing is being talked about
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Horses’ is plural in number, while ‘horse’ is singular.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: horses是复数﹐horse则是单数。

ColloBox.HEADING: COLLOCATIONS 词语搭配 – MEANING 义项 5

Collocate.EXAMPLE: A large number of children were running around in the playground.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 有很多孩子在操场上奔跑。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very large
Collocate.EXAMPLE: We’ve had a huge number of complaints.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们收到大量投诉。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: There seems to be no reason for the high number of suicides.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 自杀数量之高似乎没有理由可以解释。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite a large number
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He received a substantial number of votes.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他获得大量选票。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite a lot
Collocate.EXAMPLE: He has written a good number of books for children.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 他写了许多儿童读物。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The class had only a small number of students.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这个班学生很少。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: the low numbers of women involved in sports coaching
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 从事体育教练工作的女性数量之少

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: quite small
Collocate.EXAMPLE: A limited number of copies were printed.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 印制数量有限。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: very small
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Only a tiny number of these animals remain in the wild.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这些动物只有极少数生活在野外。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: An increasing number of women are entering the profession.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 越来越多的女性进入这个行业。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: As you improve, increase the number of times you do each exercise.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 随着你身体好转﹐增加每个练习的次数。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: We need to reduce the number of cars on the road.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们需要减少道路上的车辆。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The number of mobile phones has increased dramatically.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 移动电话数量大幅上升。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes twice as big
Collocate.EXAMPLE: The number of road accidents has doubled in the last ten years.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 在过去十年里﹐交通事故数量翻了一番。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: The number of new houses being built is falling steadily.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 新建住宅数量正在逐渐下降。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: becomes twice as small

Collocate.COLLOCTRAN: 大量地/越来越多地/数量有限地等
Collocate.EXAMPLE: Birds nest here in large numbers.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 大量鸟儿在这里筑巢。

Collocate.COLLGLOSS: a very large number of them
Collocate.EXAMPLE: There have been any number of magazine articles about the celebrity couple.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 杂志上有大量关于这对名人夫妻的文章。

Collocate.EXAMPLE: This will bring the number of jobs lost at the company to 85.
Collocate.EXAMPLETRAN: 这将使公司的裁员数目增加到85。

ErrorBox.HINTTRAN: Do not say 不要说 a big number of people/things’. Say 而要说 a large number of people/things.

Sense.DEF: to give a number to something that is part of an ordered set or list
Sense.EXAMPLE: They haven’t numbered the pages of the report.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们还未给报告编页码。
Sense.EXAMPLE: All the seats in the theatre are numbered.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 剧场里的所有座位都编了号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Each check is numbered consecutively.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 每张支票都是按连续的数字编号。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a numbering system
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 编号系统

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Number the questions 1 to 25.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 把这些问题从1到25编号。

Sense.DEF: if people or things number a particular amount, that is how many there are
Sense.EXAMPLE: The population of the town numbered about 5,000.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 镇上的人口大约为5,000。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The men on strike now number 5% of the workforce.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 罢工人数目前约占工人总数的5%。

Sense.DEF: used to say that someone or something cannot live or continue for much longer
Sense.TRAN: 某人生命垂危﹔某人活着/某事物存在的日子屈指可数
Sense.EXAMPLE: I knew my days were numbered at that firm.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我明白我在那家公司的日子屈指可数了。

Sense.LEXUNIT: number among sth/be numbered among sth
Sense.DEF: to be included as one of a particular group
Sense.TRAN: 被认作[算作]某一团体中的一员
Sense.EXAMPLE: He was a successful corporate lawyer who numbered among his clients JP Morgan and Standard Oil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是一位成功的公司法律顾问﹐被看作他的客户摩根大通集团和标准石油公司的一员。

Sense.DEF: to count something
Sense.EXAMPLE: Who can number the stars?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 谁能数清星星有多少？

Sense.DEF: if soldiers number off, each one calls out their number when their turn comes
someone whose job involves working with numbers, such as an accountant
Sense.TRAN: 计算数字的人﹐工作与数字有关的人〔如会计师〕

Sense.DEF: the process of working with a lot of numbers and calculating results
too many to be counted
Sense.TRAN: 数不胜数的﹐多到数不清的﹐无数的
Sense.EXAMPLE: numberless fish
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数不清的鱼

Sense.DEF: the best, most important, or most successful person or thing in a group
Sense.TRAN: 最重要的人[事物]﹐头号人物[事物]
Sense.EXAMPLE: Until his marriage, his job was number one in his life.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在结婚以前﹐工作是他生活中的头等大事。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shearson is number one in the market this year.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 今年希尔森是市场上的领导者。

Sense.DEF: the musical record that is the most popular at a particular time
Sense.EXAMPLE: number one in the charts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 排行榜榜首的唱片
Sense.EXAMPLE: They’ve had three number ones.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他们已经三次荣登榜首。

Sense.DEF: to look after yourself and not worry about other people, in a way that may seem selfish
a word meaning urine, used especially with children to avoid saying this
Sense.TRAN: “一号”〔指小便﹐尤用于对孩子的婉转说法〕

Sense.DEF: most important or successful in a particular situation
Sense.TRAN: 头号的﹔最重要的﹔最成功的
Sense.EXAMPLE: The University of Maine has the number one hockey team in the country.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 缅因大学有全国最好的曲棍球队。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Sweden’s number one model
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 瑞典的头号模特

Sense.DEF: first on a list of several things to be considered, done etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: item number one on the agenda
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 议程上的第一项
Sense.EXAMPLE: This has got to be our number one task.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这必须是我们的首要任务。

Sense.DEF: one of the signs with numbers and letters on it at the front and back of a car
the address of the official home of the British Prime Minister
Sense.TRAN: 唐宁街10号〔英国首相官邸〕

Sense.DEF: a word meaning solid waste from your bowels, used especially with children to avoid saying this
Sense.TRAN: “二号”〔指大便﹐尤用于对孩子的婉转说法〕

Sense.DEF: a very stupid person
Sense.EXAMPLE: Look what you’ve done now, you numbskull!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 看看你都干了些什么﹐你这个笨蛋！

Sense.DEF: the ability to do calculations and understand simple mathematics
Sense.EXAMPLE: The report suggests that students need to improve their numeracy skills.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 该报告显示学生需要提高计算能力。

Sense.DEF: a written sign such as 1, 2, or 3 that represents a number
able to do calculations and understand simple mathematics
Sense.TRAN: 会计算的﹔懂简单算术的

Sense.DEF: a system of counting or the process of counting
Sense.TRAN: 命数法﹐读数法﹔计算法﹔计算

Sense.DEF: the number above the line in a fraction, for example 5 is the numerator in 5/6
expressed or considered in numbers
Sense.TRAN: 用数字表示的﹔数字的﹔数值的
Sense.EXAMPLE: a numerical code
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 数字密码
Sense.EXAMPLE: The home team tried to utilize their numerical advantage the fact that they had more players than the other team.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 主队试图利用他们在人数上的优势。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Make sure the files are organized in numerical order.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 务必把这些档案按数字顺序排列。

Sense.DEF: many
Sense.EXAMPLE: Numerous attempts have been made to hide the truth.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 为掩盖事实作了很多尝试。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The two leaders have worked together on numerous occasions.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那两位领导人已经多次合作。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The individuals who have contributed to this book are far too numerous to mention.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 为本书做过贡献的人不胜枚举。

F2NBox.HEADING: REGISTER 语体
F2NBox.EXPL: In everyday English, people usually say a lot of rather than numerous.
F2NBox.TRAN: 在日常英语中﹐人们一般说a lot of﹐而不说numerous
F2NBox.EXAMPLE: There were a lot of mistakes in his essay.
F2NBox.EXAMPLETRAN: 他的文章里有许多错误。

Sense.DEF: having a mysterious and holy quality, which makes you feel that God is present
the activity of collecting and studying coins and medals
Sense.TRAN: 钱币[徽章]收集﹔钱币学﹔徽章研究

Sense.DEF: someone who collects and studies coins and medals
Sense.TRAN: 钱币[徽章]收藏家﹔钱币学家﹔徽章研究者

Sense.DEF: an insulting word for someone who is stupid or not good at doing something
a stupid person
someone who is a member of a group of religious women that live together in a convent
a representative of the Pope in a foreign country
a convent

Head.GRAM: only before noun 仅用于名词前

Sense.DEF: relating to marriage or the marriage ceremony
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nuptial mass
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚礼弥撒
Sense.EXAMPLE: nuptial bliss
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 婚姻美满

Sense.DEF: a wedding
someone whose job is to look after people who are ill or injured, usually in a hospital
Sense.EXAMPLE: The nurse is coming to give you an injection.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护士会来给你打针。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The school nurse sent Sara home.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 学校的护士送萨拉回家。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a male nurse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 男护士
Sense.EXAMPLE: a senior nurse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 高级护士
Sense.EXAMPLE: a student nurse someone who is learning to be a nurse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 实习护士
Sense.EXAMPLE: a psychiatric nurse a nurse for people who are mentally ill
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病院护士
Sense.EXAMPLE: a community nurse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 社区护士

Sense.DEF: a woman employed to look after a young child

Subsense.DEF: to look after someone who is ill or injured
Subsense.EXAMPLE: He’s been nursing an elderly relative.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他一直在照顾一位年老的亲戚。
Subsense.EXAMPLE: After Ray’s operation, Mrs Stallard nursed him back to health.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 雷接受手术后﹐斯托拉德夫人照料他恢复了健康。

Subsense.DEF: to work as a nurse
Subsense.EXAMPLE: She spent several years nursing in a military hospital.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她在一家军队医院里当了几年护士。

Sense.DEF: to rest when you have an illness or injury so that it will get better
Sense.EXAMPLE: Shaw has been nursing an injury, and will not play on Sunday.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 肖一直在养伤﹐星期天将不参加比赛。

Subsense.DEF: if a woman nurses a baby, she feeds it with milk from her breasts
Subsense.EXAMPLE: information on nutrition for nursing mothers
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 关于哺乳期母亲所需营养的信息

Subsense.DEF: if a baby nurses, it sucks milk from its mother’s breast

Sense.DEF: to keep a feeling or idea in your mind for a long time, especially an angry feeling

GramExa.EXAMPLE: For years he had nursed a grievance against his former employer.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 多年来他一直对前雇主心怀不满。

Sense.DEF: to take special care of something, especially during a difficult situation
Sense.TRAN: 〔尤指在困难时期〕精心照料﹐打理

GramExa.EXAMPLE: He bought the hotel in 1927 and managed to nurse it through the Depression.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 他于1927年买下那家宾馆并精心打理﹐顺利度过了大萧条时期。

Sense.DEF: if you nurse a drink, especially an alcoholic one, you drink it very slowly
Sense.TRAN: 慢慢地喝〔尤指含酒精的饮料〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: Oliver sat at the bar, nursing a bottle of beer.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 奥利弗坐在酒吧里﹐慢慢地喝着一瓶啤酒。

Sense.DEF: to hold something carefully in your hands or arms close to your body
Sense.TRAN: 小心地捧[抱]着﹔爱惜地搂抱
Sense.EXAMPLE: a child nursing a kitten
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 怀抱着一只小猫的孩子

Sense.DEF: a woman employed to look after young children
a nurse who is trained to do some of the work that is usually done by a doctor
a place where young children are taken care of during the day while their parents are at work
a place where plants and trees are grown and sold
education etc for young children from three to five years old
Sense.TRAN: 幼儿园教育/幼儿园机构/幼儿园教师等

Sense.DEF: a room in a hospital where babies that have just been born are looked after
a baby’s bedroom or a room in a house where young children play
someone who grows plants and trees in a nursery
someone who has been trained to look after young children
a short traditional poem or song for children
a school for children who are between three and five years old
a slope that is not very steep, where people are taught to ski
Sense.TRAN: 〔供初学滑雪者使用的〕练习坡地

Sense.DEF: the job or skill of looking after people who are ill, injured, or old
Sense.TRAN: 护士[护理]工作﹔护士[护理]技巧
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’d love to go into nursing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我很乐意从事护理行业。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nursing profession
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 护理专业
Sense.EXAMPLE: psychiatric nursing
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 精神病人的护理

Sense.DEF: a place where people who are old and ill can live and be looked after
loving care and attention that you give to someone
to help a plan, idea, feeling etc to develop
Sense.TRAN: 发展〔计划﹑想法等〕﹔培养〔感情等〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: European union is an ideal that has been nurtured since the post-war years.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 建立欧盟是战后多年来人们一直争取实现的理想。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a hatred of foreigners nurtured by the media
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 由媒体助长的对外国人的仇恨

Sense.DEF: to feed and take care of a child or a plant while it is growing
Sense.EXAMPLE: plants nurtured in the greenhouse
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 在温室里培育的植物

Sense.DEF: the education and care that you are given as a child, and the way it affects your later development and attitudes
a dry brown fruit inside a hard shell, that grows on a tree
Sense.EXAMPLE: a pine nut
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 松子
Sense.EXAMPLE: roasted nuts
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烘坚果
Sense.EXAMPLE: We were sitting round the fire cracking nuts opening them.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我们围坐在火炉边夹碎坚果。

Sense.DEF: a small piece of metal with a hole through the middle which is screwed onto a bolt to fasten things together
Sense.EXAMPLE: Use a wrench to loosen the nut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 用活动扳手将螺帽拧松。

Sense.DEF: someone who is crazy or behaves strangely
Sense.EXAMPLE: My dad is such a nut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我爸就是这样一个怪人。
Sense.EXAMPLE: What are you, some kind of nut?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你是什么﹐是个疯子吗？

Sense.DEF: someone who is very interested in golf etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: You don’t have to be a sports nut to enjoy skiing.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 就算你不是运动迷﹐也会喜欢滑雪的。

Sense.DEF: a man’s testicles

Sense.LEXUNIT: the nuts and bolts of sth
Sense.DEF: the practical details of a subject or job
Sense.TRAN: 某事的基本[实质性]要点
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nuts and bolts of government
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 政治的基本内容

Sense.DEF: someone who is difficult to deal with
Sense.EXAMPLE: He may have softened a bit in his old age but he’s still a tough nut.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他年老之后可能变得温和了一些﹐但还是个刺头。

Sense.DEF: a difficult problem or situation
Sense.EXAMPLE: Celtic have lost only once this season and will be a tough nut to crack.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 凯尔特人队本赛季只输过一场﹐不好对付。

Sense.DEF: to be crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: You must be off your nut!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你一定是疯了！

Sense.DEF: to become very angry or worried
Sense.EXAMPLE: I didn’t get home till three - my mum did her nut!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我3点钟才到家﹐妈妈都担心坏了！

Sense.DEF: your head or brain

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Oh come on, use your nut!
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 好啦﹐动动脑筋吧！

PIC.HEADING: NUTS 坚果
PIC.PICCONTENT: cashew nuts 腰果；pistachios 开心果；walnuts 核桃；almonds 扁桃仁；pecans 山核桃；pine nuts 松子；hazelnuts 榛子；peanuts 花生；chestnuts 栗子；coconuts 椰子

Sense.DEF: to hit someone with your head
Sense.EXAMPLE: He just turned round and nutted me!
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他干脆转过身来用头撞我！

Sense.DEF: dark brown in colour
someone who behaves in a crazy way
Sense.EXAMPLE: He’s a complete nutcase.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 他是个十足的疯子。

Sense.DEF: a tool for cracking the shells of nuts
Sense.TRAN: 夹碎坚果的钳子﹐胡桃钳

Sense.DEF: a place that is loud, unpleasant, and not organized
Sense.EXAMPLE: I don’t want to spend another night in this nuthouse.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我可不想在这乱七八糟的地方再待一个晚上。

Sense.DEF: a psychiatric hospital
a crazy person
a brown powder made from the seed of a tropical tree, which is used as a spice
foods that are designed to improve health and lower the risk of disease, for example by increasing the amount of vitamins in them, or removing some of the fat
a chemical or food that provides what is needed for plants or animals to live and grow
Sense.EXAMPLE: The plant absorbs nutrients from the soil.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 植物从土壤中吸取养分。

Sense.DEF: the study of how different foods affect someone’s health by the way they react with that person’s genes, for example by making them more or less likely to get heart disease or other illnesses
a substance that gives plants and animals what they need in order to live and grow
the process of giving or getting the right type of food for good health and growth
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nutrition and exercise are essential to fitness and health.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养和运动是保持健康所必不可少的。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nutrition expert
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养专家

GramExa.EXAMPLE: Poor nutrition can cause heart disease in later life.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养不良可能会在晚年引发心脏病。

Sense.DEF: the science that deals with the effects of food, vitamins etc on people’s health
relating to the substances in food that help you to stay healthy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Cooking vegetables for too long lessens their nutritional value.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 烹饪蔬菜时间过长有损其营养价值。
Sense.EXAMPLE: the nutritional requirements of pregnant women
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 孕妇的营养需求
Sense.EXAMPLE: nutritional deficiencies
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 营养缺乏

Sense.DEF: someone who has a special knowledge of nutrition
food that is nutritious is full of the natural substances that your body needs to stay healthy or to grow properly
Sense.TRAN: 〔食物〕有营养的﹐滋养的﹐营养价值高的
Sense.EXAMPLE: Wholemeal bread is more nutritious than white bread.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 全麦面包比白面包更有营养。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nuts and fruit make nutritious snacks.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 坚果和水果是有营养价值的零食。
Sense.EXAMPLE: The cookbook contains many simple yet highly nutritious meals.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那本烹饪书里有许多简单却营养价值很高的食谱。

Sense.DEF: relating to nutrition
nutritious
Sense.TRAN: 有营养的﹐营养价值高的

Sense.DEF: crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: Are you nuts?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 你疯了吗？
Sense.EXAMPLE: I’m going to go nuts become crazy if I don’t find a new job soon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我要是不能很快找到新工作的话﹐就要发疯了。
Sense.EXAMPLE: Turn that radio off. It’s driving me nuts annoying me very much.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 把那收音机关掉﹐吵得我快发疯了。

Sense.DEF: spoken

Subsense.DEF: to become very excited because something good has just happened
Subsense.EXAMPLE: The crowd went nuts after the third touchdown.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 第三次触地得分后观众开始变得疯狂了。

Subsense.DEF: to become very angry about something
Subsense.EXAMPLE: Mom’s going to go nuts if you don’t clean this mess up.
Subsense.EXAMPLETRAN: 假如你不把这弄干净的话﹐妈妈会发火的。

Sense.DEF: to like someone or something very much
Sense.TRAN: 对某人/某事着迷﹔热衷于某人/某事
Sense.EXAMPLE: My wife is nuts about kids.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 我妻子非常喜欢孩子。

Sense.DEF: used to emphasize that something bad or annoying has happened
Sense.EXAMPLE: Nuts! Now we’re going to be late for the movie.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 哎呀！我们看电影要迟到了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are angrily refusing to listen to someone or do something
Sense.TRAN: 去你的﹔混蛋〔用于生气地拒绝听某人说话或做某事时〕
Sense.EXAMPLE: ‘Nuts to that,’ he sneered, and left.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: “去他的。”他冷笑一声走开了。

Sense.DEF: used when you are stating the main facts about something in a short clear way
Sense.TRAN: 一言以蔽之﹐简括地说﹐用一句话概括
Sense.EXAMPLE: Okay, that’s our proposal in a nutshell. Any questions?
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 好了﹐简单地说我们的提议就是这样﹐有什么问题吗？

Sense.DEF: the hard outer part of a nut
a crazy person
Sense.EXAMPLE: an absolute nutter
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 十足的疯子

Sense.DEF: crazy
Sense.EXAMPLE: It’s another of his nutty ideas.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这是他的又一个疯狂念头。
Sense.EXAMPLE: She’s nutty as a fruitcake completely crazy.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 她完全疯了。

Sense.DEF: tasting like, or containing, nuts
Sense.EXAMPLE: This coffee has a rich nutty flavour.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 这种咖啡带有浓浓的坚果味道。
Sense.EXAMPLE: a nutty cake
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 果仁蛋糕

Sense.DEF: to gently rub or press your nose or head against someone to show you like them
Sense.TRAN: 〔为表示喜爱〕用鼻子触碰﹔用头挨擦﹔把头紧挨在
Sense.EXAMPLE: Evan leaned forward and began nuzzling her shoulder.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 埃文靠过去蹭她的肩膀。

GramExa.EXAMPLE: The horses were nuzzling up against each other.
GramExa.EXAMPLETRAN: 马用鼻子相互蹭来蹭去。

Sense.DEF: an examination relating to the skills and knowledge involved in a particular type of work. NVQs are taken in Britain, usually by people who are already working.
Sense.TRAN: (英国)国家职业资格证书﹐国家职业资格认证
the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= northwest or 或 northwestern 西北(部)﹔(来自)西北的

Sense.DEF: used when you are talking about the word ‘nigger’ but do not want to say it because it is offensive
a strong artificial material that is used to make plastics, clothes, rope etc
Sense.EXAMPLE: nylon fabric
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 尼龙织物
Sense.EXAMPLE: The tent was made of nylon.
Sense.EXAMPLETRAN: 那顶帐篷是尼龙做的。

Sense.DEF: women’s stockings that are made of nylon
one of the spirits of nature who, according to ancient Greek and Roman stories, appeared as young girls living in trees, mountains, streams etc
Sense.TRAN: 〔古希腊和罗马神话中居于山林水泽中的〕仙女

Sense.DEF: a beautiful girl or young woman
a young girl who is very sexually attractive
a woman who wants to have sex often, usually with a lot of different men

Sense.TRAN: the written abbreviation of 书面缩写= New Zealand 新西兰
